Microsoft’s Cloud business is experiencing explosive growth, and the Capacity, Supply Chain & Provisioning (CSCP) organization is responsible for enabling the infrastructure underlying this growth. Our mission is to deliver the world’s computer with an industry-leading supply chain. CSCP is responsible for strategic sourcing, customer demand forecasting, capacity planning and management, supply chain planning and execution, capacity provisioning, and decommissioning and dispositioning of datacenter assets worldwide.
Welcome to CSCS – Cloud Supply Chain Sustainability. Our team is driving Microsoft's Cloud toward 90% reuse by 2025 and both Carbon Negative and Zero Waste by 2030 . We engage in solving complex problems, influencing hardware design, and innovating on supply chain solutions. Our culture is built around attributes that drive our every decision and our every action: Making a difference – creating a secure sustainable circular supply chain for all of Microsoft Azure cloud . Growth Mindset - we value all perspectives and reward individuals that poke at the edges of what they know to be true. We are seeking people that think differently and are biased toward action to accomplish great things. Diverse & Inclusive - we enable people who bring a contemporary view to shape our internal teams and encourage all to feel included. One Microsoft - we collaborate and value the work of others, combining their learnings with our own to make a better outcome for our customers.
As part of CSCS, the Circular Center (CC) Program Manager position is responsible for driving the Microsoft Circular Center program end to end from strategy and roadmap definition, through design, approval, build, operations and continuous improvement. The CC program manager will have to work closely with multiple partners in Engineering, Data Center management, Finance etc to gain alignment and successfully execute the program. They will have to demonstrate strong people and team management skills as in addition to a team of process engineers and program managers, they will have to also direct the activities of the various support and stakeholder teams. They will have to translate the output into sustainability terms such as waste or carbon emissions, so background knowledge of sustainability is required. Occasional regional and international travel will be required.
Responsibilities
Developing and ratifying strategies for the deployment and growth of Circular Centers
Ability to articulate the value proposition of new asks and work with Finance and business partners to gain approval.
Ensure that the Circular center can meet our throughput needs as the Microsoft cloud scales.
Hiring, training, onboarding and performance management of the CC business team.
Accountable for safety in operations and delivery/thoughput metrics and goals to maximize the output of the Circular Center.
Accountable for sustainability metrics of the Circular Center
Review and approval of OPEX and CAPEX budgets, spend, vendor resourcing models, and reconciliation of same
Identify opportunities to create strong visibility, proof points and storytelling of Microsoft's vision for Sustainability to drive innovation and engagement
Presenting status and strategies to senior management, internal and external
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
12+ years in program and operations management roles

Master’s degree in Engineering, with MBA preferred or equivalent
Preferred qualifications:
Understanding of and exposure to manufacturing management and driving continuous improvement
Knowledge of and exposure to sustainability science and directions
Previous experience working with suppliers, engineering teams to drive capability enhancements and improvement
Demonstrated ability to manage global, diverse teams to drive innovation and change
Demonstrated experience in managing and successfully executing large startup programs
Strong communication skills
Financial management experience and good business acumen
Strong ability to work independently and handle ambiguity
Strong leadership skills with the ability to provide vision and direction in an interrupt-driven, fast paced and diverse environment
Ability to effectively drive business and technical conversations with stakeholders, management, and engineering.
Approaches issues with a strategic, long-term mind set

Our mission is to deliver the world’s computer with an industry-leading supply chain. CSCP is responsible for strategic sourcing, customer demand forecasting, capacity planning and management, supply chain planning and execution, capacity provisioning, and decommissioning and dispositioning of datacenter assets worldwide.
Microsoft Cloud Supply Chain and Provisioning (CSCP) organization shoulders the critical responsibility of delivering to the cloud customer, across Microsoft, the promise of elasticity and scale at optimal cost and speed. For CSCP, this promise is architected on a mission of an integrated Capacity Planning, Supply Chain and Provisioning Organization that delivers capacity for all Cloud Services predictably, through intelligent systems. We are at the front of Microsoft’s cloud growth - forecasting, planning, and executing the end-end supply chain leading all the way to provisioning capacity to Microsoft’s datacenters as well as managing capacity to provide the best customer experience. We are looking for a software architect that can help define our overall software architecture, interaction between first- and third-party software, and a roadmap for a complex set of systems that help execute on our mission and enable true differentiation
Responsibilities
The role has scope for broad impact, but will require strong collaboration capability, and ability to influence across organizational lines. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with a demonstrated track record of providing technology vision and driving them through. The candidate would play a key role in helping the leadership team with technical strategy as well as guide technology investments in highly ambiguous and exploratory areas. The candidate will work with engineering leaders to build an end-end product architecture and drive consistency and simplifications to our product workflows. The candidate will not shy away from diving into individual problem areas and will guide the engineering team by making recommendations and best approaches. This candidate will directly report to the General Manager Engineering overseeing the architecture and vision for a geographically distributed team of 250+ engineers across all experience levels.

JobTitle: Sr Manager, Product Management Technical, Fashion Innovation
Content_text:
The ideal candidate will demonstrate a breadth and depth of knowledge in the following disciplines:

Bachelor's degree
8+ years of product management or related experience, preferably in the technology sector
Proven success in delivering technology products/services in a high growth environment
Demonstrated ability to decompose significantly complex technical propositions into straightforward solutions, and understand core technologies utilized in your product
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, complemented with the ability to problem solve independently
Ability to lead, influence and build partnerships technical and non-technical teams across different groups
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions
Willingness to challenge and influence big leaders
Ability to handle multiple, competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

Job summary
Through Virtual Try On we're creating fun, immersive try-on experiences so you know it fits and flatters before it ships, while transforming the Amazon shopping experience into a personalized journey of inspiration, discovery, and evaluation. Our VTO portfolio includes a host of cutting-edge projects including augmented reality and fit-accurate try-on experiences using a virtual avatar. In this role, you will be the single-threaded leader of a pillar of our VTO portfolio, owning the customer experience end-to-end. Come join us as we create the future of fashion.

What makes this job awesome: If you’re inspired by challenging the status quo in a startup environment and building entirely new customer experiences from the ground up, this position is for you. Leading a highly strategic and innovative product portfolio, you'll set a strong North Star vision and lead the development and execution of a technical roadmap that includes Machine Learning (ML), Computer Vision (CV), 3D visualization, and other emerging technologies. You'll interact regularly with senior leadership as you bring your vision to life. The successful candidate must be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with high attention to detail, and a proven ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

A day in the life
You will lead the team comprised of Product Managers, Technical Program Manager, and a Business Analyst that owns all workstreams that cross-cut the entire VTO portfolio (Augmented Reality, 2D, and 3D try-on experiences). This includes discovery and engagement, selection strategy, beta, and business insights. You will also own internal and external partnerships for VTO that help accelerate our roadmap. This role will play a critical leadership role on several marquee launches, with regular VP/SVP visibility.


MBA or Master's degree in computer science
Broad technical breadth and depth including familiarity with machine learning
Experience defining multi-year strategies and executing on associated roadmap, including leading engineering discussions around technology decisions
A deep understanding of software development in a team, and a proven track record of shipping software quickly then iterating on the experience
Full lifecycle product development experience (from vision to production)
Entrepreneurial instincts with a clear bias for informed action and a track record of leading new initiatives with limited resources and support

To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. Cloud Engineering Infrastructure Development:
The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) team can provide you the opportunity to build and operate a suite of massive scale, integrated cloud services in a broadly distributed, multi-tenant cloud environment. OCI is committed to providing the best in cloud products that meet the needs of our customers who are tackling some of the worldâ€™s biggest challenges.
We offer unique opportunities for smart, hands-on engineers with the expertise and passion to solve difficult problems in distributed highly available services and virtualized infrastructure. At every level, our engineers have a significant technical and business impact designing and building innovative new systems to power our customerâ€™s business critical applications.
Technical Operations and Support (TOS) Platform Engineering org is an exciting new group focused on the intersection of customer experience and support operations, and are leading the modernization and standardization of how OCI provides support to its customer. The objective is to empower customer to self-resolve issues, and when not possible then provide the fastest streamlined help in the industry. To support the vision, we are establishing the foundation using AI/ML to automate self-help-self-resolve, building a new unified support platform that manages end-to-end lifecycle of support request, and designing automation products that learns, evaluates, and provides path to resolution to service team engineers.
This is a brand new org, building brand new products ground up and approaching like a startup to delight our customer faster.
As a Senior Member on this Team, you will be driving the effort in designing, and delivering various platform components using latest technologies on OCI. You will partner with the architectures, learn about the existing challenges, and propose designs that influence the vision and direction. You will own the entire software lifecycle â€“ development, testing, CI/CD and production operations. You must balance between product feature development and production operational concerns like writing run books, ops automation, structured logging, instrumentation for metrics and events leveraging a plethora of internal tooling at OCI.
From a technology perspective, this is a greenfield development environment with a huge amount of autonomy, leaving us free to build and innovate without being encumbered by legacy products and services.
About You :
You are an experienced cloud engineer with a proven track record of delivering high-scale, high-impact solutions
You are obsessed with the customer, always exceeding expectations
You have excellent communication skills. You can clearly explain complex technical concepts
You are a disciplined engineer who understands the importance of high standards, never satisfied with mediocrity and constantly striving for excellence
You are comfortable with ambiguity in a chaotic and fluid environment
You are passionate about technology and are not afraid to defend your opinions or position with peers/superiors
Minimum Qualifications
4+ years of experience shipping scalable, cloud native distributed systems
BS in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
Ability to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment
Strong grasp of Computer Science concepts (data structures, algorithms, and programming paradigms)
Proficient in at Java/C++, Python and shell scripting tools
Experience with container orchestration like Kubernetes/Docker Swarm/Mesos, experience working on Helm Charts, etc.
Strong working experience on GitHub/Bitbucket, TeamCity/Hudson, Maven/Gradle
You are experienced at building highly available services, possessing knowledge of common service-oriented design patterns and service-to-service communication protocols
Experience with components of modern infrastructure like service discovery, secret storage, containerization, software-defined networking, etc.
Experience with production operations and best practices for putting quality code in production and troubleshoot issues when they arise
Able to effectively communicate technical ideas verbally and in writing (technical proposals, design specs, architecture diagrams and presentations)
Preferred Qualifications
MS in Computer Science
Experience in a fast-paced start-up environment
Experience building control plane/data plane solutions for cloud native companies
Experience in diagnosing, troubleshooting and resolving performance issues in complex environments
Deep understanding of Unix-like operating systems
Production experience with Cloud and ML technologies
Data science and machine learning knowledge would be helpful but not required


Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.

Duties and tasks are varied and complex needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty.


The Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) is an independent research center at the University of Washington. Its mission is to deliver to the world timely, relevant, and scientifically valid evidence to improve health policy and practice. IHME carries out its mission through a range of projects within different research areas including the Global Burden of Diseases, Injuries, and Risk Factors; Future Health Scenarios; Cost Effectiveness and Efficiency; Resource Tracking; and Impact Evaluations. Our vision is to provide policymakers, donors, and researchers with the highest-quality quantitative evidence base so all people live long lives in full health.


IHME is committed to providing the evidence base necessary to help solve the world’s most important health problems. This requires creativity and innovation, which are cultivated by an inclusive, diverse, and equitable environment that respects and appreciates differences, embraces collaboration, and invites the voices of all IHME team members.


IHME has an outstanding opportunity for a full-time Data Specialist to join the IHME Scientific Publications team. This position offers an opportunity to implement custom analyses, generate tables and figures, fact-check materials, and write custom code to facilitate number-plugging for capstone, country, and topic-specific papers. The Scientific Publications Data Specialist should have a command of a variety of research needs and analytic functions.


The Data Specialist must be able to independently translate requests into actionable results by writing and implementing novel code. The individual must be adept at navigating complex databases and analytic engines and troubleshooting problems in order to resolve them. They must be able to independently interpret results to assess their quality and must be able to assess, transform, and utilize a broad array of quantitative data using multiple coding languages (R, Python, SQL, Stata). Frequently the individual will be given assignments where a desired end result is identified but there is no preset path laid for achieving it. The individual therefore must carry out individual planning and problem solving to resolve computational questions and produce results.


This position will additionally work alongside other research staff on complementary projects and will require knowledge and skill sharing and collective problem solving. Overall, the Data Specialist will be a critical member of an agile, dynamic research team. This position is contingent on project funding availability.


Responsibilities:


Research command


Exhibit command of the dimensions and uses of health estimates and the analytic underpinnings of different research streams.

Understand the context of the estimates and ensure that they are relevant to the analyses themselves.


Data Analytics


Problem-solve computational and analytic challenges by investigating the estimates, understanding the root questions, and coming up with alternative measurement strategies.

Enhance and execute analytic engines, statistical models, and tools to carry out functions responsive to the analytic questions to be resolved.?

Execute queries and complete novel analytics.

Assess and lead decision-making about what type of coding language and approach to use in accomplishing computational tasks.

Develop novel representations of data and results.

Assess results and provide input on validity.

Create new code functions to add to a common code library to make common tasks more efficient.

Identify, design, and implement improvements to routine analyses, taking into account the relevant tradeoffs of different approaches.

Identify problems with datasets and computational processes, rectify issues, and systematize processes for future analyses.


Publication Development


Work closely with team members to design, adapt, and create tables, figures, and other visualizations.

Query appropriate databases and write custom code for number-plugging.

Fact-check publications against database records and for internal consistency.

Participate in manuscript development and design of analytical plans.

Collaborate with others at the Institute to develop and implement novel ways to automate publication tasks


General


Communicate clearly and effectively while contributing as a member of both the Institute and the University of Washington.

Work closely with other team members to assist with relevant tasks, facilitate learning new skills, and to help resolve emerging problems on different projects.

Serve as a resource to others in explaining analytic approaches, describing data, and instructing how to implement code. Develop and lead trainings for internal staff as well as external stakeholders.

Participate in overall community of the Institute, carrying out duties as required as team members with other Institute members.

Support general IHME projects, including but not limited to fulfilling requests from the Director’s Office and responding to media requests pertinent to specific publications.


Other duties as assigned.


As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For a complete description of our benefits for this position, please visit our website, click here.


REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree in social sciences, engineering, computer science, or related field plus four years’ related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.


Additional Requirements:

Demonstrated success in developing code in R or Python.

Interest in global health, population health, and/or ways in which quantitative research and data science can be used to create valuable global public goods.

Demonstrated self-motivation and evidence of self-direction. Agility with detailed information and data. Demonstrated flexibility and mature communication skills with an ability to thrive in a fast-paced, energetic, highly creative, and entrepreneurial environment.

Ability to learn new information quickly and to apply analytic skills to better understand complex information in a systematic way.

Strong quantitative aptitude and agility making sense of new data.

Demonstrated experience with one or more of the key research areas undertaken at IHME. Ability to explain the major tenets, principles, and purpose of a subset of the analytic work.

Experience interpreting results and creating effective visualizations.

Ability to compartmentalize, illustrate, and explain how code implements analytic strategies.


A commitment to working to alongside others at IHME to illuminate the health impacts of systemic racism and to work within IHME to make our organization more diverse and inclusive. See IHME’s DEI statement here: http://www.healthdata.org/get-involved/careers/dei.


Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


DESIRED

Demonstrated success in developing code in R and Python.

Functional ability to develop code in SQL or other coding language.

Weekend and evening work sometimes required.

This position is open to anyone authorized to work in the US. The UW is not able to sponsor visas for staff positions.

The University of Washington requires students and personnel to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Under state regulations, individuals who are not fully vaccinated are required to wear masks while in all UW buildings and facilities. Office is located in Seattle, Washington. This position is eligible to work fully remote in the US.

We're driving ongoing efforts as Amazon reorient its outbound fulfillment systems. Our fulfillment network is radically different from the one we had just five years ago. Today we rely on a greedy per-package cost optimization, which made sense when Amazon fulfilled exclusively via Third Party carriers. But now Amazon fulfills over 50% of units using First party assets from the FC to the customer address (Sort Centers, Middle Mile, Last Mile). With First Party fulfillment, the resources are procured well in advance of demand, and the cost of such resources is mostly sunk. To efficiently use First Party resources, we need to shift from optimizing on a per-package level to a new system that manages the flows in our network. The new system will eliminate manual inputs where possible and expose simpler levers that let us strike a balance between cost, speed, and risk. This space requires a high level of strategy, engagement, execution, and operations to evolve the fulfillment capabilities for the next decade and solve 21st century problem with a 21st century cutting edge technology. This initiative is fundamental to Amazon’s future, and will provide great personal satisfaction and career development as we tackle some of the most intriguing transportation problems.

We are looking for a highly motivated, top notch senior engineering leader with both business and technical acumen to drive this exciting innovation. You will own mission critical systems which model Amazon's transportation network and carrier capabilities/constraints and optimizes the transportation of every single Amazon package. These services improve customer experience by providing better promises and drive fulfillment planning and execution to lower transportation cost. These are highly available, low latency services that scale horizontally and are critical part of Amazon's ordering and fulfillment pipeline. You excel at leading developers and have a track record of building and growing strong engineering teams and fostering a culture of creative problem solving. You will have high standards for yourself and your team. You will drive engineering best practices and be constantly looking for ways to make the systems you own better. You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills, and can comfortably work with customers, technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe features and capabilities, product strategies, and influence technical decision-making.

Here is a brief teaser to what we do: https://bit.ly/3cRtCwr. If you enjoy dealing with high ambiguity, high complexity, and broad scope that will be at the epicenter of customer order fulfillment, come join us!

Job Description:
Ethicon is recruiting for a Principal Algorithms Engineer, Advanced Imaging and Visualization R&D, located in either Cincinnati, Ohio, Santa Clara, California. Open to any J&J location for candidate willing to travel 10-15% of time. Remote work options may be considered on a case-by-case basis and if approved by the Company
Ethicon, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, has made meaningful contributions to surgery for more than 60 years from building the first sutures, to revolutionizing surgery with minimally invasive procedures. Our continuing dedication to Shape the Future of Surgery is built on our dedication to help address the world's most pressing health care issues and improve and save more lives. Through Ethicon's surgical technologies and solutions including sutures, staplers, energy devices, trocars and hemostats and our dedication to treat serious medical conditions like obesity and cancer worldwide, we deliver innovation to make a life-changing impact. For more information, visit www.ethicon.com.
The Principal Algorithms Engineer is a key team member for our Advanced Imaging product pipeline, leading and conducting a wide range of assignments in collaboration with the team, in alignment with ongoing projects. This represents an excellent opportunity if you are excited by building transformational surgical imaging and visualization capabilities – Digital Surgery, and working in a cross-disciplinary environment.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, prototype, develop, and validate algorithms, software and image signal processing solutions for visualization and advanced imaging products and concepts in the domain of computer vision and machine perception technologies.
Collaborate with external technology companies to integrate advanced imaging technologies into proprietary visualization platforms, including NIR contrasting agents.
Build internal capabilities and full data analysis pipeline (data ingestion, curating, processing, results visualization and sharing)
Process, analyze and visualize complex data to generate useful information.
Apply machine learning, signal processing or mathematical models to data generated with the device in development, to improve data processing and achieve target metrics.
Work closely with Marketing, Preclinical and R&D teams to evaluate and identify meaningful metrics that directly translate to clinical performance
Rapidly iterate on cleaning and analyzing data, building and testing algorithms, execute detailed implementation, analysis and ultimately validation.
Partner with HW and SW teams to clinically validate algorithms intended use and performance requirements using disciplined scientific and statistical methods.
Contribute to the risk analysis of algorithm implementations in terms of the device performance and patient safety.
Participate in intellectual property reviews for algorithm development.
Provide technical leadership to project teams from feasibility to launch. Manage organizational and technical work you're doing to meet the goals of assigned projects.
Contribute to and own software deliverables, including requirements, design, implementation, testing and verification for algorithms.
Establish and maintain strong, productive relationships and collaborations across internal, external, and partner organizations.
Understand and follow J&J Quality Management Systems, Design Controls throughout the product development.

Qualifications

A minimum of a Ph.D. with 4+ years of experience, or M.S. with 7+ years of relevant experience is required.
Degree within Electrical, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Software Engineering, or related science/engineering degree, is required.
Experience with software and algorithms development in C++ is required.
Strong practical knowledge of Python, Matlab or other scripting language is preferred.
Experience with deep learning libraries (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) is required. Experience with computer vision tools (Open CV, MonAI, 3D Slicer) preferred.
Experience with AI/ML concepts (training, validation, test sets, cross validation, hyperparameter tuning, minimum sample size requirements) are required.
Experience with efficient/parallel implementation of AI/ML algorithms (e.g., using CUDA) is strongly preferred
Experience with annotation tools and ground truth generation methodologies is preferred
Experience with GPU hardware, cloud computing (AWS, GPC, Azure) and understanding of tradeoffs strongly preferred
Familiarity with medical devices, imaging technologies or visualization systems is required, experience desired.
Understanding of image sensors, computer vision/frame-based image processing, and electronic interfacing of image data streams desired.
Experience with camera and optical device testing preferred.
Passion for quality, exceptional attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to describe and document clearly.
Direct experience working across company and organizational boundaries, in many cases without direct authority, to build relationships, define mutual goals, and collaborate to meet objectives.
Business maturity – ability to work in ambiguity, organize and define work outside of direct technical expertise, exercise independent judgement, define and manage risk, and translate clinical finding to inform project plans.
Experience with building prototypes, products, and systems for testing; along with setting up and running laboratory simulations.
Good understand of design controls, industry standards and guidelines, and medical device software development; the ability to develop and execute design plans, design verification and validation.
Domestic and international travel of up to 20%, less during COVID-19

Summary:
The IT Technician provides support for Agency computer systems. Installs and maintains computer operating systems, hardware, peripherals, and software; provides support for telephone system administration. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, resourceful, possess strong self-awareness and relationship-building skills, and have a passion for making an impact in the community.
Essential Functions:
Regular attendance and punctuality are essential to our business and to this position.
Installs, configures and troubleshoots desktop, laptop hardware, and peripherals. Test’s configurations to confirm system operations.
Installs, troubleshoots, and supports operating systems, utilities, hardware, communications and software applications and tools.
Documents and responds to requests for service and reported problems.
Provides technical support to agency staff in a courteous and professional manner; assists, educates and supports the end user in terms understandable to users at all levels.
Diagnoses and resolves desktop computer problems, which include hardware, operating systems, software applications, memory management, printers and router/modem/VPN/Broadband firewall configurations.
Detects potential service problems and provides solutions related to agency specific hardware and software programs. Resolves network, system, and applications issues when possible. Refers escalated issues as appropriate to Senior System Administrator.
Manages time and priorities independently and communicates status of progress on assignments regularly.
Attends regular staff meetings, and other service training as necessary.
Provides evening and weekend technical support remotely and on-site on a rotating basis if needed not currently practiced.
Other duties as assigned.
Communicates respectfully with people of all cultures, languages, ages, genders, gender preferences, races, physical abilities, ethnic backgrounds, and religions.
Maintains a professional and positive working relationship with clients, vendors, volunteers, donors, and fellow staff and adheres to the Hopelink Standards of Conduct.
Required Qualifications:
Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, SharePoint, Teams, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint) Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Two years’ experience in hardware/software installation and configuration, Windows operating systems, PC and desktop troubleshooting and support in a medium to large (250+ workstations) environment including field support, or equivalent industry certification.
Competent with Microsoft Server basic system administrative tasks, i.e. creating user accounts and setting up email profiles.
Experience providing LAN and WAN support in a multi-site environment.
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office.

Employee must report to work site during their scheduled hours, regardless of weather conditions or other emergencies. Manage own transportation needs in adverse weather, including possible limitations to public transportation options.
Licenses, Certificates and other requirements:
Must pass criminal background check through the Washington State Patrol.

Job Description – Zones Cloud Product Specialist – LCS/SAM
The Zones Cloud Product Specialist (ZCPS) is a Champion of our Zones Cloud Platform plus a Subject Matter Expert (SME) of the Product Offers available within a Solution Environment.
For this role, the Solution Environment is Lifecycle Services and the product focus is on SAM and Zones Discovery Services (ZDS) subscriptions and associated services provided for Software and Cloud Asset Management, Security Assessments, and Cloud Workload Assessments provided through the use of the product.
A key objective of this role is to drive awareness and adoption of Zones Discovery Services subscriptions and associated services. In this role, you are an instrumental contributor supporting our Sales and Solution Architect (SA) teams (Pre-Sales) as well as delivery and support teams (Post-Sales).
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions:
Be the Subject Matter Expert on our Zones Discovery Services tools/technologies
Demonstrate business acumen and technical understanding of a client’s IT related business goals related to Software and Cloud Asset Management, Security, and Cloud Workload Planning and migration challenges to ensure proper translation of the client’s needs into technology solutions aligned with your focus area
Under minimal supervision, you will act as the SME to our Zones’ sales teams and to our clients and be responsible for the leadership and delivery of project-based assignments including ZDS design/architecture planning sessions, deployment and support of the ZDS product, managing associated proof-of-concepts, and assisting in the discovery of a client’s business goals to help identify opportunities where Zones Cloud Marketplace subscriptions and service offerings align
Assist with the translation of customer finding into product subscription proposals and help position professional services and/or Managed Services that are aligned with ZDS subscriptions
This role is a combination of pre-sales, customer setup and onboarding, solution delivery, and post-sales support aligned with our sales team’s consultative sales efforts
Provide a combination of Zones Cloud Platform demos and ZDS product demos
Assist in joint sales account planning, partner teaming (internal & external), sales engagements and solution development, and implementation follow-up and support
Support the technical relationship with sales in Zones Discovery Services (ZDS) customer accounts
Equip and train Zones internal teams on ZDS solutions and how to hunt for opportunities
Install, troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade ZDS deployments for customers
Support the preparation of RFP’s, sales proposals, statements of work (SOW’s) and subscription contracts
Ensure effective coordination and support between account teams and supporting ZDS technical resources
Ensure that when proposed solutions are implemented, they meet the needs and functional requirements of the customer
Keep project and activity reporting current based on use of defined tools and meet submitter deadlines
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
 
Education:
BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related field or equivalent experience
Certifications/Licenses/Etc.:
Any of the following are a plus: A+, Network +, Security, CISSP, Azure Cloud Specialist, AWS Cloud Specialist, SAM
Required Experience:
2+ years in a pre-sales technical role
5+ years of progressive, post baccalaureate work experience
Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills including demonstrated experience presenting technology recommendations from a business perspective
Understanding of the software and cloud technology industry, market, customers, competitors, suppliers, partners and capabilities of the business
Ability to communicate effectively with clients, colleagues and management
Professional, business-focused attitude and courteous manner towards clients, partners, and peers
Consultative problem solver ''Actively listens'' Understands the needs and business problems in order to uncover potential value points of offering
Can multi-task, prioritize, and juggle to serve multiple clients during same time frame
Demonstrates a high level of responsiveness to the customer to enlist trust and build credibility
Strong interpersonal, teaming, leadership, creativity, influencing, problem solving, and conflict resolution skills required
Ability to travel an average of 20%-30% of the time as needed
Technology Focus & Requirements
Zones Cloud Platform, Zones Discovery Services Tools/Platform
Ability to Assess, Architect, Design, and Implement Zones Discovery Services and Professional Services Solutions into Customer Environments Ranging from SMB to Enterprise Accounts
Core understanding of Software Asset Management, Contract Asset Management, Security, and Cloud Workloads

Job summary
Amazon delights millions of customers around the world. Meet the behind the scenes team that enables our People Experience Leaders to make informed decisions. The PeopleInsight team builds analytical products for our teams that fulfill customer promise every day. Our work directly impacts the People Experience Technology's team's mission to build the most scientific and desired people organization in the world.

This role will be pivotal to the delivery of global programs, products, and projects across a team of engineers, product, UX, and science professionals.

Key job responsibilities
As a Program Manager you will be a thought leader and collaborate with a team of Product Managers, Data Scientists, Business Intelligence Engineers, Software Development Engineers, and Data Engineers to develop, launch and scale our products and its features. You will drive multiple projects simultaneously, defining timelines and communicating on status, risks and process changes. You will need to thrive and deliver results in an ambiguous, fast-paced, dynamic business environment, operating at all levels of the organization. You should be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity and relish the idea of solving hard problems.

A day in the life
Success in this role will include creating processes, mechanisms, and tools that shape the delivery of multiple technical projects across the organization. You will manage ambiguity and competing priorities while staying focused on short term and long-term goals. You will need to earn trust through regular communication with senior management and stakeholders on status, risks and change control. You will own defining, measuring and tracking metrics for project success. You will be resourceful and find creative solutions to complex technical and business challenges.

About the team
We are an employee-obsessed team of engineers, technologists, product leaders, user experience experts, and scientists. Our mission is to enable creation of the world's most scientific and employee-obsessed organization.

CompanyName: VA Puget Sound Health Care System
Content_text: Research/Software Engineer – Image Processing and AnalysisThe Department of Mechanical Engineering at the University of Washington and the Center for Limb Loss and MoBility (CLiMB) at the VA Puget Sound Health Care System in Seattle, WA have an opening for a research/software engineer in the field of image processing and analysis. This position is available immediately and will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found.The successful candidate will be primarily involved in two projects: 1) further refinement and development of our in-house software for bone kinematic tracking from medical imaging and 2) the evaluation of bone morphology in subjects with arthritis of the great toe, including image analysis and algorithm development.This research is done in an engaging and supportive team environment of professionals who are motivated towards advancing healthcare through research. This position uniquely includes opportunities for career growth for candidates who fulfill the core programming background requirements even in the absence of any prior biomechanics or medical research experience, though applicants with biomechanics or medical research experience are also encouraged to apply. This should be considered an excellent opportunity for cross-training into the medical research and healthcare field. This position also offers opportunities (5-10% effort) for the successful candidate to have hands on involvement in device design & fabrication, human-subjects research and new project formulation as desired, for variety.Responsibilities:  1) Implementing new algorithms for visualizing and processing 3D data and assisting with data analysis and reporting. 2) Developing/designing stand-alone tools to assist in image measurement in clinical research. 3) Assisting in further development/optimization of software tools built in C++/CUDA/C#/Matlab. 4) Working with users to understand design requirements and incorporate user feedback into design revisions.Requirements: The successful candidate will have:Excellent problem-solving skillsExcellent command over C++ and C# (required)Proficiency in Matlab, CUDA, and C++/CLIExperience developing software through the full lifecycle, including defining project requirements, prototyping, testing, deployment, and maintenanceStrong competency in version control (Git, SVN, or similar)Strong competency with developing and managing software build process (CMake or similar)Strong competency in fundamental image techniques such as:o Image processing (convolution, dilation, correlation, etc…)o Development of feature detection and mapping algorithmso Shape analysis (statistical, principal component, and/or Procrustes)o Image manipulation in 3D environmentsFamiliarity with open-source computer vision/linear algebra libraries (OpenCV, Eigen)Relational database management (SQL)UI development experienceExcellent independence and self-sufficiency (candidate will become the subject matter expert on various facets of these projects)Strong oral and written communication skillsA bachelor’s degree in a relevant engineering or computer science discipline, with at least 2 years of work historyAdditional qualifications desired but not required: A Graduate degree in a relevant engineering or computer science disciplineMedical imaging experiencePlease note that this position is only open to U.S. citizens and individuals not requiring sponsorship to work in the US.Qualified applicants must submit a cover letter discussing the above qualifications (also briefly describing how this position supports their overall career trajectory) and curriculum vitae with contact information for 3 references.Job Type: Full-timePay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per yearBenefits:Health insurancePaid time offRetirement planSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayExperience:Advanced Image The Deep Learning Group at Microsoft Research Redmond advances the state of the art on deep learning and its applications to neuro-symbolic reasoning, software engineering, program synthesis, question answering, multi-modal intelligence, conversational AI, and natural language processing. We regularly publish in top-tier computer science venues and collaborate with Microsoft product groups including Office, Bing, Dynamics, and Visual Studio.
We seek exceptional researchers with a demonstrated ability for independent research and a strong record of influential publications on deep learning or its applications. An ideal candidate is passionate about the next generation of deep learning technologies and their real-world impact on computer vision, natural language processing, and multi-modality intelligence.
We are particularly interested in candidates who thrive in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment and can lead independent research in our areas of focus. Prospective candidates must have completed or be close to the completion of their PhD.
Responsibilities
As a researcher in Microsoft Research, you lead your own research agenda and collaborate with other researchers, engineers, and product groups. As a member of a word-class research organization, you are expected to aim for research breakthroughs in the field and will be given an opportunity to realize your ideas in products and services used worldwide.
Qualifications
Required qualifications:
PhD (completed or close to completion) in Computer Science or related field with a focus on Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or related areas.
Research ability demonstrated by a strong publication record of top-tier journal and conference publications or submitted/accepted papers in top venues.
Preferred qualifications:
Demonstrable ability to develop original research agendas.
Ability to work collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary team.
Active participation in the scientific community.
Strong communication skills.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Job Description
Nearly a year ago, we began our journey to transform our approach to data and analytics from a batch-centric platform with siloed data marts, to our Nordstrom Analytical Platform (NAP), a real-time, event-streaming-centric, analytical platform that provides high quality, pre-stitched 360 views of our customers, products, inventory, customer service, fulfilment/logistics, and credit. The Nordstrom data team designs, develops and maintains software applications and services that support all of Data Engineering and Analytics business needs to drive the Nordstrom Omni channel experiences. This opportunity also provides various avenues to collaborate and influence several other platforms within Nordstrom Technology and have a company-wide impact – both business and engineering. Data Analytics is a strategic focus area for the company. Over the next year we will be focused on data integration across all Nordstrom brands to create a holistic view of the customer & products, enabling us to personalize their experience and engagement with Nordstrom to reflect their unique preferences and style. Delivering real-time data will be central to ensuring that they receive only the most relevant information and have a seamless online and offline experience. A day in the life… Design and develop at the organization level event driven mico-services architecture for real time analytics. Design and develop at the organization level distributed data processing pipelines in the Big Data ecosystem using Spark, Flink, Kafka, Hive, Presto, etc. Lead projects across a global team. Drive key technical and design discussions with technical leads across the engineering organization Make sound technical decisions, influence priorities, and come up with tradeoffs that maps to short-term and long-term goals and objectives Champions new techniques and influence engineering standards across the organization Collaborate with technical program management, analytics, and marketing business partners to build scalable and durable solutions that drive business outcomes Build data products that reduce friction and time to delivery for Data Scientists and Analysts Design, communicate, and execute end-end solutions Continuously improve upon existing processes and solutions Ongoing production support of data products Serve as mentor to other engineers You own this if you have: 8+ years of professional experience 8+ years of experience in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Java, Scala) 8+ years of experience with MPP Databases, SQL, data modeling, data mining, and automated engineering solutions. Strive to deliver results, make quality technical decisions, manage complexity, and drive a vision while being customer focus. Experience with standard industry practices for engineering and operational excellence Experience with distributed systems (Spark, AWS EMR etc) Experience with Spring boot framework Experience with cloud environments (AWS or other equivalent cloud providers) Experience in developing near real-time data processing solutions using Kafka, Flink, Spark Streaming (preferred) Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience (Master’s preferred) This range may vary for candidates hired to work in locations other than Colorado. Minimum = $124,600/annually Maximum = $186,900/annually
We’ve got you covered…
Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:
Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability
Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources
A few more important points...
The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”.

Engineers have deep knowledge and hands-on experience in Point of Sale platforms and solve technical problems while working on technology initiatives. Engineers have strong architectural, leadership, and technical skills. They ensure delivery of high quality artifacts and adhere to and follow Costco’s SDLC. Engineers interact in a highly effective manner with other team members and management, drive innovation, and influence delivery and performance.

The Point of Sale Engineer will provide senior expertise and leadership for Costco’s Point of Sale environments. This position will focus on Point of Sale hardware, Operating systems, and custom applications. This includes technical knowledge of Point of Sale hardware, system configurations, and programming in order to develop and apply these solutions. This position is responsible for identifying tasks required to evaluate promising technologies and determine their applicability to Costco’s environments.
If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

ROLE

Escalates complex issues as needed, ensures timely recovery from outages, performs root cause analysis, and implements preventative measures.
Builds prototypes of potential features.
Runs proof of concepts and uses diagnostic/debugging skills to solve current challenges in multi-platform systems.
Integrates diverse solution components across multiple platforms using industry standard interfaces.
Tests and resolves problems, performs root cause analysis, identifies gaps, recommends solutions and preventative measures, and leads team members to solution delivery plans.
Creates conceptual and detailed technical design documents and standards.
Seeks opportunities to automate, document, share, educate, and improve processes where appropriate.
Addresses compliance requirements such as Payment Card Industry (PCI), Personally Identifiable Information (PII), and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX).
Enhances automation of applications, systems, and platforms and identifies opportunities for streamlining, and continuous process improvement.
Collaborates with system architects to plan, design, implement, and improve new capabilities, enhancements, solutions, and/or platforms.
Contributes, interprets, and communicates enterprise, technical, project, and operational strategies to the team.
Develops team vision to drive new capabilities against a published roadmap, in conjunction with management.
Ensures that proposed and existing systems are aligned with organizational standards, goals, and objectives.
Formulates and directs activities that align short term goals and long term initiatives while providing accurate and timely estimates (work breakdown schedules).
Works with teams, management, and stakeholders to conceptualize, design, build, test, and release products.
Influences and drives adoption of best practices and high quality standards throughout the division.
Promotes and supports a culture of compliance, risk avoidance/mitigation, and corporate accountability throughout the organization through technical leadership, knowledge of business need, development and communication of policies, procedures, and plans, and assurance of solution designs that are in compliance with architecture standards, technology guardrails, security, and operational guidelines.
Provides leadership/mentoring to team members, implements development efficiencies, creates appropriate documentation, drives operational efficiencies and technical growth within the team, and supports the release model.
Provides technical leadership in implementation of applications, strategic planning sessions, documentation of requirements, tool implementation, database query languages, and programming languages.
Uses subject matter expertise to support industry standard source control and source change management techniques.
Presents technical designs and solutions to executives, management, and other audiences to gain consensus and/or project approval.

REQUIRED

Minimum of 10 years’ Point of Sale experience.
Deep understanding of TCx Sky, 4690 OS, and Linux/Unix administration.
Minimum of 7 years’ of developing Java applications.
3-5 years’ python experience.
3-5 years’ Unix/Linux shell scripting experience.
Strong background in backend development and integration.
Strong knowledge of browser configuration and administration.
Strong knowledge of system security, certificate management, and operations.
Proven ability to plan, install, and integrate software packages (OEM, OS, etc.).
Excellent troubleshooting skills.
Proven ability to partner with others in the area or company to deliver quality solutions.
Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision.
Self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail-oriented.
Ability to easily adapt to a rapidly changing work environment.
Must have proven ability to set and follow priorities and timeline.
Excellent understanding of the challenges surrounding efficient operations and failure mode analysis in large complex distributed systems.
Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including 24x7x365 environment, on-call, and on-location as required.

Recommended
Knowledge of Costco’s Business and Point of Sale Operations.
Familiarity and/or experience with multiple Point of Sale solutions.
Advanced understanding of technical architecture principles and best-practices.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Sciences, Engineering, or equivalent work experience.

Required Documents

Cover Letter
Resume

REI is a different kind of company. As a co-op, we put purpose before profits and act in the long-term interests of our members. We believe time outside is fundamental to a life well lived, and as a member of the Digital Product team, you’ll contribute to REI’s mission to connect every person to the power of the outdoors and engage them in the fight to protect it.
Our product managers help drive our product vision and build experiences that are inspiring, inclusive, human, purposeful, and trustworthy.
The User Generated Content (UGC) Platform team is looking for a Product Manager. In this role, you will drive the product vision, roadmap, and discovery for a core piece of our customer's journey. This Agile team is accountable for building the back-end platform for ratings and reviews, questions and answers, and other customer content that has been submitted to REI and its vendors. This UGC service is available to all teams as they build front-end experiences for our customers.
As product manager, you’ll be working with solution architects, software engineers, UX/CX partners, researchers, analysts, and various stakeholders across the co-op. You'll be expected to own the product vision and clearly articulate the roadmap to team members and stakeholders.
Our product management community is a fast-paced, growing, and passionate group that is empowered to discover and deliver impactful solutions to our customers and drive the mission of the co-op.
Key Responsibilities include:
Articulating the product vision and clearly translating the vision into clear requirements for the roadmap.
Accountable for a component or set of components within the UGC platform with a well-understood customer base. Expected to deliver impactful data and services.
Responsible for building and operationalizing holistic solutions that meet the needs for multiple lines of businesses.
Using tools to conduct discovery with their product team, such as user surveys, data analytics, cohort analyses, and journey mapping.
Proactively assisting product team to recognize dependencies, remove barriers, and ensure smooth product delivery.
Anticipating and building out data and systems that support expanded capabilities.
Tracking the results of our experiments by using data to draw appropriate conclusions and leveraging those learnings to craft new tests.
Clearly tying prioritization methods to strategic objectives and broader co-op goals.
Utilizing various data analytic tools to gain deep insights about cohorts and usage behaviors.
Effectively communicating and aligning with multiple product teams and stakeholders to drive towards common goals.
Actively utilizing and improving product practices for the co-op.
Working with a cross functional product team to deliver solutions that create positive outcomes for our customers and business.
Leading your team through a process of discovering how to best solve for key opportunities. Encouraging and incorporating the feedback of key stakeholders.
Working with designers and architects/engineers to translate customer needs into a design and technical plan.

Bring your passion and expertise
Minimum Qualifications
2–4 years of experience managing technical platforms
Experience working collaboratively with software engineers, data analysts, and solution and domain architects
Experience designing and executing product discovery and product optimization for internal tools and users
Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing technology concepts, schedule trade-offs and new opportunities with technical team members
Fluency with API design principles, able to clearly communicate platform benefits from API design choices
Familiarity with fundamental concepts of Systems Thinking
Understanding of data value streams, and ability to identify data quality concerns
Experience in building and operationalizing holistic solutions that meet the needs for multiple lines of businesses
Proven track record of delivering impactful products or services to a broad customer base in an Agile environment
Proven ability to leverage data and insights to make informed product decisions
BA/BS or equivalent practical experience in computer science, engineering, or related disciplines
Preferred Skills
Experience with Grafana or similar analytics tools to derive insights and drive decisions
Strong understanding of product experimentation methods and experience with execution
Transferable Skills
Here at REI, we value the experience and perspective of candidates with non-traditional backgrounds. We encourage you to apply if you have transferable skills or related experiences.

JobTitle: Sr. Hardware Dev Manager, AWS Firmware/Hardware
Content_text:
Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with product definition, financial metrics and customer-facing experience
Experience managing cross-functional organizations and external design partners

·

10+ years of experience across hardware, firmware, and embedded software development across full product life cycles
5+ years of experience building and managing high performance platform and/or infrastructure engineering teams

Job summary
The AWS Server Hardware Engineering team is driving rapid innovation in the server systems used by Amazon Web Services. Our designs are fundamentally changing the data center, providing operational and financial benefits that are critical to the success of the AWS business and its millions of customers. We design and build devices and products used by AWS services such as EC2, EBS, S3, Glacier, and CloudFront. Our engineers solve challenging technology problems, and take big bets on new concepts, enabling AWS services to continue to revolutionize the industry.

The ideal candidate for this role will be a strong leader, comfortable managing in a hyper-growth environment with a high degree of ambiguity. You will be a seasoned general manager, leading a multi-disciplinary team to achieve AWS-wide outcomes. You will be an innovative, hands-on leader seasoned in building and leading teams developing components for the computing industry. You will be experienced with hardware, firmware, and software, as well as their combined architecture. You will have experience partnering with and improving your products for your customers. You will not be satisfied with the status quo and seek to innovate in the pursuit of better customer outcomes.

You and your team will identify and develop technologies for your customers ahead of when they are required. Your team will innovate, design, build, validate, and operate AWS server systems, and like products worldwide. Your team will engineer in diverse technology domains, including hardware, firmware, embedded software, large-scale distributed software systems, and Amazon services. You will establish the strategic vision, and drive tactical execution in defining and delivering your new products and services. Success in this role will be based on customer satisfaction, and the operational excellence that enables AWS to continue to expand its products and services for our customers.

Why it matters: Public cloud IT services represent the majority of growth in the overall IT services market and will continue to do so for several years to come. The scale of AWS, combined with an understanding of how our hardware is used, creates a unique opportunity for customization that will directly benefit our customers.

Why you will love it: This is a fast-paced, intellectually challenging position, and you’ll work with thought leaders in multiple technology areas. You will work with teams across the company to enable the rapid development of next-generation devices. You will have a direct impact on our bottom line and the ability to deliver improvements for our developers. You will lead part of a growing, fast paced, and fun team. You will have ownership for the implementation of your work. You will see direct product improvements based on the results of your work. Along the way, we guarantee that you’ll learn a ton, have fun and make a positive impact on millions of people. AWS Engineers are shaping the way people use computers.

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Object oriented development skills (Python, C or C++)
Relevant experience with component architecture including hardware, software, and firmware
Experience managing internal and external teams in the development and manufacturing of high run rate electronics
Knowledge and operational experience with server, storage, networking, and/or large-scale distributed systems
Expertise in server motherboard design, PCB design including schematic capture, stackup and circuit board layout.
Experience with the design and manufacturing of server, storage, and/or infrastructure products
DFx (Design for cost, test, manufacturing) expertise
Excellent written communication and verbal skills
Hands-on experience with Agile development methodologies
An understanding of AWS technologies (aws.amazon.com)
