A higher degree of healthcare.


All across UW Medicine, our employees collaborate to perform the highest quality work with integrity and compassion and to create a respectful, welcoming environment where every patient, family, student and colleague is valued and honored.


UW Medicine’s IT Services department has an outstanding opportunity for an Enterprise Information Security Manager to join the team!


UW Medicine’s Information Technology Services (ITS) department is a shared services organization that supports all of UW Medicine. UW Medicine is comprised of Harborview Medical Center (HMC), UW Medical Center-Montlake Campus (UWMC-Montlake), UW Medical Center-Northwest Campus (UWMC-NW), Valley Medical Center (VMC), UW Neighborhood Clinics (UWNC), UW Physicians (UWP), UW School of Medicine (SOM) and Airlift Northwest (ALNW). In addition, UW Medicine shares in the ownership and governance of Children’s University Medical Group and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (a partnership between UW Medicine, Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research and Seattle Children’s). ITS is responsible for the ongoing support and maintenance of the infrastructure and applications which support all of these institutions, along with the implementation of new services and applications that are used to support and further the UW Medicine mission.


In collaboration with UW Medicine IT Services (‘ITS’) and under the general guidance of the Director of Information Security Program, the primary focus of the Manager, Enterprise Information Security (‘Manager’) is to define, manage, and mature information security services, controls, reporting, and related activities. The Enterprise Information Security Manager provides management and technical leadership to matrixed resources and dedicated teams of Cybersecurity Analysts and Engineers across the enterprise, with a focus on ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information and systems.


Areas of responsibility include, but are not limited to:

Lead (direct incident response for all internal and external reports of information security events.

Provide forensic incident response services for all of UW Medicine and partner entities.

Facilitate enterprise compliance requirements through collaborative governance and consulting activities; address specific information assurance, risk management, and related compliance issues including management of enterprise policy/standards, information security risk assessment, and audits.

Grow and mentor a diverse team of professionals through responsible hiring, management, and development activities.

Manage 3rd party relationships and maintain an operational budget for information security vendors, tools, and services.

Manage, report on, and proactively mature a portfolio to include vulnerability management, threat assessment and management, awareness and training, risk management, and incident response/forensics.

Optimize new and existing resource opportunities for building and sustaining effective information security activities, including establishing and maintaining partnerships with key professionals.

The individual is expected to demonstrate comprehensive knowledge and experience with:

vulnerability assessment methodologies and related tools;

risk assessment methodologies and related tools;

digital forensic investigations using industry standard software tools;

technical implications of compromised systems and network services especially associated with potential information security breaches;

project management;

security awareness and training approaches and tools; and

metrics and reporting methods and KRIs/KPIs for operational, tactical, and strategic audiences.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Program Management and Operations (30%)

Implement, manage, and mature the information security program and service portfolio in accordance with UW Medicine’s information risk and asset protection needs, including risk management, governance, threat management, vulnerability management, awareness and training and incident response.

Direct information security projects, balancing internal and external dependencies and timelines to meet objectives.

Manage the remediation process, create reports, and provides oversight of IT Services efforts to address and mitigate risks.

Ensures that UW Medicine’s assets (i.e. business activities, key services, key people, business partners, applications, and data) are identified and reports on specific information security risks and threats related to the assets.

Collaborate with external stakeholders to facilitate access to relevant and timely information security threat information.

Monitor the broad "threat landscape" and experiences in the field for potential threat information relevant to the UW Medicine’s risk exposures.

Manage and ensure adequate institutional coverage for automated vulnerability scanning, customized vulnerability assessment, and penetration testing.

Directs the timely response and investigation efforts for security incidents, breaches, and forensics to meet all regulatory and business requirements and minimize their impact.

Cooperate with and assure the timely response to UW CISO and UW Medicine Compliance investigations of security incidents involving confidential electronic information.

Ensure that information security strategies and processes meet all regulatory and business requirements so that the impacts of incidents are minimized.

Develop procedures for incident response to meet regulatory needs. Manage and expand the digital forensic services.

Evaluate new tools and external services, recommends purchases and subscriptions, stays current on latest technologies, and collaborates with external subject matter experts on digital forensics methodologies and best practices.

Leadership and Strategy (25%)

Participate in groups and committees to represent risk and security both as an enterprise shared service and critical partner for other enterprise initiatives.

Serve as a liaison for healthcare IT risk and security with UW campuses, UW Medicine business stakeholders, research affiliates, Privacy, Compliance, and Audit groups.

Act as an expert resource for engineers and analysts working on complex technical issues spanning all ITS technologies.

Manage, monitor, and sustain vendor/supplier relationships and contracts for hardware, software, connectivity, and services relevant to the enterprise information security program.

Facilitate the development and execution of roadmaps for enterprise security services and distributed security architecture.

Conduct reporting to ensure visibility for leadership, institutional affiliates, stakeholders, and customers. Regularly review and evaluate data to provide awareness, analysis, planning, set service expectations, and improve performance.

Personnel Management (20%)

Lead, organize, and motivate multiple teams of information security professionals, including Leads, cybersecurity engineers and analysts (7-9 staff), matrix resources, and student workers.

Instill UW Medicine and ITS vision and guiding principles to all staff; implement mission-oriented HR practices.

Promote an environment that is attractive to the employee and that facilitates the recruitment and retention of professional, technical, and support staff. This includes, but is not limited to, staff development, recognition, motivation, and communications.

Make hiring decisions and recommendations for separations, reclassification recommendations, salary adjustment recommendations, handle complaints and grievances as well as generally planning, assigning, and approving the work of these positions.

Recruit, hire, train, coach, motivate, and manage performance of permanent, temporary, and contract staff.

Conduct performance evaluations and measuring on a regular basis, and other standard practices, consistent with all ITS teams.

Identifies and puts remediation plans in place to ensure optimal performance of staff and consultant resources.

Monitor resource requirements across operational and project activities and proactively adjust as appropriate and in alignment with UW Medicine priorities.

Creates processes and programs that encourage creativity, teamwork, collaboration, diversity, and value delivery.

Develop, mentor, and grow people, build skill sets, and establish career paths and succession plans.

Provide functional and technical expertise to staff.

Establish and enforce technical and functional standards.

Ensure compliance with security and confidentiality requirements.

Promote, monitor, and support UW Medicine HIPAA policy and procedures.

Support a framework to be the employer of choice.

Develop a service-oriented work force with exceptional technical talent, create plans for career progression and succession planning.

Ensure all employees understand the linkage to the mission and vision of UW Medicine and to the UW Medicine Patients Are First principles and adhere to the professional conduct policy of UW Medicine.

Develop the necessary staff to implement, enhance, and support ITS goals, projects, and programs.

Foster staff engagement.

Governance and Communications (10%)

Facilitate development, publication, and maintenance of UW Medicine information security standards and policies.

Provide audit strategy, response management, and ongoing guidance on solutions to achieve and maintain security compliance, to mitigate information security risks and to correct compliance exposures and gaps.

Perform and manage any IT-specific activities or remediation required to meet applicable federal and state regulations.

Partner with UW Medicine Compliance, UW CISO and UW Medicine IT units in assessing education and outreach needs, developing related strategies, developing training content, and participating in outreach activities.

Budget Management (10%)

Manage operational, capital, and project budgets including FTE, software licensing, vendor contracts, and other expenditures.

Participate in and provide advice for annual budget development process and major purchase planning.

Routinely monitor actual expenditures against budgets to ensure alignment with IT Services accounting standards.

Other (5%)

Participate in all aspects of improving the team, including education/training of other team members, and contributing to process/communication improvement initiatives.

Work with manager to set professional goals for career development.

Act as back-up for other team members and functions, as needed.

Perform other duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field or equivalent combination of education/experience.

Current industry recognized security certification (e.g., CISSP, GIAC, CISM, CISA, CEH).

8+ years technology experience must include:

8+ years' progressive technology, security, and professional services experience to include one or more of the following: risk management, incident response, threat management, vulnerability management, governance, audit, and computer forensics.

4+ years’ experience managing, coaching, and developing high performing teams of security professionals in complex environments to meet operations, enterprise, and strategic objectives.

Demonstrated management and leadership capabilities with proven ability to influence in matrix environment.

Proven ability to make administrative/procedural decisions and provide guidance and leadership to staff.

Extensive experience and background with on-premise and cloud technology, operating systems, and applications, preferably including clinical and healthcare solutions.

Extensive experience with project and program management in technical environments with diverse stakeholder groups.

Expert experience conducting information security risk assessment, control analysis, and vulnerability assessments.

Demonstrated work experience conducting investigations and managing information security incidents.

Expert understanding of information security threat modeling and vulnerabilities in large scale business technology environments

Expert understanding of and experience with security related technologies, systems, and tools.

DESIRED

Previous experience in and knowledge of academic healthcare systems and/or operational environments.

Advanced degree (e.g., Master’s, PhD, etc.).

Demonstrated work experience in digital forensics analysis and/or threat intelligence using a variety of open source or commercial tools.

Curiosity and ability to write in at least one programming language and effectively code in a scripting language.

Working knowledge of security tools and best practices with large cloud providers

IAM experience with common vendors and tools.

Familiarity with IAM authentication and authorization concepts, services, and best practices.

ITIL and PMP knowledge or certification.

Our Opportunity:

Chewy is looking to hire a Senior Software Engineer based in Bellevue, WA. You will be a part of the Platform Engineering Tools team that builds tools and processes supporting our microservices platform, increasing productivity and efficiency across the software organization by improving our developer experience. This team aims to build tools, systems, and services that minimize engineering costs with security, quality, and scale as key pillars and accelerate development activities to keep pace with our rapidly growing teams across the Engineering organization.

This role is a high-profile position that will have exposure across the entire business, influencing the vision and implementation of architecture, design, and features. You will directly engage with engineering teams that rely on our team's tools and application templates, work with our users to identify gaps in our product offerings, and then own the implementation strategy from measurement to delivery. We support and encourage experimentation and innovation with new technologies that contribute to solving problems at scale. Your expertise in these areas will directly influence team strategy and contribute to the defining of the technology landscape for Chewy. This role offers an excellent opportunity for professional growth and has tremendous visibility in the technology & business organization of Chewy. This role will allow you to act as an individual contributor as part of a team of strong engineers building Tools and Services for Chewy's Tooling Platform.

What You'll Do:

Design, build, and maintain tooling, frameworks, and infrastructure to abstract complexity and improve standardization of existing and new processes, keeping pace with evolving technologies and user needs
You will be responsible for the design, development, delivery, and support of large-scale, distributed software and tools
Work in an agile development environment, collaborating with Application Development and Architecture teams
Provide technical guidance to your team to build quality software
Bring industry best practices in terms of technology and process
Drive innovation through rapid prototyping and iterative development
Set engineering excellence to the team and have the drive to focus on scalability, resiliency, high availability & performance of applications
Hire, educate, mentor, and help peers and contribute to the open-source engineering community.
Collaborate with key stakeholders and service providers to pursue use cases and assist in ensuring our internal customers' knowledge of our technology remains ahead of the curve.

What You'll Need:

7+ years of experience as a software engineer
Strong knowledge and proven expertise with at least one modern programming language such as Python or Golang
Clear understanding of emerging technologies and ability to apply those principles in solving critical business needs
Be a Hands-on Engineer who will spend a significant percentage of their time writing code, creating a Framework structure for the team
Experience with designing, building, and deploying scalable, highly available systems
Strong background with modern tools and environments
Working Experience with distributed SCM (GitHub a plus), DevOps, AWS
Experience working across fully automated stacks in a CI/CD ecosystem
BS degree in Computer Science, a similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience

Bonus:

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Experience with Github and AWS or other Cloud technologies
Experience building applications using AWS services
Working knowledge on React Framework
Experience in API development or engineering at scale
Ecommerce experience

Are you tired of working on projects that aren't interesting? Is your current job a "J.O.B." and not something that excites you? Are you motivated to learn, but stuck doing something that is beneath you? Want to work on cool projects that span all those crazy buzz words that you hear about on TechCrunch, Mashable, Geekwire, and/or Technology Review? Sound interesting? If so, read on!

We are a startup in Seattle's Belltown area that is solving bleeding-edge problems that span scalable web service interface design, creation of compelling user experiences on mobile devices, IoT, Augmented Reality, POS commerce, location-based services, and gamification design. We publish our own products, while also have a long list of clients that use our services. We are a cross-functional team, we choose our projects carefully, and all employees are given a say in the direction of the company, while also being given free time to pursue projects of their own that fit the vision and mission of the company.

If this sounds interesting and motivates you, we want to hear form you now!

4 years professional experience in software development

Description
You are an inspiring strategic leader who is passionate about technology, knows how to define and deliver shared goals with cross functional teams, thrives on complex challenges, and juggles priorities with ease. You love to collaborate, build relationships and partner with people across the organization. You are a curious, determined solution-finder who is motivated to achieve excellence.
We are a fun, fast-moving team responsible for helping Weyerhaeuser achieve its vision through developing and implementing technical solutions that align with strategic goals and objectives. We also focus on continuous improvement, fostering innovation, continuous learning, and developing people to their full potential.
In this role, you will own and manage multiple IT projects simultaneously for our Wood Products business as a member of the IT Portfolio Management Office (PMO). You will manage the strategy, planning, budget development, and execution of projects in alignment with the Wood Products IT investment roadmap. We are moving fast, using the latest technologies, and transforming the way we leverage technology at Weyerhaeuser. If you are looking for a place to make a difference, this is it.
Responsibilities
Responsible for leading multiple IT projects simultaneously and ensuring delivery of expected results.
Manage project intake, prioritization, estimation, resources, goals, scope, schedule, and budget. Provide project status, budget tracking, and reporting. Propose alternative methods for achieving goals when necessary.
Independently lead projects requiring high levels of functional integration and involving multiple disciplines.
Perform project financial tracking and analysis and contribute to the annual IT budgeting process.
Facilitate discussions and negotiations.
Create and help execute comprehensive change management strategies and communication plans relative to project scope and stakeholders; orchestrate and lead change management plans.
Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the team's ability to meet project or objectives.
Consult with IT managers and project managers and serve as a focal point for collecting and sharing project management best practices.
Responsible for continuous improvement of project management competencies and provide training on specific project management processes and techniques.
Qualifications
Education
Bachelor's degree in management information systems, business administration, computer science or relevant field is preferred.
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification a plus.

Experience
Minimum of six (6) years of progressive, relevant information technology project management experience is required.
Deep experience and proficiency leading medium to large sized complex IT projects from start to finish.
Experience with manufacturing business process, ERP and Supply Chain projects.

Qualifications
Demonstrates the important leadership and interpersonal skills required to effectively bring a team together to achieve a common goal.
Proven experience in delivering successful projects, a strong sense of ownership, and a passion for defining and driving large cross-functional project teams.
Extensive experience defining project scope, developing detailed project plans, and facilitating the collection of engineering, operational, and business requirements. Establish goals and set clear expectations, prioritize activities, and follow through to completion.
Proven ability to effectively present and communicate status, issues, and risks clearly, concisely, and regularly to all project stakeholders and various levels of leadership.
Highly skilled at breaking down complex problems with simplicity while understanding interdependencies and cross team impacts.
Can think long-term, balance conflicting interests, and converge on outcomes that earn trust.
Builds an effective and productive working relationship with team members, customers, and vendors while effectively implementing IT solutions.
Outstanding customer service skills including working effectively and collaboratively with all levels of the organization to provide highly effective technical solutions.
Proficient at conflict resolution, time management, process and data analysis, cost/benefit analysis, and risk management.
Proven ability to operate and effectively communicate while under pressure; as well as the ability to manage a diverse workload and work under time constraints with minimal supervision
Experienced in using Waterfall and Agile methodologies. Able to select the appropriate methodology to meet project objectives.
Skilled in training and guiding others in various project management techniques and methods.

Company Description
About Radiant
Radiant Vision Systems provides automated visual inspection products to ensure the manufacturing quality of displays, lighting, assemblies, and surfaces. Radiant’s photometric and colorimetric imagers are calibrated to human visual perception of light and color, offering the most sophisticated inspection technology for meeting customer expectations for performance in high-value devices. Leading brands in electronics, virtual & augmented reality, automotive, aerospace, and beyond rely on Radiant to ensure accuracy, automate quality control, reduce costs, and improve efficiency from the lab to the production line. Based in Redmond, WA, USA, Radiant Vision Systems has proven production experience with thousands of cameras testing millions of components. The company's extensive product portfolio includes TrueTest™ Automated Visual Inspection Software, ProMetric® Imaging Colorimeters and Photometers, machine vision solutions, and goniometric systems.

Job Description
The IT Manager is an individual contributor responsible for organizing, planning, managing, and controlling all the Company’s information systems, including business systems and programming, computer, internet, and network operations, phone operations and related vendor relationships. In this position, you become the IT expert with in-depth understanding of our systems and how they speak to each other. You will work to build the IT function where necessary and make recommendations on what resources may be required. Responsible for best practices, user training, and champion for continual improvement for our IT infrastructure, this position offers an opportunity to make a significant impact on the organization.
As a hands-on technical expert, you will be involved in recommending technological innovations and implementation of the Company’s IT strategic plan. Working with departments across the organization to identify business requirements, you will directly install, modify, enhance, and customize operating systems, process development and execution, including participating in budget planning and coordination. You will also manage the technical support of the Company’s computer platforms, including building, supporting, and continuously improving the company’s ERP and CRM infrastructure.

Qualifications

Perform IT day-to-day support along with management of outside IT services company.
Responsible for purchase recommendations of both hardware and software assets as needs arise across the company.
Recommend implementation of cost effective and efficient systems and computer operations designed to meet current and future business needs.
Assist with long- and short-term IT planning. Develop and propose a total strategy and direction for the Company’s electronic processing functions in collaboration with Senior Management.
In collaboration with Senior Management, develop and implement operational plans, policies, and goals which further strategic objectives.
Under the direction of Senior Management, manage to budget for system hardware and software, hardware maintenance, and technical support education and training.
Analyze business functions and management information needs; seek and propose new system solutions.
Responsible for IT security controls as well as incident reporting to management and appropriate parties. Ensure IT systems are secure, properly backed-up, and appropriately documented.
Ensure equipment, peripheral devices, and software are set up and operated in accordance with prescribed instructions. Research and recommend equipment, software, and system updates.
Ensure system operations are performed in accordance with established standards, policies, and procedures. Continually evaluate established policies and procedures and recommend updates or modifications, as necessary.
Propose, plan, document, and implement a business recovery strategy to resume operations of computer platforms in the event of a disaster or similar contingency. Execute on established goals and ensure corporate-wide goals are complemented and reported to Senior Management.
Provide leadership to external IT services company and department cross-collaborators through effective goal setting, delegation, and communication. Direct, schedule, and coordinate IT functions ensuring optimal performance.
Assume responsibility for ensuring professional business relations are established and maintained with clients, vendors, trade professionals, etc.
Maintain and improve required processes and procedures to comply with customer confidential information policies. Ensure the Company’s professional reputation and appropriate levels of confidentiality are maintained.
Function as a consultant and resource to users. Advise and assist Department Managers with their IT service needs. Ensure program recommendations comply with Company budget guidelines and, if approved, meet users’ requirements and are completed on schedule.
Assist, support, and train company-wide users as required. Ensure questions and concerns are promptly and courteously resolved.
Keep Senior Management informed of progress toward established objectives, and of any significant problems. Complete special Information Technology projects and research studies as required.
Work with stakeholders to develop and execute on strategic initiatives around the CRM and ERP systems.
Be involved with the implementation of new modules for CRM such as marketing automation, quality, and support initiatives.
Recommend and support IT and technology initiatives for US and Asia, including development and management of IT policy documentation and updates.
Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience
5-7 years’ experience in IT, with 2 years’ managing IT function as an individual contributor
Experience managing IT Support vendor required
CRM development and management experience, preferably Microsoft Dynamic useful but not necessary
ERP development experience ideal, preferably Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains
Experience with SQL platforms is a plus, but not required
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in requirements gathering and development
Strong experience with systems analysis and functional design is desired, but not required
Knowledge of computer and telecommunications equipment
Understanding of Company operations and information needs
Advanced analytical/technical knowledge pertaining to decision analysis
Exposure to planning and experience managing to budget
Excellent interpersonal and supervisory skills
Solid project management, problem-solving and analytical skills
Creative and initiative-taking, with a proven track record of success – both as an individual contributor and as a team member
Proven ability to effectively support vendor management and potential employee as IT needs grow

Additional Information
Apply Today! https://careers-radiantvisionsystems.icims.com/jobs/1180/it-manager/job

JobTitle: Director, Sales Readiness for Business Application Solutions
Content_text:
Microsoft is delivering the next generation of intelligent business applications that enables organizations to grow, evolve and transform to meet the needs of their customers and capture new opportunities. In this data-first world, Microsoft Business Applications is built ground up with data and intelligence at the center. Trusted by global businesses as their platform of choice and recognized by analysts as a leader, Microsoft Business Applications uniquely enables customers to optimize their operations, engage their customers, empower their people and transform their products. Are you interested in playing a pivotal role in accelerating Microsoft’s ability to help customers realize their digital transformation? The WW Business Applications Readiness team is the place for you.
The WW Business Applications (Biz Apps) Readiness team is part of the Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions organization (MCAPS) and has the charter to build capability in our global field sales to drive market share in Business Applications. This team is responsible for strategizing and delivering readiness plans that help Business Applications sellers world-wide to effectively engage customer Business Development Managers (BDMs) on business process transformation and help achieve their goals. Seller readiness is a key growth lever for Microsoft in this business category. Employee skilling in key sales transformation areas like business value selling, industry solutions, differentiated use cases and technical intensity are critical for mid- and long-term business success.
The Director of WW Biz Apps Sales Readiness will lead a large team of experienced and talented individuals who not only shape world class readiness programs for Microsoft Biz Apps sales & pre-sales teams, but also deliver training events that both build tech intensity as well as drive customer obsession by leading business value from their investment in Microsoft Business Applications.
As the manager overseeing the Business Applications Sales Readiness team, you will be responsible for onboarding new hires and ongoing skilling of existing sales talent. You will lead a team of individuals who are subject matter experts in various Microsoft Business Applications workloads, readiness operations as well as strategic topics of industry and business value management. Your team’s strategies, execution rigor and readiness delivery quality will enable a massive sales team spanning field sellers, and digital sellers across 60+ countries. You will ready the sellers to envision business process transformation, be confident BDM conversationalists, bring industry relevance, have technical intensity and leverage One Microsoft portfolio differentiation.
Responsibilities
Be a strong people leader who brings vision, and exhibits stellar model, coach and care traits in managing a high performing team
Build a strategic readiness plan for both onboarding new hires as well as keeping existing talent current; plan should accelerate capability building in key sales transformation areas like business value selling, industry solutions, differentiated use cases and technical intensity
Ensure quality delivery of all readiness courses and sessions
Strategize ongoing readiness refreshes to keep up with product innovation, customer needs and market/competitive developments
Optimize readiness hours required of every seller for best experience and highest value
Lead seller evangelism of readiness plan and drive uptake/adoption
Partner closely with Worldwide Learning, Product Marketing, Engineering, Field teams etc. in building, operationalizing, and delivering readiness plans.
Qualifications
12+ years of technology industry experience in sales, sales readiness, sales operations, sales training, or consulting services
5+ years of sales/sales operations leadership experience
Successfully created and implemented a change management plan resulting in organizational process change
Deep understanding of Cloud apps and services – specifically experience with Business Applications such as Customer Relationship Management (CRM) or Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) technologies
Competitive knowledge of Salesforce, ClickSoftware, SAP, Oracle TOA etc.
Ability to drive cross-team collaboration with diverse groups in a cross functional organization
Top-tier problem-solving skills with the ability to achieve results despite ambiguity, and ability to think strategically about technology and its business implications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field required. A master’s degree is preferred but not required.
LOCATION: Redmond, WA preferred (relocation assistance available), but open to remote candidates in the United States willing to accomodate Pacific Timezone hours.
__
The salary for this role in the state of Colorado is between $157,300 and $236,300.
At Microsoft, certain roles are eligible for additional rewards, including annual bonus and stock. These awards are allocated based on individual performance. In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee’s role.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed here may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.US-based employees gain access to healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan and company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, and fitness benefits, among others.

Principal Product Manager, Data Quality, Governance, and Tools
Locations: SF, SEA, STL, CHI
The Climate Corporation is revolutionizing the agriculture industry with its Digital Farming Platform and products that help the world’s farmers sustainably increase their productivity with digital tools. We have a unique opportunity for a global product lead to join our team to help create the world’s largest digital agriculture platform and ecosystem to bring new innovation and product offerings to farmers and enterprises.
Profound meaning in your work:
If you are looking for meaning and impact by solving a problem which will affect generations to come — we need your passion and grit. We have only begun to scratch the surface of how we can use Science, Technology, Data and Design to modernize farming. You will be at the forefront of an industry which affects every human on earth.
Your Seat at the Table:
Data quality and governance is at the core of all our Climate products and platform. It is the most critical component to build trust in our data and make it usable for all customers, partners and internal stakeholders.
We are looking for a highly analytical and data driven Principal Product Manager who will be a critical part of The Climate Corporation’s Product team. This product leader will own the vision, strategy and roadmap for for data quality and governance tools and services, including master data management.
In this role, you will drive a close partnership with our enterprise-wide data quality and governance teams and develop and implement frameworks, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organizational policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools, architecture and data stewardship programs.
This is a hands-on position that will require you to roll up your sleeves to get things done. Having a general manager / owner mentality, an entrepreneurial drive, and a demonstrated ability to have fun and inspire teams will be beneficial to this role.
Your Impact:
Build future state data quality and governance strategy, roadmaps, and recommendations for Climate business data management
Conduct data management maturity assessments and identify pain points for capabilities, e.g. data quality, governance, meta-data and reference data management, master data management.
Work closely with Data Scientists, Science teams and other teams to create data quality metrics and help build those into products
Enable data quality reporting, issue identification, remediation and tracking, ultimately ensuring trust and confidence in data across domains
In partnership with our enterprise quality and governance teams,

help implement defined governance roles and responsibilities required to operate and sustain the enterprise data ecosystem
help define and implement operating models for data quality and governance in our infrastructure and application environments
help programmatically enforce established data standards, policies and controls; design and implement the framework, including associated processes and monitoring, necessary to sustain a data control environment
assess the implications and prescribe best practices that arise from legal, privacy, contractual, and compliance obligations
collect, synthesize and publish meta-data as defined by project scopes, include business terms and vocabulary, data dictionaries and lineage, taxonomy and topology, etc.
develop and implement tools to implement business oversight via essential data governance organizations and data stewardship programs
Basic Qualifications:
8+ years of data management related experience such as data analysis, data governance, enterprise information management, data modelling, and data quality management
Experience as a technical product manager, program manager or similar technology background.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, science and/or business or equivalent experience, an advanced degree is a plus (e.g., MSc., MBA)
Knowledge of digital space with the ability to support change in complex organizations
Bring a general manager mindset, analytical problem solving skills, ability to simplify complex problems, prioritize based on trade-offs and drive decisions and actions
Experience leading highly complex initiative(s) that works across multiple business units
Ability to keep a pulse on risks and headwinds that can come up in an evolving environment.
Ability to understand market needs, product priorities, and ecosystem capabilities
Genuine empathy toward customers and commitment to diving into the weeds on their challenges
Ability to identify and decompose customer problems, use cases and business needs into actionable tasks/stories and track to delivery
Ability to drive roadmap and projects autonomously
Excellent team- and relationship-building abilities, with both internal and external parties (engineers, data scientists, business partners, legal, privacy, security, etc.)
Strong leadership skills, including the ability to influence cross-functional teams via diplomacy and tact
Experience working with engineering to deliver a product into market
Strong technical aptitude - no coding experience required, but understanding of technology stack is critical to success
Ability to work well under pressure, multitask, and maintain a keen attention to detail
Natural tendency to be positive, creative, curious and learn quickly
Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years of data quality, governance and tools experiences
Experience in data systems, infrastructure, security, privacy or related fields
Experience designing and executing software development lifecycle tools and processes
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an ability to summarize complex technical programs into a broader compelling narrative
Experience in and passion for agriculture is a plus
What We Offer:
Our teams are composed of industry experts, top scientists, and talented engineers. The environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with dozens of specialties coming together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers. We provide competitive salaries and some of the best perks in the industry, including:
Superb medical, dental, vision, life, disability benefits, and a 401k matching program
A stocked kitchen with a large assortment of snacks & drinks to get you through the day
Encouragement to get out of the office and into the field with agents and farmers to see first-hand how our products are being used
We take part and offer various workshops, conferences, meet-up groups, tech-talks, and hackathons to encourage participation and growth in both community involvement and career development
We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:
Inspire one another
Innovate in all we do
Leave a mark on the world
Find the possible in the impossible
Be direct and transparent
Learn more about our team and our mission:
The Climate Corporation - The Technology Behind Making A Difference
https://youtu.be/c5TgbpE9UBI or visit https://climate.com/careers
Climate aims to create a welcoming and collaborative environment for our employees in which a diverse set of perspectives and voices are represented and celebrated.
As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, The Climate Corporation is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, sex (including pregnancy), protected veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any unlawful criterion existing under applicable federal, state, or local laws. #LI-BD1

The industry of structured cabling uses many names to describe this position: Low Voltage Technician, Low Voltage Electrician, Structured Cabling Technician, Network Cabling Technician, Cabling and Infrastructure Technician, Field Service Engineer. But here at Fidelis, we settled on Network Cabling Installer because it matches the most commonly used customer understanding of what the position does every day installing networks spanning Information Communications Technology (ICT) that serve a wide range of uses: computer, mobile device, wireless access point, phone, camera.

General Accountabilities
Network Cabling - Horizontal Cabling, Data Cabling, Voice Cabling, Category Cabling (CAT6, CAT6a, CAT8…), Coax Cabling
Backbone Cabling – Multi-Mode Fiber and Multi-Pair Category Cabling
Pathways – Cable support systems
Spaces – Data Centers, Server Room, Computer Room, Equipment Rooms (ER), Telecommunications Rooms (TR), Data Racks and Enclosures, MDFs…
Audio & Video (AV) – Conference and meeting spaces
Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS)
Wireless Network Installation
Data renewal projects – reorganize and clean up an existing data room.
Cable removal and wreck out
Certification and Testing
Requirements
Must have personal, reliable transportation and driver’s license, as this position requires both working at the Fidelis office as well as onsite support at customer locations throughout the Puget Sound region
Physical office is located on 580 Industry Dr. Tukwila, WA 98188
Compensation is based on experience and level
Any offer of employment is contingent upon the results of a pre-employment drug test and a background check
All levels must be able to perform the physical demands of wiring a building, navigate small spaces and lifting equipment
Able to lift/move objects up to 75 pounds
Able to carry and work on different sized ladders
Able to work with your hands most of the day, involving repetitive motion
Able to stand for long periods of time
Network Cabling Installer Level Matrix
Lead Installer & Job Foreman

Journeyman
Expert Level
 5+ years working as Expert Level Technician ready to lead a team or act as a foreman
Lead installation teams using project management skills
Design and interpret drawings, plans, and specifications
Design and interpret the job plan and the Scope of Work
Participate in bidding new and retrofit projects
Understand and enforce safety and professionalism with team members
Installer

Journeyman
Expert Level
 5+ years of network cable & telecommunications installation experience, including conducting job-site surveys; building telecommunications closets (including mounting racks, cross connect blocks, backboards, and grounding hardware); placing copper and fiber cables (backbone and horizontal); terminating twisted-pair, coaxial, and fiber-optic cables; testing twisted-pair and fiber-optic cables; troubleshooting copper- and fiber- cabling systems; splicing copper and fiber cable; performing cutovers (retrofit or upgrade) of cabling systems
Ability to interpret drawings, plans, and specifications
Advanced troubleshooting for both copper and optical fiber installations
Ability to choose the correct tool or methodology for specific tasks
Working knowledge of the standards of wired and wireless networks
Installer

Intermediate Level
 2-5 years of network cable & telecommunications installation experience, including: cable-support systems, workstation outlets, horizontal station cables, backbone cables, data & rooms, racks & cabinets, patch panels, testing & certification, firestopping
Working knowledge of the ANSI, TIA, EIA & BICSI cabling standards and the National Electrical Code (NEC)
Working knowledge of telecom and data networks
Ability to read general system layouts from blueprints
Successfully terminate various types of copper and fiber connectors
Installer

Apprentice
Beginner Level

0-1 year with little to no network cable installation or telecommunications installation experience.
High School-level math, reading, and writing skills are required

Basic power & hand tool familiarity
Ability to work on a team
Self-motivated
Basic Computer Skills (email, typing)
Comprehensive Benefits packages, depending upon position
Compensation
Profit Sharing
401k Match
Healthcare Plan
Medical
Dental
Vision
Long term disability
Life
Cell phone
Device Allowance
Plan Allowance or Company provided plan
Auto
Fuel card
Auto allowance or company vehicle
Personal Time Off
Paid Holidays

JobTitle: Tech Product & Offering Development Associate Director
Content_text:
We are:
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 624,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
Software Engineering strives to remain a step ahead, making the new accessible now. We’re building the engineers of tomorrow, as we work with clients to pivot to the NEW. Clients dream it, we build it. We turn innovation into differentiation by putting custom systems and skillsets in place to realize our clients’ vision at scale. In today's disruptive landscape, clients’ software must be built to adapt, just like their business is. Not only do clients need compatible code that plays well with legacy systems, they also need specialized talent—people with full-stack experience to ferry their vision into the future. As one of the largest and most acclaimed teams of specialized software engineers, architects and developers, we solve intractable business problems in creative, unexpected and pragmatic ways. Our software engineering services also provide clients with premier access to emerging technologies through our vast network of industry partners. We're there, incubating at the cutting edge to bring clients simple, seamless software at its best.
You are:
Individuals in this role will understand Accenture’s core offerings and deliver their unique value proposition to customers. They collaborate with Industry Client Account Leads and Account Executives to identify and pursue and close new business opportunities in existing and new accounts.
The work:
Ensures all offerings within the Software Engineering portfolio are represented with a clearly articulated value.
These offerings include: Application Engineering for new product or platform development, Application Migration & Modernization, Mainframe Migration approach, Quality & Performance Engineering, Architecture, Cloud Native development, Distributed Cloud Integration, De-Coupling, and Industry Solutions.
Has deep understanding of Custom Software Development life cycle, technology stack and Processes
Acts as subject matter expert and provides solution guidance to Accenture teams.
Direct important client engagements and ensure that services solutions offerings are aligned to the clients’ goals and agenda.
Provides Strategy and thought leadership at organization level responding to changing customer needs in their core engineering business.
Play a key role in enhancing the business capabilities of Accenture’s Software Engineering offerings and generate ideas and opportunities for growth in the identified area.
Adapts existing methods and procedures to create alternative solutions to moderately complex problems.
Understands the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals.
Uses own judgment to find optimal solutions to recommend.
Generally, interacts with peers and management levels at a client and within Accenture.
Figures out methods and procedures on new assignments with minimal guidance.

Here's what you need:
Minimum of 15 years of experience in technology or related field
Minimum of 10 years of Software Engineering Services experience
Minimum of 5 years sales/ presales experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years' work experience.
Executive leadership experience
Go to market experience
Articulate and fluent in English
Bonus:
Experience at large consulting firm or engineering firm or cloud provider company
Bachelor's degree and or an advanced degree in Engineering or Computer Science
As required by Colorado law under the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is {{$147,000-$312,000}} and information on benefits offered is here.
What We Believe
We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.
Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.
All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.
For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement.
Requesting An Accommodation
Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.
If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.
Other Employment Statements
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.
Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.
Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.
The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.Content Ecosystem is critical to TikTok's user experience, where people watch short-form videos from the vast content pool. This role reports to our TikTok Frontend team, who build end-to-end solutions to improve quantity, quality, and diversity of TikTok's content pool.As a backend engineer of Content Ecosystem working on our Frontend team, you will be responsible for building data pipelines and APIs to interact with business critical data. As a backend engineer at TikTok, you will:1. Work closely with product managers and frontend engineers to deliver key features;2. Implement service to handle very high QPS, with security in mind;3. Improve system design and architecture to ensure high stability and performance of the services;4. Learn and understand how TikTok product works and help build end-to-end solutions;5. Learn and grow from working with great colleagues and taking on challenges;6. Help our team grow from your expertise, experience, and perspectives.Qualifications:1. BA/BS Degree in Computer Science or related major, 2+ years of industry experience in a software development environment;2. Strong knowledge of data structures and algorithms, proficient in at least one coding language, including but not limited to Go, Java, Python, C++, Javascript, TypeScript;3. Curiosity towards new technology and outstanding ability to analyze and solve problems;4. Good grasp of software engineering and how to build a system in scalable and extensive manner;5. Understanding of concurrency, database, and message queue is a plus;6. Experience in the Big Data technologies is a plus.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $94,901.00 - $192,951.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistanceReferral programRelocation assistanceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:JavaScript: 1 year (Required)Angular: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Our Audience Engineering teams are looking for an experienced Software Developer to champion new technical initiatives and own engineering operations. This person will develop robust, scalable, and efficient software solutions, evaluate and champion new technologies, and push industry best practices in a high-visibility technically innovative group. The ideal candidate will be passionate about media and technology and have enterprise engineering experience.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with team leads to deliver high-quality, high-throughput software
Provide input and technical direction for frontend and backend systems
Be hands-on to help the team to design, develop, test, and deliver software
Research and pioneer the adoption and use of new technologies
Ensure operational success of the Audience Engineering department
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience
2+ years of experience with the following technologies: JavaScript, ReactJS, Node.js, GitLab, AWS, SQL and/or NoSQL data stores
2+ years of experience in building web applications that have been successfully delivered to users
Master-level knowledge of software design patterns and standards, REST, GraphQL and HTTP interaction, and the software development life cycle
A collaborative, flexible, positive mindset
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
Preferred Qualifications:
Exceptional troubleshooting abilities
Experience with developing automated internal frameworks or developer tools to increase developer release velocity or improve code health
Master's degree or further education or experience in engineering, computer science or other technical related field
Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace!
About Us
Make your mark in Media with Sinclair Broadcast Group, a diversified media company dedicated to connecting people with content everywhere! We have consistently led the broadcast industry since our inception, and now Sinclair owns the largest regional sports network business and one of the largest television broadcast portfolios in the country. In addition, we have affiliations with all of the major broadcast networks, own Tennis Channel, and several multicast networks including TBD and Comet. Our content is distributed over-the-air, on multi-video providers, and through our industry-leading digital media platforms. We also recently launched a free TV streaming service called STIRR. Our success is the direct result of our extraordinary employees and management team who believe in our vision and are dedicated to ensuring a great future for our employees. We are advancing the world of Media and want YOU to join our winning team!
About the Team
The life-blood of our organization is our people. We have a compelling story, a goal-oriented culture, and we take really good care of people. How good? Here is a glimpse: great benefits, open door policy, upward mobility and a strong desire to see you succeed. Ready to be part of a winning team? Let's talk.

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative/technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Finance).
3+ years of relevant experience in one of the following areas: Business analytics, Business intelligence, data engineering or database engineering.
3+ years of hands-on experience in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large data sets.

Amazon Freight is building a disruptive transportation product with the vision of redefining shipping for its customers. The goal is to develop easy-to-use, reliable and transparent transportation services that raise the customer experience bar relative to all existing shipping alternatives. In doing this, Amazon is deeply studying customer shipping needs and building innovative, market-leading solutions that will organically attract customers towards our services.

We are building an exciting new business in this space and seeking a highly skilled and motivated Business Analyst to join our Amazon Freight LTL Program/Product team in Bellevue, WA. This role is an integral part of the business, meaning that you will work alongside product, finance and operations integrations teams to drive continuous improvement and scaling initiatives. You will be responsible for generating business insights that impact everything from daily program/product decisions to long-term strategic decision making.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist in designing, developing and delivering a scalable set of tools that enable a seamless data exploration and analytics experience for our internal stakeholders.
Prototype applications and services that assist in automating or providing greater visibility into a range of operational processes.
Apply data mining and quantitative analysis to understand how our customers interact with us and identify the best way to improve the customer experience and meet our goals.
Acquire various data sources to enable holistic analysis at a global level
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation

Want to learn more about working with Amazon Transportation Services? Check out this video! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=en5YqrtBGvY&feature=youtu.be


Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other engineers for best practices on data engineering
Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations
Masters in computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, or other quantitative field
Experience in BI platform like Tableau, QlikView, etc.
Experience with AWS services including S3, Redshift, Lamdba.
Proven success in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe data modeling decisions and data engineering strategy
Experience in working and delivering end-to-end projects independently.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
