Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. By working together with a shared dedication and diverse perspectives, we are able to reach our full potential and make a real difference in the world. Seagen is a fast-growing company and has an abundance of opportunities available for you to grow your career. Put your passion to work at Seagen and join us!
Summary:
We are seeking a highly motivated team leader to join us as a Senior Manager of Technology Internal Audit. Seagen is experiencing rapid growth and increasing complexity which is driving the demand for Internal Audit. The function’s goal is to establish a best in class, systematic and disciplined approach to evaluating and improving the effectiveness of the company’s governance, risk management and internal controls. This is an independent contributor role that will focus on leading execution of the company’s annual technology internal audit plan utilizing a hands-on approach to designing work programs, performing procedures, testing controls, documenting results, and tracking remediation.
Responsibilities:
Collaborates with other internal audit leaders to perform risk assessments and developing the annual internal audit plan
As the technology audit lead, work on cross-functional on multi-disciplinary internal audit and advisory projects to support shifting business needs
Develop and execute technical audit testing procedures to evaluate the design and operating efficiency of technology controls
Oversee the IT SOX testing and provide risk and controls guidance to the Technology Organization
Play a major role in the buildout of the audit function’s data analytics, visualization and process automation capabilities and seek opportunities to apply data analytics techniques and automate repetitive audit test procedures
Be a trusted advisor to various internal business department teams with a solid understanding of Seagen’s business model, processes, systems, underlying controls, and an ability to influence positive change in these areas
Keep abreast of standard methodologies, both internally and externally, and provide a conduit for introducing those practices to the Company
Proactively seeks knowledge, new task, and responsibilities. Highly self-motivated and able to work independently
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills to convey ideas clearly and interact effectively across all levels and functions
Organize projects, prioritize work responsibilities and meet deadlines
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration or other relevant field
7+ years’ experience in technology audit
Ability to work with ambiguity, and respond to a rapidly changing, highly innovative environment
Travel domestically and internationally (up to 25% of time) once travel restrictions are lifted
Preferred Qualifications:
9 years’ experience in technology audit
Oracle ERP and relevant ecosystems experience
Data analytics, visualization and process automation experience
Professional certifications such as CISA or CIA
As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, relocation assistance and much more. To learn more about Seagen, please visit www.seagen.com.
Seagen is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.
To prevent the spread of COVID-19, and as an integral part of its public health and safety measures, Seagen requires that all newly-hired employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 before commencing employment, subject to reasonable accommodation and other requirements of applicable federal, state, and local law.

#LI-PM1

Our team helps customers proactively prevent payment fraud. Commerce and financial transactions are increasingly moving online. While the internet has enabled easier and instantaneous payments, it has also introduced a layer of anonymity between the transacting parties. To fully leverage the power of online commerce: there must be mutual trust between parties. Without trust, commerce cannot happen.

By providing a clear, accurate assessment of risk at multiple points of the end-user journey, we enable merchants to eliminate fraud losses, and create adaptive, frictionless experiences for low risk payments. We believe that machine learning is THE way to empower internet-scale businesses to prevent payment fraud.

What you'll do

Research and apply the latest machine learning algorithms to power our core business product
Build offline experimentation systems used to simultaneously evaluate tens of thousands of models
Work on maintaining and improving Sift's ML models and architecture.
Scale machine learning pipelines used to produce thousands of models derived from terabytes of data
Build systems that automatically explain how a model arrived at a prediction
Use data science techniques to analyze fraudulent behavior patterns
Collaborate with other teams to build new ways to use machine learning within Sift
Generate and execute on ideas to provide customers with meaningful and actionable insights to identify and prevent fraudulent behaviors and transactions
Leverage anomaly detection algorithms to identify unusual behaviors for customer traffic patterns
What would make you a strong fit
Practical understanding of machine learning and data science concepts, and a track record of solving problems with these methods
2+ years of experience working with production ML systems.
2+ years experience working with large datasets using Spark, MapReduce, or similar technologies
2+ years experience building backend systems using Java, Scala, Python, or other language
Experience training machine learning models end-to-end
Strong communication & collaboration skills, and a belief that team output is more important than individual output
Degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or a related field

Bonus points

Experience working with scalable, real-time prediction systems in production
Familiarity with multiple machine learning or statistical packages in Python, R, MATLAB, or another programming language
Experience evaluating model performance
Advanced degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or a related field

A little about us:

Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.

The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.

Benefits and Perks:

Competitive total compensation package
401k plan
Medical, dental and vision coverage
Wellness reimbursement
Education reimbursement
Flexible time off

Sift is an equal opportunity employer. We make better decisions as a business when we can harness diversity in our experience, data, and background. Sift is working toward building a team that represents the worldwide customers that we serve, inclusive of people from all walks of life who can bring their full selves to work every day.

This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy

This position is 100% Remote. Work anywhere in the United States
Varis is a well-funded and fast-growing technology startup. Our incredible team includes top industry leaders with decades of experience. We are innovation driven, customer centric, and ready to transform eProcurement. Our culture is focused on bold vision, launching the simplest (yet still valuable) initial solution to learn, then either failing or scaling fast. We seek teammates who drive value creation, are great problem solvers, have strong interpersonal savvy, and can successfully learn on the fly! Joining us now is a ground-floor opportunity to shape our limitless future. On our team you will: see and feel the direct impact of your work; be surrounded by passionate people; learn how to be an entrepreneur; and be at the center of a highly dynamic business model with tremendous individual and collective potential.
As SDE II, you will be an integral part of an agile development team designing, building, and extending new products. In close collaboration with a diverse team of developers, designers, and product managers, you will be leading the build and resolving issues for functionality, resiliency, and scale.
What You’ll Do

Your Responsibilities:

Work with a cross-functional team of developers, designers, and product managers to develop and maintain high-quality technical solutions that deliver a quality customer experience
Translate user stories into a high-performing production solution, and set operational success metrics
Deliver quality software projects that have an immediate impact on the business and our customers.

Success Metrics

You may be a fit for this role if you

Thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment where you can drive new products under fluid conditions
Embrace working with a diverse team in a collaborative, dynamic environment
Seek out challenging problems to solve and own solving them

Who You Are

Seeker of difficult and meaningful problems
Strong collaborator and curious learner

What You’ll Need

2-3 years relevant coding experience with Java or Golang (or similar)
Familiarity with cloud (Azure preferred)
Experience with application containerization (Kubernetes/Docker or equivalent)
Bachelors’ degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent experience

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification and are not intended to be a complete list of all required responsibilities and skills. Other duties and special projects may be assigned per business needs. Job descriptions are subject to change at any time with or without notice. Varis is wholly owned by The ODP Corporation, which is the legal employer of Varis associates. ODP is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Reference Number: 108998
Location: Seattle, WA US
We’re looking for a technically-savvy product manager to help strategize, design and deliver platforms and customer experiences across devices that transform how customers shop for clothing, shoes, and accessories online. Coming up with compelling ideas that solve real customer problems is just the ante, it’s your ability to translate those ideas into reality which enables our big bets pay off.


You’ll be surrounded by technologists so you are as adept at being a strong contributing member of a technical team as you are coalescing a vision. You should feel at home with our agile approach to software development. In fact, for some projects you’ll be the scrum master. You seek truth in data and are adept at writing complex SQL queries to unlock insights and opportunities. You can work with senior tech leaders to prescribe scrappy technical designs when we want to experiment quickly, but know what has to change for when we have to scale the successful ones for millions of customers. Above all, you relish collaborating with developers on a daily basis to make what they build even better.

We are creating an experience that’s aspirational, so you should have a track record of creating consumer experiences that go beyond functional excellence. You might have had a career in gaming or entertainment, where your contributions elevated the experience into something fun and delightful, but want to take your passion to the next level reaching more customers in a single day than most video games sell in their lifetime.

Key Responsibilities:

Define the product vision, goals, and success metrics.

Take ideas through the green light process with team members up through C-level execs. Translate that vision into a logically sequenced and optimized product roadmap. Write complete and detail-oriented product requirements documents and ensuring clear communication of those requirements to the business, design, usability and development teams. Drive execution, staying ahead of dependencies, making smart tradeoffs, coordinating dependencies, and maintaining communication throughout the organization to guarantee a smooth and efficient product delivery. Balance business needs and technical constraints while maximizing business benefit and building great customer experiences. Audit launched products and iterate based on measurable results. The successful candidate will demonstrate:
A track record delivering world-class consumer experiences in a dynamic industry.

High attention to detail in both communication and task management.

Adeptness from the big picture through the smallest details.

Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams through influence versus direct management; excellent interpersonal skills.

A composed, poised and professional demeanor.

A history of teamwork and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done.

Strong analytical and quantitative skills (including the ability to effectively use tools such as Excel and SQL on large data sets) and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop project business cases.

Basic Qualifications

3+ years program or product management experience leading teams to launch at least 2 consumer-facing sites/apps. Computer Science, Engineering or Math/Stats undergraduate degree. SQL proficiency with large datasets. Experience with high transaction, secure, and scalable systems. Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to influence both senior leadership and peers. Preferred Preference for working on agile enabled teams. Experience in in an industry where fun matters (e.g. fashion, entertainment, media, or games). Spearheaded a V1 product. Can't live without their mobile devices. An eye for style.

JobTitle: Senior Product Manager - Customer Accounts Platform
Content_text:
Help define and create the foundational capabilities REI needs in order to know our members and customers while empowering them to shape their engagement with the co-op! REI is looking for a seasoned product manager with experience building enterprise-level platforms to lead our Customer Accounts Platform team. This team is focused on enterprise needs related to customer identity and access management and customer profile. Other key responsibilities include ensuring that the data customers share with us is kept secure and is used to their benefit and to that of the co-op.
In this role, you will work with a talented cross-functional team to guide products from ideation to launch, focused on crafting innovative solutions to customer and business problems. We are looking for a product leader who is passionate about understanding needs from across the co-op related to customer identity and profile, and who is able to translate those needs into solutions that deliver the greatest possible value for our members and for REI.
Responsibilities
Establish a product vision and roadmap and get others on-board with the plan
Lead product discovery efforts focused on validating potential value, technical feasibility, and solution design for product opportunities
You’re charged with building a platform! Elicit needs from a wide assortment of stakeholders from across REI’s lines of business, and identify those opportunities that will deliver the most value for the broadest set of internal and external customers
Use market research, analysis, and direct engagement with our internal and external customers to create product requirements and define success metrics
Partner closely with engineering and design to drive product discovery and development
Manage your product backlog, making data-driven prioritization decisions that lead to optimal value delivery against identified objectives
Collaborate with other product managers and internal teams as a trusted advisor to achieve shared objectives
Monitor and analyze emerging consumer and technology trends to advance our product capabilities and drive innovation

Bring your passion and expertise
Minimum qualifications
5+ years experience as a Product Manager of digital or ecommerce products
Experience with developing platform products that empower organizations or teams by delivering foundational capabilities
Experience with customer identity and access management
Experience managing custom and third-party enterprise applications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Preferred qualifications
Education or experience in a technical discipline such as computer science
Experience evangelizing new technologies across teams to accelerate adoption

JobTitle: newSr Product Manager-Tech, Supply Chain Systems, Amazon Diagno...
Content_text:
Experience with end to end product delivery
5+ years of experience in product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology
Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
Bachelor's Degree
Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
Experience overseeing roadmap strategy and definition
5+ years of experience in product management creating and launching supply chain planning and/or ERP (enterprise resource planning) products
Experience working on and launching technical MRP/planning solutions integrated with inventory
Bachelors or Masters degree
Experience with end-to-end technical product and solutions delivery
Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to the product(s), with the ability to clearly articulate to a diverse audience, including senior executives
Experience in relaying technical solutions to create reporting and analytical requirements to drive metrics
An entrepreneurial mindset, with the tenacity to independently develop ideas and thrive in a fast-paced environment
String oral and written communication skills, with ability to pen thoughts clearly on paper
Strengths in problem solving skills, issue resolution, attention to detail with ability to multi-task
4+ years of product or systems management experience in technology/SaaS/supply chain companies

Job summary
Sr Product Manager-Tech, Supply Chain Systems
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Amazon assembled a team with a wide variety of skills—from research scientists and product/program managers to supply chain specialists and software engineers—to focus on creating a scalable molecular diagnostic testing program. The initiative included building two state-of-the-art testing labs in Kentucky, U.S. and Manchester, UK. Combined, these labs have processed millions of tests and proved to be an invaluable benefit for Amazon’s front-line employees during the pandemic. We also offer the same reliable and convenient testing option to our customers via Amazon.com in the US.

We are excited to enable regular testing on a global scale to both help keep people safe and help get the economy back up and running, but here at Amazon Diagnostics (Dx) it remains Day 1. We have much more work to do to help improve the medical diagnostics healthcare experience and offering for customers, and connect them with the treatment and care they need.

Job Description
To help solve this problem at scale, the Amazon Dx Supply Chain team is continuously working to improve the supply chain infrastructure and enable relevant automation to ensure we can deliver to a vision by implementing supply chain systems and continuously improve upon existing solutions to support testing, processing and other medical diagnostic use cases that come with heavy involvement of the supply chain elements of planning, procurement, receiving, inventory management and production. To this effect, we are seeking a Sr Product Manager-Tech, Systems Development, to lead our transformation and implementation by focusing on planning through procure systems and integrations. This leader will apply technical and organizational skills to tease out and capture detailed business and system requirements, and work across a cross-functional environment of partner and software development teams. You will collaborate and influence other partner teams in bringing our vision to life, keeping a day-1 mindset and never losing sight of creating these supply chain solutions for scale and expansion. You will track deliverables against organizational and team goals, measure progress, manage dependencies, and mitigate risks. The ideal candidate will have prior supply chain experience in a technical product capacity and can converse comfortably with technical and engineering teams. You will obsess over your products solutions, sustenance, and related services. You will create best practices, for both product and processes along the way.

Key job responsibilities

Write supply chain planning, procure and SIOP systems requirements from the lens of manufacturing and distribution, identify strengths and weaknesses of current toolsets in a dynamic environment and create business requirement documents and/or functional specifications
Challenge the status quo and recommend adjustments to improve the current state with a minimalist mindset
Connect the dots across several entities and functions (but not limited to) such as items, bills of material (BOM), recipes/routings and inventory to assess impact while creating plan-to-procure solutions and integrations
Manage milestones, operational systems documentations, system guides and manage change effectively
Works with site functional teams, including manufacturing, engineering, warehouse, and quality assurance to gather user requirements for systems and product design
Advocate and follow an agile mindset in launching capabilities with end-to-end ownership
Escalate ahead of time, block and tackle bottlenecks and demonstrate foresight to see risks and challenges
Conduct requirements reviews, align with partners for milestone gates, plan, monitor, and control the delivery of projects to schedule, budget and to agreed quality
Continuously improve supply chain business processes to reach organizational maturity leveraging people, process and technology as the sequence of approach to problem solving

A day in the life

Willingness to learn, be uncomfortable and work through ambiguities
Technological curiosity and apply technology as an enabler and needle-mover
Strategic thinking and execute tactically to organize discussions, deep dives, presentations and demos to align with the customers on technical requirements and designs
An ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment on a day-to-day basis
Willingness to roll-up their sleeves and do what is needed
Experience creating ERP-like solutions in a supply chain planning and manufacturing environment
Experience directly working with stakeholders such as Production and Component/Ingredient Planners and Buyers
Demonstrated ability to transform customer’s needs/pain points into innovative products
Bachelors/Masters/MBA in Computer Science, Information Technology or Supply Chain
APICS CSCP certification

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.
Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.
We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?
Qualtrics Engineering

Our Engineering team is a group of deeply passionate engineers who are breaking new ground in cloud computing and web scalability. We organize and sort terabytes of data and develop solutions used by millions of users every single day. We design products that make sophisticated research simple. Engineering focuses on these tenets; Platform-oriented, API First, Secure, One Product (Our customers shouldn’t have to learn two different ways of solving the same problem), and Quality (Our customers rely on our products to drive their businesses. Our software must work. If a feature is buggy, don’t release it (if it hasn’t been released yet), fix it or take it out.)

Quality Engineering Challenge

Our Quality Engineering organization’s mission is to build a quality culture championing a delightful customer experience while enabling teams to efficiently bring high quality software to all markets. We do this by engaging early to ensure customer use cases are tested AND fully automated. We also automate the release process to save human effort, reduce mistakes, and speed overall delivery. Our environment is primarily Selenium, Protractor, Mocha, Chai, Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, Jira, TestRail, Python, Jenkins, Nomad and Docker. In our collaborative culture, you find plenty of opportunities to improve the quality of our software.

Responsibilities
You develop and design test frameworks, test tools, and automation for complex, distributed SaaS systems for other STEs, SDETs, and SDEs to use.
Design test plans and test cases for mobile and web applications
You convert manual tests cases into automated test cases.
You ensure the product is tested at the appropriate level (unit vs integration vs end to end, API vs UI), reducing unnecessary test cases, intermittent failures, and decreasing execution time.
You define, implement, and analyze metrics to resolve test effectiveness and the overall quality of software.
You research, share, recommend, and drive adoption of new technologies, standard methodologies, and trends.
You help your team evolve by actively participating in the code review process, design discussions, planning, and post-mortems.
You mentor and develop your other team members.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
4+ years professional coding experience in a programming language like C#, or C++, knowledge of Java, JavaScript or Python preferred.
1+ years professional experience building test automation frameworks and tools from scratch.
Proficiency with a broad range of data structures, algorithms, and design patterns, and knowing when it's appropriate to use them (and when it's not).
Experience applying different software testing techniques, such as equivalence class partitioning, boundary value testing, pairwise testing, etc.
Experience with SOA and distributed systems.
Experience testing web services is a plus.
Experience with Performance / Scalability / reliability testing is also preferred.
What Differentiates Qualtrics from Other Companies
Work–life integration is deeply important to us - we have regular office events, team outings, and happy hours.
We take pride in our offices’ design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.
On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.
Qualtrics continues amazing growth; from 2,300 to 8,000 employees by 2023 across the Globe.
Qualtrics Experience Program - $1,800 for an experience of your choosing (eligible after a year)

CompanyLocation: Seattle, WA 98103 (Green Lake - Wallingford area)+1 location•Remote
Content_text:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Role
Splunk is looking for a Solution Strategist (with technical architecture skills) to join our New Markets and Partner Strategy team, where you will research opportunities, prioritize, define and build and launch solutions that represent our best thinking on how customers can benefit from the combination of Splunk and data from other products and services. Working in conjunction with both strategic partners and new prospective partners, you will envision, craft, build and promote the application of Splunk products. You will work closely with our business development owners to identify and align Splunk’s capabilities to craft and drive valuable customer outcomes when partner ISV and Splunk products, services and solutions are combined. Candidates should demonstrate the ability to think strategically about the performance, reliability and security needs of customers using cloud technologies to build their digital infrastructure and possess hands-on technical experience building scalable, secure and compliant solutions.
The responsibilities for this role include: voicing support for Splunk products, providing technical product expertise; supporting, staffing and speaking at partner events; providing presentations at the C-level; delivering ongoing communication of the latest Splunk capabilities and partner enablement; building groundbreaking prototypes to support our joint initiatives and build cloud-optimized architectures. You will need to be, or quickly become, a Splunk expert. You will be comfortable white boarding software architectures with a room full of engineers, as briefing an executive audience.
Responsibilities
You will innovate within and across internal teams to develop new use cases, value propositions, tools, technical content and engagement programs that scale and evolve the Splunk selling and adoption motion. In addition, you will:
Engage with customers, develop insights into what is possible, and uncover unarticulated customer needs to drive customer success
Define content capabilities, user stories, mockups, and acceptance criteria in collaboration with other team members.
Build compelling and high impact content that can be consumed by many outstanding customers using existing Splunk APIs and interfaces. Identify priorities based on a researched understanding of customer needs, partner interest & market trends.
Create technical documentation, reference architecture and supporting technical content.
Understand and internalize partner product architectures. Determine where Splunk products can have the most impact.
Assist in the creation of technical integrations with ISVs and other key technology vendors to deliver solution content.
Assist in developing and delivering training to the Splunk and partner technical sales force.
Promote the Splunk solution portfolio internally with our field organization and with customers, prospects, and partners.
Help Splunk extend its brand and value proposition through social media, conference presentations and blogs.
Requirements
10+ years relevant Sales Engineering or Solution Consulting experience, building, delivering and selling cloud service products to IT organizations and C-level officers
Expertise or understanding of multiple technical domains: Cloud infrastructure and services, Security, DevOps, Analytics and Application Management
Hands on Splunk experience or similar technology a plus
Understanding of architectural principles for cloud-based platforms including SaaS PaaS, multi-tenancy and automation.
Product and/or Project Management experience is preferred
Committed Curiosity - with a desire to question, research, learn and grow (on repeat)
Forward-thinking learning - ability to quickly grasp the essence of new issues and concepts
Collaboration - work across teams in a highly matrixed organization
Bias for action -address new opportunities and challenges, set, communicate, lead, and meet results-oriented achievements and deadlines
Should be available to travel to visit your accounts, up to 30% of the time (including international travel, so must have a valid passport!)
BS in Computer Science or similar degree, MS/MBA degree preferred
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

(Colorado only*) Minimum base salary of $135,000. You may also be eligible for incentive pay + equity + benefits.*Note: Disclosure per sb19-085 (8-5-201 et seq).

Sonos has office locations in Santa Barbara, Seattle and Boston. This is a position with flexibility to work remotely in the United States.
At Sonos, we're passionate about bringing music into every home and inspiring the world to listen better. To fulfill this mission, we have developed an unquenchable thirst for data. Data helps us build a better business, a better product and ultimately helps us make happier customers. If you have a passion for helping organizations extract tremendous value from their data, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!
We are looking for a talented Director of Analytics Engineering to lead our growing data engineering and quality teams and be a partner in transforming Sonos into a mature, data driven organization. You will challenge the status quo and dream big, pushing the company to use data in ways that didn’t seem possible. You are a collaborator and love working together to solve the most complex problems.
In this role, your team will be responsible for all aspects of data analytics engineering - developing, testing, and maintaining the data pipelines that feed business operations, data analytics and data science at Sonos. Your team partners with technology and software teams to build and deliver internal products and services at scale that support the business. This is the data engineering team that provides the foundation for data at Sonos.
What You’ll Do
You will partner with business stakeholders and data leaders to architect, build and deploy end-to-end data assets for Sonos. Your team owns the data models and pipelines that enable reporting & analysis, insights, and model building for teams across Sonos. Your team will also be responsible for building out the test automation framework and ensuring that we can be assured that the data is always high quality and accurate. You are an experienced leader who can drive transformational initiatives. Key responsibilities for this role include:
Setting the data engineering and quality strategy that will support our company’s goals
Communicating the technical vision to executive leadership and non-technical stakeholders
Building and inspiring a high performing organization of engineers and creating an inclusive culture
Collaborating with your data science and program management partners to translate business requirements into technical solutions for the engineering team to implement
Collaborating with data leaders and business leaders to develop a data engineering roadmap and participating in regular planning cycles
Setting the standards for data engineering best practices and helping the team develop good engineering practices
Participating in decisions about where to invest in our engineering tools and systems and when to buy vs build
Steering the team through a transformation in how we operate as we migrate from our current SQL-based systems to a modern, cloud-based data platform
What You’ll Need
Basic Qualifications
7+ years leading and mentoring teams of data engineers
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or a similar technical field, or equivalent experience
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with driving change in engineering organizations
Experience running a large internal service organization
Experience with designing, developing and maintaining a data platform and data warehouse that supports analysis and data science
Experience with building strong engineering practices including using Agile, CI/CD, and automation
Experience with technologies frequently used in data engineering (MS SQL Server, Snowflake, Airflow, Spark, Kinesis, etc)
Strong analytical skills and strong organizational and presentation abilities.
Demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate across organizational functions and influence business leaders.

U.S. News & World Report ranked Cincinnati as the No. 1 city to live in Ohio for 2021-22 – but the accolades don’t stop there. Out of 150 cities across the country, it ranked Cincinnati as: No. 13 on the list of most affordable places to live in the U.S. No. 44 in best places to live. No. 82 in best places to retire! According to ASG “A tech worker in Cincinnati…may take home more money each year than the same job in Silicon Valley could offer. Indeed, echoed CompTIA’s findings by average annual salary for all tech jobs listed on its site between August 2016 and July 2017 in the top 25 large-market tech areas, factoring average cost of living, and found that the salaries offered in San Francisco don’t go as far. Trust us, we believe you’ll love Cincinnati as much as we do!We are looking for a full-time, talented, and dedicated Mobile Android Developer to join our emerging software team. With passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish! We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver a full suite of design and technology solutions. Our strong sense of community drives us to be the best - we hold each other and our software to the highest standards! Are you looking to be a part of something that you can leave your mark on? Then we are the team you want to join! We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.https://www.tinyhomeconsultingllc.comRelocation assistance is available! Relocation must occur within 60 to 90 days.Why work with us:We love collaborative, agile software development, iterative design, and testing. We form tight teams with PM and UX which build rapid prototypes and release frequently. Projects are varied and plentiful!We encourage learning and integration of new technologies. You think you have a new technology solution you’d like to try? We’d love to hear it.· Our onsite team gives us the ability to collaborate quickly and efficiently.· With our streamlined hiring process go from interview to first day in rapid speed!What you will be doing:Develop features for us and our customersImplement unit and functional/integration testingShare knowledge and learning with the team and contribute to system architecture design decisionsImprove the scalability and securityInterface with QA, UX/product design, and DevOps teamsWhat you need for the job2+ years of experience as an Android developer; but really, we are open to any developer that has the technical prowessConstraint layout, Recycler View and Compound ComponentsA strong grasp of computer science fundamentalsAbility to effectively communicate within a team and with project stakeholdersAble to collaborate and effectively communicate technology ideas and issuesEnthusiastic about product quality, design, code quality, and user experienceExcellent problem solving and analytical thinking skillsWillingness to ask for help, learn from others, and mentor others in turnAbility to work independently as well as in a team environmentExperience integrating with REST APIs is a plusMockito mocking libraryEspresso UI testingAndroid Jetpack Navigation, RetrofitMVVM architectureFamiliarity with iOS development appreciatedYour benefitsCompetitive benefits and compensation!Ability to work with exceptionally creative and talented people!Job Type: Full-timePay: $56,151.00 - $125,298.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time offRelocation assistanceRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question(s):Will you be willing to relocate to Cincinnati, OH?Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Software development: 2 years (Preferred)Mobile Development: 2 years (Preferred)Kotlin: 2 years (Preferred)Work Location: One location

JobTitle: Store No. 8: Sr. Software Engineer - Seattle
Content_text:
Position Summary...
What you'll do...
About the Role:
Success in interactive commerce requires a content engine to enable contextual intelligence: understand customer intent, understand store offerings and provide the best match of both. The Contextual Intelligence engineering team will leverage advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and Machine learning (ML) holistically to support our ultimate goal: a new standard of consumer shopping with the fastest most delightful end-to-end consumer experience through Augmented Reality (AR). Our journey has just begun and we are building a hard-working passionate founding team to join us changing the retail landscape and driving technical innovation.

You’ll love this job if you:
Think of the user first and delight them in new and exciting waysHave solid technical chops and use them to drive measurable impact to the customer and businessCan work autonomously and know how to work in a high-performing autonomous teamThink out of the box and make things happenThrive in loosely structured environments and help create right-fit structure as we growConsistently deliver and let nothing get in your wayAre flexible to the changing demands of a fast-paced startup environmentWork cross-functionally with other departments and other engineering teams to craft transparency and consensus in what you build

What you’ll do:
Design and build Store No. 8's Content Engine / Contextual Intelligence
Productionize machine Learning models of cloud services and open source projects, including but not limited to the areas of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Translation (MT), Speech Recognition, Image Recognition, Computer Vision (CV) and Information Retrieval (IR)Build SN.8's operational tooling platforms and internal tooling of simulation, experimentation and data management
Boldly innovate without losing sight of our missionCollaborate directly with Product Managers, UX Designers, and other Engineering teams
Help build a great engineering culture that consistently delivers value to our users and business
What you should have:
BS / MS in Computer Science or related experienceExperience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java and PythonStrong computer systems experienceExperience with web service frameworks and UI components frameworksExperience with cloud computingExperience with linear algebra, calculus, and statistics
What We Offer:
A fast paced startup environment with unlimited potential for growthUnlimited PTO - We believe in work-life balance and want you to take the time you need.
Generous Medical, Dental and Vision packages to choose from401K and Stock Options
Career Development programsMonthly social events and team outings
And so much more..
Minimum Qualifications...
Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.
As permitted by applicable law, provide evidence of full vaccination as defined by CDC guidelines OR secure approval of medical or religious accommodation for the vaccination mandate., Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and 3 years’ experience in software engineering or related field OR 5 years’ experience in software engineering or related field.
Preferred Qualifications...
Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.
Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field and 2 years' experience in software engineering or related field
Primary Location...
2628 NE UNIVERSITY VILLAGE ST, SEATTLE, WA 98105-5023, United States of America

Reports to: Software Development Manager

Who We Are:
Headquartered in Redmond, Washington, MicroVision is part of the community of high-tech leaders in the Greater Seattle Area. Founded in 1993, early applications of our technology were incorporated into automotive systems and U.S. Military heads up displays. We’ve since worked with companies worldwide to successfully integrate our technology into their products and bring revolutionary solutions to market.
Is this You?
Are you passionate about new ground breaking technologies, such as 3D lidar, ADAS and Autonomous Vehicles? MicroVision has an immediate exciting opportunity for a Lidar Algorithm Development Engineer in our growing Software Engineering team. In this role you will collaborate with various technical teams in the company to develop a market defining automotive lidar product. The ideal candidate for this position will be a highly motivated computer scientist who is passionate about developing efficient algorithms to solve the toughest problems.
Essential Responsibilities:
Design and development of algorithms utilizing MicroVision lidar's 3D point clouds as applied to Advanced Driver Assistant Systems (ADAS) and Autonomous Vehicles (AV).
Optimize algorithms for performance while minimizing computational complexity.
Analyze and process MicroVision 3D Point Cloud data sets for variety of operations, such as segmentation, clustering, collision avoidance, path prediction, etc.
Collaborate closely with software and RTL developers to enable implementation of algorithms in embedded software or logic.
Document and communicate design work.
Conduct design reviews.
Desired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Experience in working with large 3D datasets and point clouds
Experience in systematic development of Algorithms to meet product requirements
Expertise in rapid and iterative algorithm prototyping in Python and MATLAB
Working knowledge of C++
Understanding of efficient implementation of Algorithms in Embedded CPUs, DSPs, or Logic.
Domain expertise in Computer Vision, Robotics, or Mathematics
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
Education and Experience:
M.Sc. in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or a related field AND
5+ years of relevant experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
MicroVision is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MicroVision is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, status as a disabled veteran or Vietnam-era veteran or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation in completing the application, attending and/or participating in an interview or in taking any test required for employment.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $35 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.
Thermo Fisher Scientific leads molecular testing and molecular diagnostics with world-renowned real-time PCR, microarray, and capillary electrophoresis (CE) instrumentation systems. Our DNA Human Identification BU (HID) is the world leader in enabling our customer the make the world safer. The BU is in need of a Software Engineering Leader. You will lead a globally distributed software R&D team to build our industry-leading software for instrumentation platforms, integration ecosystem, customer interface and data interpretation/solution.
Position can be Remote based anywhere in the US.
San Jose, CA/Bay Area highly preferred.


Responsibilities
Your will be responsible in delivering software platforms for Genetics Sciences Division (GSD) multi-billion-dollar HID’s business unit. You will also be responsible in the development of the strategy and the execution for the HID business.

You will work with Product Management and R&D leaders to form software strategies. You will transform the long-term digital vision to short-term executable blocks that both address the current business needs and lead a path toward our future platform. You will lead U.S.-based software engineering resources and run/collaborate with offshore groups to implement software roadmap. You will lead technology selection and technical innovations.

Requirements
Advanced degree in Math, EE, Computer Science, Statistics, Bioinformatics, Biology or related fields. Minimum BS degree and/or equivalent years of experienceA minimum of 5 years of people management experience
Knowledge in web technologies, client-server software architecture, backend processes, and common software security measures. i.e. AWS, ML pipeline, Java-based web stack, Python, Postgres and nosql
Experience with Human Identification (HID) applications.
Execution:
Represent GSD software R&D with the HID businessHighly accountable with a track record of setting ambitious but realistic targets and delivering upon project commitmentsExperience leading global engineering teams to deliver sophisticated software solutionsDiligent, organized, capable and comfortable leading multiple large-scale projects simultaneouslyAbility to prioritize and never settle for second-class software solutionsEnjoy working in a fast-paced environmentComfortable in getting results in the face of ongoing ambiguity; enjoy the process of developing industry-leading products by actively seeking competitive information and market feedback, and continuously optimizing product conceptsKeen in improving customer experience through continuous innovation and ecosystem developmentUnderstand the role of a R&D leader is to enable the business as a whole. Display flexibility and lead by example to support other functions such as internal R&D and manufacturing
Technology:
Deep understanding of the genetic sciences domainDeep understanding of the end-to-end genetic analysis workflow, including sample preparation, instrument operations, testing solutions, analysis solutions and reportingDeep understanding and track record of building software solutions for the applied markets
Strategy and partnering:
Ability to collaborate effectively; form partnerships with marketing and business partners to design and implement overall product strategyAbility to communicate across organization to evangelize software vision and roadmap, ability to form alignment in a fast-changing environment and comfortable making adjustments in order to reach the end business goal
People management:
Track record of managing and encouraging impactful software engineering teamsExperience running globally distributed resources
Our global team of more than 90,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!
Position Summary
At F5, we make apps faster, smarter, and safer…from anywhere. Come work within the BIG-IP team in an exciting, fast-paced environment charting the course for F5’s current and future. You will get to build and maintain world class systems.
In this position you will be responsible for leading engineers in an Agile organization focused on DevOps/Automation aspects of the product, involving end-to-end CI/CD Pipeline strategy, harnesses for the Integration Pipeline and Product validation, build reporting workflow for integration and quality efforts, and cater the overall system needs. You will be working on some of the newest technologies in Cloud Services, Kubernetes, microservices architecture, CI/CD, and many more. You are an advocate every single day for improving the DevOps/Automation needs of F5 BIG-IP products and services.
Key responsibilities are to develop and manage people, provide technical leadership, lead project planning, facilitate communication, and offer product vision. Coordinates project timelines with Project and Development Managers, determines and obtains resources, performance management and provides technical leadership. This Manager is a champion for product quality within the department and is accountable for an assessment of product readiness and commitments on product delivery schedules.
Primary Responsibilities
Employee management including but not limited to sourcing, interviewing and hiring candidates for open positions, onboarding, establishing goals, assigning or delegating work, providing on-the-job training, giving guidance to staff, conducting performance evaluations, approving paid time-off (PTO), developing performance improvement plans, and taking disciplinary action.
Recommends changes to policies and establishes procedures that affect immediate organization(s).
Act as an advisor to subordinate(s) to meet schedules and/or resolve technical problems.
Ensures plans are being met; monitor, track and make visible
Develops and administers schedules, performance requirements; provides input into budgeting.
May meet with customers to communicate and review product features
May communicates product roadmaps and project status to staff, senior management, and other product teams.
Evaluates and reviews new technologies on their applicability to product architecture and design.
Prioritizes product features resulting in the correct delivery of needed functionality.
Coordinates with development service groups resulting in greater communication and higher probability of on time delivery of products.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge and expertise in software engineering methodologies.
Demonstrated ability to lead technical teams
Deep understanding about development and maintenance of DevOps Automation tools
Proficient in software life cycle like Build/Release/Deploy and specialized in cloud automation through open-source DevOps tools like Gitlab, Jenkins, Chef.
Proven ability to deliver products with the highest quality, on time and within budget.
Demonstrated ability in mentoring and developing direct reports.
Extensive experience with bug tracking and triage systems
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Demonstrated excellence in all written communications.
Qualifications
B.S. Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other technical degree
Minimum 12+ years of handling services, development or automation for a large-scale distributed environment.
Experience working in a micro-services environment such as Kubernetes, Dockers and Containers
3 years of leading or managing a Development or DevOps team
F5 Networks, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we embrace diversity
The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.
Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com ) .
Equal Employment Opportunity
It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

Mavenir is building the future of networks and pioneering advanced technology, focusing on the vision of a single, software-based automated network that runs on any cloud. As the industry's only end-to-end, cloud-native network software provider, Mavenir is transforming the way the world connects, accelerating software network transformation for 250+ Communications Service Providers in over 120 countries, which serve more than 50% of the world’s subscribers.
Role Summary
Join Mavenir Network and Client Operations and R&D team in developing cutting edge solutions for customers. Work in a Dev Ops mode to rapidly investigate solutions for Client issues. Apply fixes and Changes to Trial Systems. Must be able to work in shifts, including weekends based on schedule. Able to prepare Method of Procedure for an upgrade and configuration changes on mOne Based Application Platform
Key Responsibilities
Performing tests using phones and clients and systems
Collecting Logs and Cataloging issues
Troubleshooting, call tracing, call flow review and debugging
Isolating issues in call flows to relevant nodes
Applying fixes to trial systems
Hosting calls with R&D to drive resolution
Maintaining and managing Action Registers
Job Requirements
Engineering Degree with a major in Computer Science or Equivalent Preferred
5 years’ experience in the wireless industry
Experience with Tier 1/ 2 Troubleshooting Skills
Basic TCP/IP and Linux networking knowledge
Able to perform End to End testing / troubleshooting of voice call & messaging call flow
Database knowledge related to mySql and MariaDB
Basic understanding of IMS domain and Products (CSCF/TAS/ATCF/WRG)
Basic Understanding of VoLTE call flow and Messaging Flow (SMS/MMS/RCS) in telecommunication service provider network
Details Understanding of SIP / HTTP and Diameter Protocol and its usage in Access SBC and Interconnect SBC products
Basic understanding of error response codes (SIP and HTTP) in network and how to interpret them during debug session
Able to effectively work with customers over conference call or face to face to understand the issue details and perform required logs collection on appropriate nodes
Experience triaging call flow issues as they are reported with preliminary analysis and assign to appropriate R&D team members
Able to capture the packet capture / logs on product and perform basic analysis of the issue before handing over to R&D for resolution
Technical and detail-oriented.
Proactive. Readily demonstrates initiative (a “Go Getter”)
Collaborative and able to work in group settings
Accessibility
Mavenir is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a US applicant in need of special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail careers@mavenir.com or call: +1-469-916-4393. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.
Mavenir is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes qualified applicants from around the world, regardless of their ethnicity, gender, religion, nationality, age, disability, or other legally protected status.

JobTitle: newCyber Aerospace and Defense Strategy Manager
Content_text:
Work you'll do As a Manager for Deloitte's Risk & Financial Advisory Cyber team, you'll work with our diverse teams of leading professionals to help design and implement solutions to some of today's toughest cybersecurity challenges so they can achieve business growth and manage risk. You'll build on your foundations in Information Technology and Business to design and implement business-aligned cyber risk management programs, processes, and systems that help clients focus their investments on key information technology risks. In your role as a Manager, you will support a team in delivering projects across a variety of cyber topics, including: * Understand how business functions operate and how industry trends impact a client's business. * Assessing or developing an organization's cyber risk strategy and posture, as it relates to data risk, cyber risk management, cyber risk frameworks and policies, and/or cyber risk measures, methods, and reporting * Strategically drive the development and execution of risk assessments and mitigation plans to enhance the client's ability to identify, evaluate, prioritize and mitigate risks * Implement risk management solutions aligned to the client's vision and strategic priorities * Work includes project management, offering operations/development, sales, innovation, eminence building and people development.


Works with all stakeholders to identify and confirm resource necessary program resources throughout the project lifecycle. * Manages program issues and changes to business plans and resource allocations. * Coordinate across multiple stakeholder groups and manage end-to-end concurrent projects * Responsible for effective project and program kickoff, identification of all program stakeholders, defining and clarifying program roles and responsibilities. * Conduct project analysis and provide an efficient forecast of all project directives and timelines * Track and manage project financials, project deliverables, timetables, risks, and challenges * Manages program issues and changes to business plans and resource allocations.
Documents/communicates status and escalates risks as appropriate. * Configures, utilizes, and supports key program and project management tools. * Strong analytical, project budget and forecasting, project management and communication skills. This individual will have strong excel, MS Project, and PowerPoint skills.
Self-starter with the ability to focus on deadlines and deliverables * Coordinate across multiple stakeholder groups and manage end-to-end concurrent projects * Contribute to Deloitte's thought leadership in client organizations and the external market place. * Drive development and implementation of cyber strategies targeted on key client's risk and business needs, and enhanced by leading practices * Identify and evaluate complex business and technology risks and remediation methods to mitigate risks * Demonstrate problem solving, critical thinking and logical structuring skills * Assist in the selection and tailoring of approaches, methods and tools to support service offering or industry projects * Actively participate in decision making with engagement management and seek to understand the broader impact of current decisions * Demonstrate a general knowledge of market trends, competitor activities, Deloitte & Touche products and service lines * Actively mentor and train team members on overall cyber processes, governance, and frameworks * Work cross-functionally with team members to support and drive a collaborative team environment * Create and design effective presentations as a means for communicating project and deliverable progress to clients * Perform sophisticated data analyses to understand client's business and identify risk * Execute advanced services and supervise staff in delivering basic services Qualifications Required: * BA/BS in Business Administration, Supply Chain, Accounting/Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Management Systems, Information Security, Math, or related fields * 5+ years of experience in the following areas: * Information security and privacy or cyber risk management * Implementing security solutions * Professional services or related roles within industry * Data Risk, Identity, Risk Assessment, SEIM, NIST/ISO or Regulatory framework - NYDFS or FFIEC. * IT and cyber security * Risk assessment and monitoring * Threat modeling * Threat remediation * Identity and access management * Encryption * End point security * Working understanding of cybersecurity concepts across a full range of cyber domains covered in common frameworks like NIST 800-53 and 800-171, NIST CSF, ISO 27001 and CMMC (e.g. Identity Management, Data Protection, SLDC, Encryption, Security Monitoring - SIEM, incident response, etc.) * Experience with the Cyber regulatory requirements of DoD contractors such as DFARS, ITAR, CUI handling, CMMC, DIBCAC audits, etc.

Knowledge of ICD 503 a plus. * General network security and architecture understanding. Familiarity with cloud engineering and cloud security concepts, zero-trust, IoT, IT architecture and infrastructure design, SMART Factory security, and DevSecOps. * Experience working as a Dept of Defense (DoD) contractor, consulting to DoD contractors or a former Federal Government employee.


Experience in change management and/or managed service solution design and implementation a plus * Experience with consulting skills (client service orientation, conflict resolution, analysis/synthesis of information, negotiation, project management, security contracts, etc.) * Negotiation skills needed to obtain commitments to remediate risks and vulnerabilities from leadership of other teams * Ability to travel up to 50% (While up to 50% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice) * Experience managing and leading large project teams and project management skills * Limited immigration sponsorship may be available Preferred: * Certification in PMI/PMP * Previous consulting or Big 4 experience * Certifications such as: CISSP, CISM, or CISA certification a plus * Active security clearance at the Secret or Top Secret level a plus

JobTitle: ELS - AMZ - Site Launch Program Manager
Content_text:
Overview:

Elite Line Services is a major single source maintenance solution in the industry with the bandwidth to service all of your equipment maintenance needs. We maintain all original equipment manufacturers for material handling equipment, BHS, PBB, Facilities, GSE and vehicles. Our hybrid programs efficiently cross utilize technicians between equipment types to provide seamless coverage that protects the best interest of our customers. Whether this is getting full warranty value for new parts and systems or applying experienced and specialized technical support for mature equipment needs, ELS has you covered.

Responsibilities:

POSITION SUMMARY
A Site Launch Program Manager is responsible for managing the launch/start-up of one or more new MHE maintenance operations throughout the NAFC footprint as well as managing the training of Maintenance Managers, Technicians and CMMS personnel to ensure minimum essential skill sets are attained prior to site launch.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Managing the launch/start-up of one or more new MHE maintenance operations throughout the NAFC footprint.
Managing the training of Maintenance Managers, Technicians and CMMS personnel to ensure minimum essential skill sets are attained prior to site launch.
Managing the site’s Installation/Operation Qualification (IOQ) process whereby identifying and deploying a team of Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), performing the IOQ, developing an action item list, and working with Operations Engineering and the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) to see the action item list through to completion.
Leading new management through the start-up of a site and ensuring that the site is fully staffed, trained, on boarded, and set up for success by the targeted launch dates.
Responsible for managing the new site set-up: Parts - receipt, ID, store, inventory; Shop - shelving, equipment, tools; War Room Set-up; RTL Tracker compliance and quality control; Arc Flash Analysis; LOTO Placarding.
Following through post launch to ensure the site is transitioned to the Regional Maintenance Manager (sustainability team) seamlessly.
Ensuring alignment with site operations management, operations engineering, launch engineering, Regional Maintenance Managers, OEM Project Managers, vendors and other key stakeholders to ensure the site is launched efficiently and effectively.
Stepping in where necessary to provide coverage in the absence of a Maintenance Manager.
Report recordable and/or other serious injuries to Safety Manager.
Compliance with ELS safety program policies and procedures in contracts.
Maintain a valid driver’s license and be insurable under the employer’s insurance policy.
Perform additional duties/assignments as may be required by management.
Qualifications:

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Project Management, Engineering or a related discipline, or 2+ years of Amazon RME Management experience.
5+ years of project management experience.
5+ years of maintenance operations experience.
Extensive Microsoft Office experience.
Ability to travel to various North American fulfillment centers is required.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MBA and work experience in technical field is highly desired.
Auditing Experience a plus.
Prior experience or use of Lean/Six Sigma.
Prior experience in training and development.
Ability to organize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong knowledge in project development methodology, clear verbal and written communication skills, has the ability to handle daily activities in a dynamic environment and drive deliverables.
ADDITIONAL SKILLS & ABILITIES
Ability to maintain confidentiality
Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
Ability to influence and persuade management level employees
Ability to communicate to interpret and explain written and statistical data to a wide range of audiences.
Excellent problem solving skills
Ability to convey difficult and challenging information to managers.
Attention to detail a must.
Ability to work unsupervised
Ability to manage time and prioritize work.
Computer Skills:
Basic Requirements:
Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Contract redline/tracking, Power Point), E-Mail, scanning and copying equipment.
Preferred Requirements:
None
Other Requirements:
Basic Requirements:
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and be insurable under the Company’s insurance policy
Must be able to comply with the ELS Drug and Alcohol policy.
Promoting and conducting good housekeeping practices
Dedicated to supporting production by working in a safe, customer focused manner
Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English

None

Job Description
Nordstrom is a fashion specialty retailer founded on a simple idea: offer each customer the best possible service, quality, value and selection. At Nordstrom, providing great customer service goes beyond the selling floor. It takes a team of individuals with different talents and skills to continuously improve service and our results. Our Advanced Analytics team works in partnership with other areas of the Company to develop insights, algorithms, and data products that support decision making, products, and technologies used throughout Nordstrom. When you join our team, you are welcomed into a family dedicated to creating memorable and rewarding shopping experiences for our customers. We are committed to building teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and active inclusion is core to how Nordstrom wins. We’re an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.
We are seeking a Director of Data Science with deep experience using Data Science approaches to solve complicated optimization problems across the organization. This role will analyze Nordstrom’s multi-channel supply chain end-to-end, identifying the biggest opportunities, and developing plans for system-wide optimization of cost, throughput, and customer experience. This is a unique opportunity to have a major impact on Nordstrom’s bottom line and continued success. The ideal candidate is a creative and passionate problem-solver who thinks big, understands the details, acts quickly, and is motivated to develop new approaches to optimize Nordstrom’s business using operations research, machine learning, and cutting-edge technology. We are looking for someone with strong experience solving difficult supply chain and fulfillment optimization problems in large scale retail environments. You should have a track record of delivering real improvements in previous roles, and a solid understanding of the downstream consequences that upstream process changes can have. The candidate will have the opportunity to lead a team of talented data scientists/analysts to develop the team’s long-term roadmap to drive business strategies and improve operations.
Responsibilities
Own strategic thought leadership for the subject of enterprise-wide supply chain optimization
Responsible for building/executing analytics roadmap and broadly engaging with the business to identify opportunities that can have significant impact on Nordstrom’s business
Build a high-performance team by hiring and developing the best talent, providing mentorship, subject area expertise, learning and inspiration to the team.
Lead large-scale modeling, optimization, simulation and statistical analysis in the areas of supply chain network strategy, supply chain planning, and transportation.
Communicate insights and recommend areas for further improvement to business leaders
Stay on top of the most recent technical trends and constantly look for new opportunities to advance data science at Nordstrom
Qualifications
Graduate Degree in areas such as Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Economics, and Computer Science.
8+ years of professional experience in advanced data analysis and modeling.
5+ years of experience managing and leading a supply chain data science/analytics team focused on optimization efforts in a retail, transportation, or similar company.
Deep knowledge in supply chain management with demonstrated results in driving supply chain optimization efforts such as transportation optimization, network strategy and planning, and inventory flow.
Strong experience with data modeling techniques such as optimization, machine learning, and simulation, solving for optimal transportation routes, optimal network topology, optimal fulfillment routing, optimal inventory deployment and flow, for example.
Strong experience with Gurobi or CPLEX.
Experience interfacing with Senior Business leaders to drive top and bottom-line improvements.
Excellent written and verbal communication skill and ability to successfully communicate ideas and sell strategic plans to senior executives.
Project management skills and familiarity with agile planning methodology.
