At PitchBook we work to provide global professionals with comprehensive data on the entire venture capital, private equity and M&A landscape so they can discover and execute opportunities with confidence. We credit our success and rapid growth to our cutting-edge products, customer centered attitude and ability to embrace and drive change.

In just over a decade, PitchBook has reached over 1,300 global employees with offices worldwide, and we’re not slowing down! Consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work, our culture is at the heart of our success and is driven by excellence, inclusion and fun. At PitchBook we’re committed to fostering an open and collaborative work environment.

About the role:


As the Director of Cyber Security in PitchBook’s engineering division, you will lead the overall security vision, strategy, and execution for PitchBook’s suite of products and data platforms in support of key business objectives. You and your cybersecurity team will work with engineers, management, and over a thousand global employees to protect PitchBook data assets and information systems from the growing global threat landscape while providing cyber risk management for PitchBook’s mission and customers.
You will provide leadership to Cybersecurity Engineering and Cybersecurity Analysis teams to build and mature key security capabilities, including threat management, vulnerability management, data security management, and information security governance risk and compliance programs in a customer-forward high-growth environment that will require adaptive nimble implementations and forward-thinking strategic planning.
Your dual mission will be to bring the certainty of a world-class preventative security program, and the assurance of a thorough and prepared incident response system. Your direct and indirect impact will be felt broadly, and you will foster a ‘secure culture’ that raises the awareness of the modern threat landscape across the organization and educates each individual on their role in managing cyber risk. You will be responsible for aligning PitchBook from top to bottom with the corporate security mission.
Your ability to collaborate with colleagues, provide leadership in a matrix-style structure, level up engineers and development managers through automation, reliability services, and support, and enable efficient usage of our cloud platform across hundreds of engineers globally will be critical to your success. You will solicit feedback, engage others with empathy, and help create a culture of belonging, teamwork, and purpose.
Primary Job Responsibilities:
Owns cybersecurity engineering and analysis operations, strategies, standards, and practices across the organization, working closely with engineering leadership, product management, and business risk management to craft roadmaps and success criteria
Devises technology systems that advance protections from cyber risks, builds adaptive response and recovery processes for cyber incidents, and supporting engineering excellence across the organization, in portability, usability, maintainability, scalability, recoverability, availability, extensibility, and security
Creates, evangelizes, and organizes PitchBook’s DevSecOps culture, integrating security seamless into product, engineering, and operations through structure, collaboration, enablement and automation
Aligns PitchBook information security and cyber risk programs with the organization’s overall mission and corporate compliance requirements
Provides security assurance and due diligence for PitchBook management, PitchBook customers, and 3rd party stakeholders
Leads cybersecurity engineering and cybersecurity analysis including, threat management, vulnerability management, data security management, cyber security incident response, and information security governance risk and compliance
Drives learning and adoption of new standards in cloud security practices, application security practices, and secure software development lifecycle
Skills and Qualifications:
M.S. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related
7+ years in architect or senior Security Engineering, Security Operations, Security Analysis, Cloud Security, Application Security, or DevSecOps, roles within a medium or large enterprise
3+ years in a leadership role responsible for department- or company-level Security Engineering, Security Operations, Security Analysis, Cloud Security, Application Security, or DevSecOps
Extensive background in modern cloud security practices, application security practices, secure software development lifecycle, and cyber security incident response
Strong skills in threat management, vulnerability management, data security management, and information security governance risk and compliance
Experience with common security frameworks (SOC2, ISO 27001/2, NIST CSF, CSA CCM), common privacy and data protections (GDPR, CCPA, SOX, 23 NYCRR 500), and common corporate compliance requirements
Familiarity with Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, IaaS/PaaS/SaaS solutions, Rapid7 or similar tools, Splunk or similar tools, IDS/IPS systems, DLP and NAC technologies, and federated IAM
Has successfully built and executed on multi-year strategic initiatives, with a strong metrics focus
Holds at least one professional cybersecurity-related senior certification (CISSP, CISM, CCISO, or equivalent)
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal. You’re a polished presenter. You can effectively read the situation and adjust your communication style to the audience
{Preferred} Experience with DevOps, Infrastructure-as-Code, Terraform, Docker, or Kubernetes
If you are ready to start the conversation about how you might contribute to all the happenings at PitchBook, submit your resume today! PitchBook appreciates and respects diversity, and as such, we are an equal opportunity employer.

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:

Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.


If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.


Our Client


Moving and tracking money is a slog, they make it easy. Building a compliant back-end can be a year’s long process that requires a team of accountant engineers, integration with your money moving stack, and lots of work making everything idempotent, traceable, and fault-tolerant. Like what Square, Robinhood, and Uber did. Our client provides the same features in an API.
They are a small founding team with deep experience in fintech infrastructure. They're backed by Gradient Ventures, Box Group, and angels from Uber, Square, Plaid, Robinhood, Index, Coinbase, and Alloy.
If you enjoy working with ambitious peers, reducing hard problems to their constituent parts, and changing how markets get built, we’d love to hear from you.

What you'll do

You'll work with a small engineering team to build mission-critical financial infrastructure for startups. For example, you might build the primitives for multi-currency payment orchestration for an SMB lending startup.

As one of our first engineers, you'll build products from scratch and have meaningful sway over our technology, our design principles, and the makeup of our team and culture.

You'll help assess, hire and mentor your future team.

Write technical blog posts (e.g. "here's how to build an SMB lending app") and documentation (e.g. if you build a payment NSF error-handler for the said lending app, you'll write the blog, the docs, and design the reference ledger for that vertical).

You're cool spending the majority of your time writing tests and thinking about how your code can fail.

What you'll bring:

3+ years experience in professional software development, ideally some of which you’ve spent in startups.

Experience with both relational and non-relational databases like DynamoDB, Cassandra, or Elasticsearch and building event-driven systems using message buses and queues like Kafka, SQS, or RabbitMQ.

Familiarity with serverless or micro-services architectures and deployment tools like CloudFormation, Kubernetes, or Serverless Framework.

Comfortable applying computer science theory to real-world concurrent, distributed systems.

A customer-first mindset and an interest in talking with customers to make sure what we’re building meets their needs.

Able to own the entire lifecycle of a feature, work with customers to design the API, write the docs, and help customers adopt and operate it.

Our client’s parental leave offers parents paid time off to spend quality time with family.

Tools

You’ll receive all new equipment including a laptop, monitor, phone, internet, gym membership, and any other accessories you need to do your best work.

founding team equity

We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer – Applications SW to join our team in developing tools and features for a novel multi-spectral cell imaging platform within our Flow Cytometry team. We are looking for a highly motivated and talented individual who will be comfortable in a fast-paced development environment and will be a key contributor to the software, algorithms and application development engineering team. At Luminex, our highest priority is developing innovative solutions for cell analysis applications using novel technologies. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be a part of our small team of algorithm and software developers working on cutting-edge technology products with focus on high throughput computer vision systems and high dimensional statistical data analysis software. Working closely with our biology and instrumentation engineering teams, you will help design and implement robust, creative and impactful solutions using advanced cellular analysis methods to support instrument operation and a variety of biological applications such as blood cell morphology analysis for disease detection, sperm cell morphology analysis for infertility studies, toxicity detection for drug development and algae analysis for biofuels.

What you will do

Design and Implement user-friendly interfaces for instrumentation and analysis software
Research instruments and new technology in the flow cytometry market to inform the development of easy to use and feature-rich software
Interact with hardware engineers, biologists, and other relevant stakeholders to develop use cases for new and existing products
Develop and document business requirements that support the use cases and provide the basis for system level testing
Translate business requirements into a structured, maintainable, easy to use user interface design that meets the product requirements
Play a key role in defining and designing a robust system-level SW architecture that can work across multiple SW products
Mock/prototype interfaces and present to stakeholders
Implement User interfaces in C++/Qt on Windows
Actively participate in the full software life cycle development
Using object-oriented methodologies, develop user interface software to meet product design specifications
Act as a senior advisor and mentor within the team and contribute to the technical direction and corresponding decision making within the team and beyond
Develop and execute unit level test plans to ensure software quality
Integrate and test user interface software with the real-time instrument server software
Participate in design and code reviews, and communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively both verbally and in writing
Track, debug, and resolve all issues detected in the application software
Assist customer support, service, and production with detection and resolution of any problems that may occur in-house or in the field

Education Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree (CS or CE preferred) required
Master's/Ph.D. Degree (CS or CE is preferred) preferred

Experience

Minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; 6 years with a Master’s degree; or 3 years with a PhD required
Experience with C++, especially enterprise multi-threaded applications desired
Experience with QT or other UI toolkits such as WPF, or Win forms desired
Experience defining requirements and/or architectural design desired
Experience with Data Modeling and Schema design with Relational and/or NoSQL databases desired. PostGres, SQLite, or RocksDB experience a plus.

Training and Skills

Interest in creating and maintaining customer focused Graphical User Interfaces (GUI)
Comfortable following best software engineering practices, including coding standards, code reviews, and testing
Experience with a version control system such as Git, Perforce, or others
Experience mentoring other developers
Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision
Ability to work with a team of software engineers to accomplish a common goal
Comfortable working throughout the software lifecycle development process (design, development, testing, release)
Strong organizational skills, flexibility to changing priorities and needs, attention to detail and accuracy, and multi-tasking ability
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Experience working in a multi-disciplinary environment such as in a life sciences company

Standard Working Conditions

Work onsite at Luminex office

Travel Requirements

Some travel may be required, less than 10% of the time

Job summary
The Team

Amazon Physical Stores is more start-up than big-company, a group of entrepreneurial, analytical, and creative leaders with innovation at our core. We’re pushing the state of the art in helping customers shop in engaging, fast, and safe ways. To date we’ve created stores that let you use an app to enter, take what you want from our fresh selection, and go (Amazon Go); a smart shopping cart that uses computer vision algorithms and sensor fusion to let you skip the checkout line (Amazon Dash Cart); and contactless services that let you pay, enter or identify yourself (Amazon One). Note: This role will support the Just Walk Out Tech organization that is enabling frictionless shopping experiences for convenience stores, full-size grocery stores, and through our 3rd party partner stores.

Our checkout-free shopping experience is made possible by our Just Walk Out Technology, which automatically detects when products are taken from or returned to the shelves and keeps track of them in a virtual cart. When you’re done shopping, you can just leave the store. Shortly after, we’ll charge your Amazon account and send you a receipt. Check it out at amazon.com/go. Designed and custom-built by Amazonians, our Just Walk Out Technology uses a variety of technologies including computer vision, sensor fusion, and advanced machine learning. Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earths’ most customer centric company and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in computer vision, machine learning, distributed systems and hardware design.

The Role
We're looking for a Sr Mgr., PM-T to lead a confidential technical product with dedicated engineering resources. This manager will lead both PM-Ts and UX Designers. The role requires a hands-on leadership and involvement in the day to day development and the ability to step back to see the high-level view to plan for the future growth of the organization.

Success in this role will include strength in growing your team and people leadership, forming strong partnerships across technology and business leaders, and comfort working in a hyper-growth and dynamic technical environment/business

Product Manager Job Responsibilities:

Lead the development of the product vision, strategy and roadmap
Create consensus for the product vision both internally and with key dev and research science partners
Work closely with software engineering, design, and business stakeholders to deliver features
Manage delivery of current products concurrently with future product planning
Actively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team’s ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals
Strong attention to detail and end-to-end ownership
Must be able to think creatively, deal with ambiguity, and manage changing priorities
Strong verbal/written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Have a passion for innovation and scaling operations.
MBA from business school, or a BS in Computer Science or related technical field from a top engineering school.
Experience managing complex digital products or applications.
High attention to detail with proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
Analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary; general manager / owner mentality.
Demonstrated ability to dive deep in understanding the product, our business, and the competitive landscape.

A successful candidate will have experience envisioning, designing, deploying, and supporting information systems and services. The nature of the work requires someone who is comfortable leading through uncertainty and working across a complex set of stakeholders to understand and prioritize requirements. Additionally, they will utilize their skill set to develop data pipelines and analytics solutions with a tenacity for solving for unstructured data and enabling self-service, on-demand capabilities to support the business. About Stellar Health:

Historically, US Healthcare has relied on a fee-for-service reimbursement system where providers are paid based on the quantity of patient visits and procedures instead of the quality of health outcomes.. Stellar Health helps primary care providers continually engage with their patients by providing them real-time information and tangible action-based incentives for improving quality of care for their patients.

At Stellar Health, we're simplifying value-based care. The Stellar platform, a cloud-based, point-of-care tool, fits into existing provider workflows and creates a simple checklist of recommended actions that helps deliver the best quality care for patients. We're building our technology from the ground up, and the industry is starting to take notice.

Our product actively supports over 400K patient lives - and we have shown that we make a real difference for these practices and their patients. It's an exciting time to join the Stellar Team: We recently raised a $60M Series B at a $460M valuation from Top VCs in the health-tech space (General Atlantic, Point72, & Primary Venture Partners), have an established product & proven operating model, and we're scaling our team to meet the continued growth and impact on our healthcare system.

Stellar is looking for a Director of Engineering with a servant leadership mindset to lead our consumer facing teams through our next phase of growth.

Our engineering team grew substantially in 2020 and we rolled out infrastructure updates, new features, and updates to existing workflows. We also grew the size of our team, bringing in new engineering and product talent.

2021 is going to be another exciting year of growth for us; we have an exciting roadmap and we'll continue to hire talented engineers for our team. As our team's headcount continues to grow we are looking for experienced leaders to join our team.

The consumer side of our engineering team is responsible for building the features and the technical infrastructure that our increasing number of Users use. The team has a wide area of ownership for complex features that are used by Clinicians and Staff in our more than 400 Medical Groups. Their responsibility is to build best-in-class user experiences, reliable infrastructure and all the systems that support the increasing complexity of our application and the growth of our user base.

Who will love this job:

You are excited about a role that asks you to lead by example and you adhere to a servant leadership mindset
You have the ability to wear many hats and work effectively with senior business stakeholders
You get things done and you love working in a dynamic environment; we move quickly and we need a leader who will too
You understand, appreciate, and enjoy the responsibility and accountability that comes with being assigned high-level ownership over projects and their success
You are looking to learn and grow, knowing that this position will involve a lot of ambiguity to deal with, with the support from the organization and senior leadership to help you navigate it
You've worked in a fast paced, scaled environment in the past and are now looking to step into a role where you have full ownership over the vision

What you'll do:

Build a best in class user experience for our consumer facing application
Own the technical direction and impact of the frontend - be responsible for consistently delivering iterations to existing modules, as well as building new modules
Ensure that best practices are commonly followed across all squads whether it's sprints, software design docs, or conducting post-mortems. You'll be responsible for ensuring that all stages of a healthy software development org are running and in order
Own the evolution of our architecture to maintain speed and velocity, especially as our platform scales
Manage and grow User Facing Squads, while actively participating in the recruiting and retention of team members
Actively contribute to Stellar's Engineering Culture, helping to shape our processes and best practices
Serve as a mentor to Managers and as an example to more junior members of the engineering team
Set consistent standards for technical excellence; and managing your team to do the same
Work closely with our CTO to make sure that engineering is aligned on product roadmaps, specifications, and priorities

You should have:

Experience growing and scaling teams, ideally within a modern startup environment.
An ability to think strategically and spot the long run technical risks and tradeoffs
Proven experience managing engineering managers on multiple squads, and an ability to keep the trains running on time
Experience working cross-functionality and with senior stakeholders to understand and communicate expectations and the technical needs of the business
BSc/MSc in Engineering, Computer Science or relevant field

Pay, Perks & Such:

We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverages, a 401k program and flexible vacation.

Note on COVID response:

At this time, Stellar is fully remote although our NYC-based office is open for those who wish to use it. Starting in January 2022, we will transition to a hybrid work environment for Stellar NYC employees and will be supporting both in-office and fully remote work. If you would like to learn more about our COVID response measures and Return to Office plans, please mention this when you speak with a Stellar Recruiter.

Diversity is the key to our success. Stellar Health is an equal opportunity employer and we are open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

We believe that diverse teams -and the different identities, cultures, and life experiences our team members bring to the table- enable us to create amazing products, find creative solutions to interesting problems, and build an inclusive working environment.

We encourage everyone to apply to our roles, even if they do not meet every single qualification on a job description, and our team is committed to reviewing every resume submitted.

About us:

Project Archer is an Augmented Reality studio based in the Seattle area. We are a team of engineers, designers, innovators and creators dedicated to paving the way for augmented reality applications in the retail space. Our focus is on functional use cases that merge diverse data streams and personalized information with specific physical locations to create productive and entertaining immersive real-world shopping experiences.

What you’ll do:

Project Archer is looking for an experienced Desktop Support Specialist who will report directly to our Director of IT. This highly customer-focused role includes assisting Project Archer employees with technical support of desktop computers, laptops, applications, mobile devices, and related technology. Other duties of this role also include setup of local and remote new hires including building user accounts, email accounts, all related system access and roles, imaging and deploying computers and supporting deployed systems.

This role requires independent analysis, strong communication, reliability, and excellent problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate must be comfortable with frequent unannounced requests and the ability to handle these requests in a friendly and timely manner. You will have success in this role if you are able to change gears quickly, balance numerous tasks in tandem and do so in a fast paced environment with little supervision.

Performs a full range of computer administration functions with minimal direction and/or technical support following process, while helping develop expedient procedures and helping to continually improve IT.
Install and configure system hardware, software, printers and verify network connectivity.
Perform advanced troubleshooting and technical liaison functions.
Design and implement troubleshooting and correction plans, develop and coordinate user training programs and documenting all processes and procedures.
Assist in coordination of testing changes, upgrades and new software products, ensuring systems will operate correctly in current and future environments.
Make recommendations on functional and technical improvements to the environment.
Participate in performance and volume analysis and design.
Participate in meetings and projects as assigned.

Provide technical support for desktops, laptops, printers, software and other associated hardware connected to a user’s device.
Provide limited training to the end users for them to achieve minimal performance in computing.

Knowledge of PC and laptop hardware components (external and internal).

Reliable /demonstrated written and verbal communication and customer service skills.

Demonstrated ability to manage priorities and tasks assigned.
3+ years of experience installing, troubleshooting operating systems for PCs in addition to core productivity applications like Office365, multiple browsers, and other software
Experience using remote tools to support remote end - users and systems.

Bonus Points:

Excellent analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Quick learner, can understand and apply existing and new technologies.


- Experience working in a team - oriented, collaborative environment.

Experience writing documentation, both wiki “howto’s” and IT processes.

- Mac and PC administration experience in a managed -environment (Active Directory, Azure AD, Intune, Jamf, etc)

Come and join the Microsoft Browser Data Science team where we thrive on data to solve high impact business problems! We enable data driven decisions by converting data into insights that enhance customer experiences and improve business performance.
We partner closely with Engineering, Marketing, and Finance teams to answer key questions related to product adoption, engagement, satisfaction and monetization. Our work requires regular collaboration with our partner teams as well as technical expertise to mine big datasets and discover key insights.
To support this mission, we are looking for Business Analysts who have a passion for analyzing big data to uncover customer usage insights and driving those insights into actions with our partner teams.
The ideal candidate should be self-directed, passionate about data, and focused on delivering the right results. The candidate should be able to understand product strategy and business goals and apply programming acumen and a breadth of tools, data sources and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and present the insights in a concise and effective manner. Experience partnering with data scientists to develop business metrics and related insights is a big plus. Technical aptitude and programming skills are necessary in this role. The candidate should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to different audiences ranging from executives to engineering feature teams.
Responsibilities
Build a holistic understanding of our product features, its customer, data infrastructure, product and business goals
Analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques
Develop analytical data sets in Azure or internal Big Data Environments which can be used to for analytics and data science
Understand business performance (trends, funnels) as well as answer product and business questions to drive product and marketing actions
Build and maintain learning plans for the product(s) with key analytical questions
Leverage industry best practices in establishing repeatable BI practices, principles & processes
Partner with Data Scientists to develop deep insights into product performance and communicate those to both technical & non-technical audiences.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
4+ years of relevant industry experience
Experience with database technology with solid understanding and hands-on skills with SQL Server, SSIS, solid understanding of SSAS / n-dimensional cubes
Preferred Qualifications:
BS/MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, Automation, Physics, or other engineering or science fields
Unique mix of technical, development, project and program management skills
Ability to understand, translate and map business and product questions into analysis projects

Join Our Team: Do Meaningful Work and Improve People’s Lives

Our purpose, to improve customers’ lives by making healthcare work better, is far from ordinary. And so are our employees. Working at Premera means you have the opportunity to drive real change by transforming healthcare.

To better serve our customers, we’re creating a culture that promotes employee growth, collaborative innovation, and inspired leadership. We are committed to creating an environment where employees can do their best work and where best-in-class talent comes, stays, and thrives!
COVID-19 Vaccination Policy:
On September 9 2021, President Joe Biden issued an executive order requiring the vaccination of employees at federal contractors. Premera Blue Cross, as a health plan within the federal employee benefits program, is designated as a federal contractor. Premera has implemented a new requirement for all employees, including telecommuters, to either show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19 or have an approved medical or religious accommodation (based on a disability/medical condition or sincerely held religious belief), by January 1, 2022. From the onset of the pandemic, Premera has remained committed to the health and well-being of our employees, customers and communities.
As a new employee you will be required to show proof of being fully vaccinated within your first five days of employment or request an accommodation prior to your start date.
Data powers all the decisions we make at Premera. It is the ‘secret sauce’ to help and improve the health of people we serve. The combination of the health industry standards and the fast-growing data sources makes data flow at Premera complex and challenging.
The Corporate Data and Analytics team is looking for a Data Engineer III to help create, modify, and test the code, forms, and scripts that construct the data sets that drive our Data Science and Business Intelligence capabilities. This work is derived from specifications developed in collaboration with those consuming or interacting with those data sets. You will work to develop and write solutions to store, locate, and retrieve specific documents, data, and information and distribute through multiple methods. They will perform ETL (extract, transform, load) processes. As they continue to build knowledge and expertise in this area, they will follow professional standards and best practices as well as departmental guidelines to independently solve problems of moderate scope and complexity.
What you'll Do:
Solve business and data science problems using data centric programming and scripting skills to create data models and pipelines.
Work closely with the business to create understanding of the needs, pace and direction for our business partners. Translate these needs into requirements and specifications and maintain contact with the customers throughout project completion.
Troubleshoot issues as they arise and solve problems independently and collaboratively.
Collaborate with data scientists and other analysts to further understand business problems.
Develop code to complete effective solutions using applicable technology.
Perform thorough peer design and code reviews
Use developing data ETL experience to develop data pipelines to support data product automation
What you'll Bring:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or similar area and 5 years’ experience in data integration, design and management (required)
A knowledge of software development lifecycle, relational database theory, and skills to utilize one or more programming languages
Familiarity with healthcare specific regulatory requirements for data management.
Experience providing data integration services within healthcare organizations.
Knowledge of Tableau, SAS, R, and other analytic tools.

POSITION: SAP Business Analyst
REPORTS TO: Head of IT Operations
DEPARTMENT: Information Technologies
STATUS: Exempt
TWINSTRAND BIOSCIENCES OVERVIEW
TwinStrand Biosciences is a Seattle-based genomics company focused on developing cutting-edge approaches for early detection of cancer, treatment optimization, and risk prediction using our ultra-accurate TwinStrand Duplex Sequencing™ technology. Our technology enables researchers and clinicians to detect genetic “needles in a haystack.” By identifying ultra-low frequency DNA mutations with a resolution 10,000-fold greater than conventional tools on the market, TwinStrand enables detection, quantification, and characterization of variants that were previously undetectable. We have recently closed a $50 million Series B financing and will continue our accelerated growth to make a difference in life sciences and medicine.
POSITION OVERVIEW
We are seeking an individual with experience and expertise in integrating third-party web applications with an existing ERP to meet our growing business needs. Your role as SAP Business Analyst will be to create workflows that enable data to flow between SAP and our numerous outside services. You will also be a liaison for all teams within TwinStrand, spearheading projects relating to SAP integration, and ensuring the necessary data is flowing to and from SAP.
TwinStrand utilizes a predominantly cloud-based infrastructure with very little on-premises. Success in this role will require interfacing with cloud vendors and getting support from those vendors to create the necessary connections and communications between them and SAP.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage connectivity between existing services and SAP B1 to ensure necessary data is flowing properly.
Manage relations with existing vendors and establish new relations with new vendors as we continue to grow.
Respond to any errors, leveraging vendor support when necessary to circumvent issues with data flow.
Work with project leaders across TwinStrand to identify new solutions for their respective needs, and ensure the necessary data is exchanged between these new services and SAP B1.
Manage projects to create workflows with new services and vendors, including project initialization, blueprinting, project realization, final preparation, go-live, and post go-live support.
Provide training to employees on effective usage of SAP B1 and the related cloud services.
Edit existing and create new Crystal Report documents such as Sales Orders, Packing Slips, Invoices, etc. as needed by various teams/departments.

EXPERIENCE AND CAPABILITIES
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience.
Three to five years of experience in SAP B1 and integrations.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel.
Ability to troubleshoot issues between disparate cloud services and SAP B1.
Experience in Crystal Reports template creation and editing.
Experience with the following cloud platforms:
Salesforce
Atlassian Jira/Confluence/Wiki
SmartSheet
OUTSTANDING CANDIDATES WILL
Have the ability to think outside the box and work in a non-traditional IT shop.
Be able to work in an agile fashion to support a fast-paced growing start-up.
Have experience creating custom API’s to integrate different platforms that don’t have built-in integration capabilities.
Bonus if you have experience with Boyum, iDocuments, and any other SAP partners/add-ons.

PHYSICAL AND TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
Prolonged periods of sitting or standing at a desk and working on a computer.
Travel is not anticipated for this position.

WHAT WE OFFER
A mission to be proud of. You will help to provide access to a technology with unprecedented sensitivity that makes it possible to solve previously unsolvable scientific problems in basic research and translational medicine, with direct and immediate benefits to human health.
Beautiful new waterfront facility overlooking Puget Sound, centrally located in downtown Seattle.
Competitive compensation plan.
Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental and vision benefits for employees and dependents, sponsored life, short and long-term disability insurance, and 401(k) retirement savings plan.
Subsidized transportation program: parking, bus, ferry, rideshare and more.
Onsite gym, showers, bike storage.
Social events, weekly happy hours, well-stocked kitchen.
Recognition that outside life exists and is important, that flexibility is needed for family and that work can sometimes be effectively carried out remotely.
Casual, but high-performing work environment.

ABOUT TWINSTRAND BIOSCIENCES
We are a vibrant, young company committed to applying a powerful new genomic technology across disciplines to improve human health and accelerate scientific discovery. Our mission is to develop and deliver the unprecedented accuracy of duplex sequencing for applications in the life sciences and medicine where it can do the greatest good for the maximum number of people.
Our business is multifaceted and encompasses internal development projects, external collaborations, and empowering of our partner organizations and customers. Our mission is strongly rooted in academic principles of responsible citizenship within the broader scientific community, yet executed with the nimbleness of a startup, such that research can be rapidly translated into solutions that benefit the scientific and medical community. To the greatest extent possible, we strive for open sharing of knowledge and discovery through academic presentations and peer-reviewed publications.
At TwinStrand we put a premium on creativity, dynamic thinking and a rigorous scientific approach. You will be challenged to push the boundaries of your knowledge, skills and comfort zone and to take ownership of your area of expertise. We expect all team members to take on some form of leadership role over time and mentor new team members as we continue to expand. We want every member of our community to come to work excited each day and able to take pride in the high-quality science to improve human health that they are contributing to.
TwinStrand Biosciences is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Coinstar is the global leader in coin recycling and redemption. Beyond coin, Coinstar has been expanding and growing into other products that enable cash-preferred or underbanked consumers to digitize their currency and transact online. We are looking for a product owner who will contribute to the product strategy and own the solutioning and delivery of these new products.

The Product Manager is responsible for driving all phases of product initiatives and building solid, collaborative relationships across the organization with regard to cash-in, pay-with-cash and financial service products. This position communicates the vision and business value through storytelling and data and shares ideas and concepts between business and technical parties. The Product Manager works alongside a team of high-performing Product Managers and Engineers, and partners closely with senior leaders across several divisions within Coinstar to drive the strategy for our financial services product offering. This role thinks strategically and executes methodically focusing on building the right long-term solutions while delivering short to mid-term incremental results.

Key Responsibilities

Assist in the development of the product vision and strategy (from concept to launch) supported by internal and external analysis with an ultimate goal to identify and optimize the top business drivers for growth.
Develop detailed, crisp business requirements and user stories that can be used to create product specifications and architecture for each product.
Deepen product relevance by building empathy for the customer and understanding of their needs.
Use product data and analytics, AB testing, and other sources of customer and market feedback to track and support product decisions.
Partner effectively with various internal teams, including software and hardware engineering, QA, technical support, sales and customer service; understand their role and needs in supporting the product.
Work closely with marketing to ensure alignment on user experience and marketing strategy.
Collaborate with other stakeholders on crafting the user experience, and safeguarding usability and simplicity.
Develop and maintain a robust working knowledge base of the industry, the category as well as the needs and wants of the customer in order to deepen product relevance and build toward product success.
Provide input to prioritization and trade-offs among customer experience, performance, and operational support.

Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree required.
5+ years’ product management experience in a consumer-facing, financial services, software-based business, with a focus on alternative payments or cryptocurrency.
Experience with kiosks or ATM’s/POS devices preferred
Understanding of Agile software development methodologies, values and procedures; experience working with technical and other teams in an agile environment.
Deep understanding of business fundamentals across multiple domains, including payments, alternative financial services and retail.
Experience with data and metrics and to make analytics-based product decisions.
Certification as Scrum product owner is a plus.
Background in program/project management a plus.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Excellent business acumen with ability to build business cases and launch and grow products.
Highly analytical, inventive, customer and team oriented, and have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines.
Natural ability to influence and collaborate with multiple functions throughout the company.
Ability to manage feature releases in a lean product, iterative environment
Ability to prioritize complex deliverables, understand and discuss technical concepts, manage trade-offs, and run meetings with technical and business leaders.
Ability to establish trusted partnerships with other company leaders.
Excellent written and oral communication.
Comfortable creating a product vision, using tools such as wireframes and user experience flows (with support from creative design team); user-centered design or design thinking skills a plus.
Proven financial modeling and business analysis with an ability to mine for data as required.
Demonstrated skills in building and executing a “go-to-market” strategy.
Must be naturally inquisitive with relentless attention to detail in order to optimize product performance.
Demonstrated leadership skills with a proven ability to lead through influence vs. authority.

Location & Travel:

This position is located in Bellevue, WA (Seattle area) but remote/WFH arrangements are welcome as many peer team members are remote today. This position requires some, likely limited, business travel.

Benefits

We believe that continued good health, financial security and work-life balance are important. We offer a complete, progressive benefits package including an outstanding healthcare plan, 401k match (immediately vested), generous paid time-off, paid parental and adoption leave, corporate matched giving, and more. In addition, we have a casual and flexible work environment with work from home options.

EEO Statement

We are Coinstar because of our people. We value and embrace their unique and diverse talents, perspectives and experiences and strive to build an environment where each individual can bring their best self to work. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Coinstar will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please contact our Human Resources team via AskHR@coinstar.com. We believe that diversity and inclusion makes us a better, more innovative and successful company, and we seek to recruit and retain a diverse talent pool. Even if you do not meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply.

Physical Requirements

Sedentary work involves remaining in a stationary position most of the time in front of a computer, using a keyboard, mouse and telephone. Regularly operate a computer and other office equipment. Occasionally move about the work site to access file cabinets, office equipment, etc. Exert up to 10 lbs. of force occasionally, and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or regularly move objects. Communicate and exchange information with co-workers and other individuals in person and electronically.

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

At PitchBook we work to provide global professionals with comprehensive data on the entire venture capital, private equity and M&A landscape so they can discover and execute opportunities with confidence. We credit our success and rapid growth to our cutting-edge products, customer centered attitude and ability to embrace and drive change.

In just over a decade, PitchBook has reached over 1,300 global employees with offices worldwide, and we’re not slowing down! Consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work, our culture is at the heart of our success and is driven by excellence, inclusion and fun. At PitchBook we’re committed to fostering an open and collaborative work environment.

About the Role:
PitchBook Product Managers work collaboratively with key stakeholders and project teams to deliver value to customers. This role actively influences product roadmap, feature prioritization and user experience. PitchBook Product Managers establish project goals, measure business impact and identify additional opportunities of success for the PitchBook Platform.


This role would be focused on the platform market intelligence experience. The role will own key features and datasets that help investors and strategic decision makers discover, analyze, and monitor what’s going on in their industry.

As a product manager working on the PitchBook Platform, you will build exciting solutions that deliver value to our constantly growing user base. We are looking for a Product Manager to drive the roadmap for one of our key growth areas – Market Intelligence.


You will have a unique opportunity to create the tools and experiences our clients use to understand the latest activity and events in the markets that matter to them. You will work closely with designers, developers and other teams across PitchBook to build experiences that enable our clients to easily turn PitchBook private and public market data into invaluable insights.

Primary Job Responsibilities:
Validate client needs, pain points, and business opportunities through ongoing user and market research
Become a SME in the product area, including understanding user needs and workflows
Passionately data driven and willing to get messy with data analysis.
Actively influence product roadmap prioritization and create business cases for new opportunities
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders and project teams to execute your product roadmap
Create detailed functional specifications from prioritized requirements.
Communicate requirements and project details to stakeholders, including engineering teams
Continuously improve our external and internal deliverables and operational processes
Establish project goals, measure your business impact, and identify additional opportunities for success
Present to stakeholders on product functionality and vision
Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested
Develop vision for features like Alerts, Similar Companies, and Company News

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, or related field
1+ years of software product management experience
Bias for action. Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do what is necessary to meet team goals
Experience gathering customer-centric requirements
Superior attention to detail including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong audience awareness
Thrive in ambiguous situations, motivated by the opportunity to work with teams to define a clear course of action
Eager to become an expert on private and public capital markets
Experience working with ML teams is a plus
Experience building alerting systems a plus
If you are ready to start the conversation about how you might contribute to all the happenings at PitchBook, submit your resume today! PitchBook appreciates and respects diversity, and as such, we are an equal opportunity employer.

Work hard, have fun, and make history at Amazon Web Services!

The AWS Kumo Software Team is searching for an innovative, passionate, and customer-focused product manager with a track record of delivery. We are looking for a relentless self-starter that will boldly do what’s best for the business to serve our customers; someone with a true pioneering spirit, willing to “get hands dirty” in a start-up environment while being able to optimize delivery against both short and long term goals.

The role:
You will be responsible for defining a low-code/ no-code experience to enable our tool builders to build diagnostic and troubleshooting tools used by support agents to deliver our world-class Support. You will partner with multiple software engineering teams to build cohesive user experiences across all these tools, resulting in reduced handle time of support issues and high customer satisfaction. Our investments in this area help resolve customer issues faster while reducing our internal costs, largely by automating best practices and providing better tooling. You will also ensure that our world-wide support teams can easily build and contribute their own tooling to meet a growing set of AWS use cases. Your customers include Support Engineers, Cloud Support Associates, and Technical Account Managers. You will be at the forefront of Cloud technologies with interactions across the full breadth of AWS services.

The Team:
The AWS Kumo team provides technology and trusted expertise that intelligently anticipate and resolve AWS customer needs, helping them adopt, optimize, and operate at scale. Kumo’s products, used by AWS customers and the support teams that help them, are vital to ensuring exceptional customer experiences on AWS. Our team owns customer facing applications like Trusted Advisor, Personal Health Dashboard, AWS Forums, and Support Center and multiple internal tooling systems. We are a highly innovative global organization revolutionizing the way customers engage and seek help from AWS. Support provides a strategic advantage for customers adopting AWS and drives direct revenue to the business.


Prior experience as a developer or in building tools for customer support
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to influence others internally and externally
Ability to analyze data, problem-solve, and scope business requirements
Understands core technologies utilized in this product domain
Fluent in technical alternatives/pros and cons and ability to partner with software teams
Decomposes significantly complex technical propositions into straightforward solutions
Strong understanding of the cloud industry
Experience creating service offerings for Enterprise level customers
Experience creating B2B service offerings that cater to a wide audience
Experience managing Software-as-a-Service technology products
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role

We are the office of the CTO for Microsoft, part of the Technology and Research (T&R) organization. Besides our regular jobs of gathering information, synthesizing recommendations, and enabling our engineering teams to achieve more, we are technology explorers. We work with a distinguished set of engineers exploring technology trends such as the Intelligent Edge, Intelligent Car, Conversational AI, AI/ML, OSS, and data security & privacy. We help take the very best ideas and turn them into business strategies and products.
We keep close track of, and often deeply explore, relevant product & research efforts across the company, the industry (competition and startups), the open-source community, and the research world to maintain perspective of the area, keeping a balance between breadth and depth. In addition, we engage closely with many contributors and leaders from relevant product & research teams (PMs, engineers, scientists, GPMs, EMs, DEs/TFs, VPs) to educate our point of view on issues/opportunities and together define concrete action plans to tackle them. In the process, we provide insights to our CTO and the SLT, connect teams & people, drive company-wide workstreams, bootstrap incubation projects & POC efforts, and engage on activities that move the needle on Microsoft’s strategic and technical direction.
Responsibilities
We are looking for a technical advisor that is passionate about exploring new technology, writing code, exploring business and research impact, working with partners, and moving ideas from wonder to results. This person should communicate well, be fluent in tech speak, and maintain a solid grounding in customer empathy. We need a curious and excited technologist that’s able to help shape musings into solid product and business objectives. This person should be comfortable working on a great team that has market changing ideas and wants to help transform those ideas into reality.
We need someone experienced with engineering, from ideation to product realization, that excels at working with and influencing a broad set of people across the company. To move us onto a proactive innovative footing, we will use your ability to grasp and articulate the visions of our finest thinkers and turn them into product.
Our team values a friendly, collaborative atmosphere with a passion for technology. We believe strongly that a diverse team that applies empathy and leverages high quality communication skills helps us deliver superior product and is key to our success.
Qualifications
Required qualifications
Masters degree in Computer Science or related field, or 10+ years in a technically focused developer or program/product manager role.
Experience shipping software on a cloud using at least two of C#, Python, SQL, C/C++, Java.
Preferred Qualifications
MBA
Strong leadership, organizational, written, and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated cross-discipline and cross-group collaboration skills
Proven track record of influencing a dynamic set of partners and stakeholders with competing interests toward win-win outcomes
Ability to think strategically and work independently in highly ambiguous scenarios
Technical expertise with distributed systems, CNCF (K8s, Prometheus, Flux, Helm, …), relational and NoSQL data stores, CI/CD, and Containers & Microservices

We see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset. It acts like a compass for us. We are fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that’s not just words on the walls.
Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It’s an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.
We make software robots, so people don’t have to be robots. Would you like to be part of this journey?
About Us

Welcome. We are UiPath and we believe in using the transformative power of automation to liberate the boundless potential of people. A world with a robot for every person is our goal.

We’re dedicated to delivering the Fully Automated Enterprise™, one where companies use automation to unlock unlimited growth opportunities.

UiPath offers an end-to-end platform for automation, combining the leading Robotic Process Automation(RPA) solution with a full suite of capabilities and techs like AI, Process Mining, and Cloud to enable every organization to rapidly scale digital business operations.

Our company is known for it’s culture - values humility, and leaders who know how to listen. CEO Daniel Dines’ primary goal was to build a company where he would love to work, and even now, with thousands of employees in tens of countries, that remains our top priority.
We trust and empower our colleagues, and together we make sure we have everything we need to do our best work, from the support of strong leaders to awesome perks and benefits.

If you want to change the future of work together, continue reading and apply if you are a fit.

Inspire the entire team and our internal partners by bringing new ideas to the table and defining next-generation interfaces.
Create high-quality interactive prototypes to communicate your work. Leverage user research and data to inform your reasonings.
Stay up to date on emerging technologies and make proposals on how to bring the best new ideas to our product.
Continuously improve engineering practices to increase quality, velocity and productivity. As a senior engineer, help more junior engineers develop new skills and advance in their careers.
Participate in hiring and attracting top industry talent.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
7+ years of hands-on design and development experience in UI/front-end development.
At least 1 years of experience directly working on Design Systems (ex: material-ui, ant.design, polaris, etc.)
Passion about building amazing UX/UI.
Must be highly knowledgeable in JavaScript, Typescript, CSS/SCSS, HTML. Experience in modern UI frameworks: react, angular, vue, etc.
You have a strong understanding of how to build components that are atomic, composable, and reusable.
You care about the under-the-hood details that can make the difference between interfaces that are performant and accessible, versus those that merely look good.
Fundamental knowledge in web related security concepts.
Strong communication, collaboration and creative problem-solving skills.
Self-directed and capable of working effectively in a highly innovative and fast-paced environment. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.

Job Description
Are you an experienced engineer with a solid understanding of multiple virtualization technologies in a large-scale technology environment? Does the challenge of building infrastructure containers across public and private cloud providers excite you? If yes, then come join us as we bring automation, infrastructure as code and DevOps culture to our infrastructure as a service organization. This position is critical to Nordstrom’s overall strategy and will directly affect our success in revenue and enhancement of the overall customer experience.
This position contributes to the creation and maintenance of Nordstrom’s compute and storage policies, governance, principles and direction of hypervisor and cloud-based infrastructure. Provides subject matter expertise on open-source technologies, server hardware specifications, and virtual/cloud enabling infrastructures. He or she contributes to the efforts to ensure security, compliance, performance, service level agreements, operating level agreements and operation standards are met for the core server, storage, and virtual infrastructure. This engineer additionally contributes to our enterprise architectural decisions, focusing speed and systems delivery. Candidates must be a self-starter, have a broad technical background, possess both critical thinking and analytical skills and must be able to manage many tasks at any given time.
In this role, you will:Implement and champion enterprise storage and hyper-converged systems technologies within our organization.Help manage data protection processes across enterprise data protection infrastructureBuild automation to assist in reconciliation exercises for enterprise storage capacityWork closely with both development and operations teams with a demonstrated commitment to their success.Have the ability to work independently or within the team, drive projects forward, provide technical updates to leadership and communicate clearly and transparentlyRepresent Nordstrom in the technical community, which can include participating in conferences and contributing to open source.Demonstrate a passion and commitment towards advancing on-premises and hybrid cloud technologies at enterprise scale.Review clustering, replication, backup and archiving options, ensure they are designed and configured optimally for the business needs.Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation
Minimum Qualifications:
4+ years of experience in an engineering capacity directly supporting industry standard storage, data protection and virtualization platforms.
Strong comprehension and experience with at least 2 of the following storage systems: Dell/EMC, Pure Storage, and NetApp.
Experience with fiber channel switching infrastructure (preferably Cisco) and maintenance.
Experience with ESXi and VSAN for an enterprise at scale.
Experience with Python, Go, PowerShell and/or Unix shell scripting.
Understanding of software development methodologies and practices, including agile development, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
Experience demonstrating, meeting, and reporting on goals, metrics, and objectives; adhering to technology operations strategies and practices.
Ability and skill to influence others in a matrix organization; Ability to participate with management in decision support mode.
Strong at design, implementation, operation and troubleshooting of storage and virtualized systems.
Ability to review others work (including code, system and network design work, and other documentation), and maintain appropriate documentation.
Desire and flexibility to continually learn and develop new skills.
Desired Qualifications:
4-year college degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Experience with NAS.
Experience with Linux/system administration.
Experience with Dell PowerFlex.
Experience with Backup and Recovery solutions such as Avamar, Data Domain, Cloudboost (or other Cloud back up solutions).
An understanding of the complexities around security and compliance in a public or hybrid cloud environment (firewalls, PCI operations, etc).
Experience with Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, or similar technology.
Experience with Git or other source control.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code and/or Infrastructure automation.
Experience with managing capacity and infrastructure lifecycle in large hyper-converged environments.
Familiarity with system monitoring solutions for alerting and capacity management.
General awesomeness, positive attitude, and passion huge benefit.
Who You are:You contribute to Nordstrom’s success by focusing on continuously improving how we manage public cloud services and the on-premises infrastructure that brings it together.You are biased towards action.You thrive in an environment where each individual is focused on a common goal, where collaboration is favored over competition.This role requires a mixture of consulting, engineering, and support work.You have an ability to deliver the level of customer service for which Nordstrom is famous, our application teams utilizing cloud are our customer and we aim to delight them with each interaction.We would love to hear about it if you contribute to open source, write a blog, or otherwise participate in the technical community.

Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability

Job summary
This leader will be in a position to innovate and build technology solutions that systematically ensure adherence to different privacy promises across critical data handling applications. The problem space is increasingly interesting with exponential growth in scale of data and applications subject to privacy promises, dealing with multiple ML modeling data formats, and augmenting the experience and innovation of our customers. Our Customers include Scientists, Data Analysts, Product Owners, and the Alexa end users.

A day in the life

Works closely with product management and design to define strategy and requirements
Collaborate with legal, privacy, audit and risk stakeholders to improve privacy posture
Lead development team from concept through delivery and subsequent operation. And, evolve and organize the team with the growing ownership, and responsibilities of the team.
Actively coaches leaders on the team and own their career development

About the hiring group

SAIF Privacy & Risk is part of Secure AI Foundations (SAIF) and our vision is to systematically enforce adherence to Privacy promises for Alexa customer voice data (Audio, Transcripts and Alexa Responses), and eliminate risks with exposure of such data across technology services, Amazon employees and external actors. We will achieve the vision via proactive identification of risks to privacy promises, building mitigating technology controls, and establishing continuous closed loop audit for measuring effectiveness.

Job responsibilities

This SDM on SAIF Privacy will own Privacy initiatives on assurance of customer promises and systematic policy adherence. This leader will be responsible for the defining the product and technical roadmap to systematically ensure adherence to privacy promises for Alexa Voice data. A key requirement is to be able to dive deep and actively participate in building data detection and deletion solutions that help other Alexa teams meet the end customer privacy promises. The leader is supposed to force multiply the team value by partnering with all stakeholders including legal, business, and ML research and development community to connect the dots between promises made and solutions devised to meet the promises.


Deep hands-on technical experience with developing and maintaining large scale cloud and big data services.
Strong business and technical vision.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
A deep understanding of software development in a team, and a track record of shipping software on time in a highly innovative and fast paced environment.
Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical, and Business approaches, and lead

engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions.

Prior experience with AWS technologies.

At the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation we believe that by creating an environment for our employees to personally and professionally thrive, we will have maximum impact toward our missions to achieve our vision.
To learn more about our vision and missions, please visit our website at www.gatesfoundation.org.
To learn more about career opportunities at the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, please visit our Careers site at www.gatesfoundation.org/careers.
Leadership & Culture
Our culture shapes our choices about what we do and how we do it. We believe that energized people, working well together, fueled by great leadership in an inclusive environment can do extraordinary things. We expect foundation employees to intentionally and consistently embody our four agreements; show respect, offer trust, be transparent, and create energy.
Group Summary
We are inspired by the mission, All Lives Have Equal Value, and are compelled by the opportunity to make an impact. Along with our partners, we take on complex challenges; we continually test new approaches and embrace change where it will facilitate the best outcome. Thus, the Human Resources organization is on a mission to evolve how we work by: pushing for greater transparency so people have access to information they need to make smart decisions, creating energy to support a thriving workforce, showing respect so everyone can bring their best authentic self to work every day.
Position Summary
As the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation continues to focus on improving the impact of our work through a data-driven approach to DEI, we are seeking a Data Scientist, DEI to join our People Analytics team in Human Resources. The Data Scientist, DEI will design and implement analytics-driven solutions in and outside of the function for the foundation’s most pressing human capital priorities. This role’s primary focus will be on supporting the foundation’s diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) efforts but may also include support for other foundation initiatives including: organizational and team effectiveness analyses (e.g., manager effectiveness) and talent analytics (e.g., hiring, career movement, retention and talent diversity impacts).
The Data Scientist, DEI role is responsible for distilling and delivering the output of multivariate cross-purpose analyses into useful insights that enable the foundation to improve its processes and decision-making strategies to result in key business outcomes. Key to success in this role is the ability serve as a strategic partner and consultant to leadership within the DEI Center of Excellence, HR, Operations and with cross-foundation senior & executive leadership.
Core Responsibilities
Design, document, implement and maintain an ongoing measurement strategy for DEI, aligned to the business strategy – defining metrics, dimensions, data sources, targets and tactics to serve as a guidepost for driving business outcomes.
Create technical documents and white papers summarizing analytics research projects, including executive summaries for presentation to senior & executive leadership.
Use data and analysis methodologies (including statistical modeling, survey design/analysis and reporting) to address business questions or problems and uncover insights that support foundation leaders in making strategic, data-driven decisions.
Provide data, analysis and reporting (data visualization) deliverables in support of foundation programs, policies or initiatives. Present resulting analysis, context and key insights to senior leaders.
Core Knowledge and Skills
People Analytics Background
At least 3 years working within the field of HR/people analytics
Statistical Competence & Applied Approaches to HR
Familiarity with descriptive and basic inferential statistics to understand usage behaviors, and generate and test hypotheses.
A proven track record to apply and integrate descriptive, and basic predictive analyses to develop strategic and operational insights for HR and organization-wide decision-making (e.g., DEI, organizational and team effectiveness, and talent analytics).
Support enterprise survey platform, craft and deploy surveys, advise users and report and interpret results.
Experience using appropriate statistical techniques to mitigate bias, interpret statistical significance and establish sufficient sample size.
Storytelling with Data
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with experience distilling and presenting complex data analyses and insights to large and small, technical and non-technical, audiences.
Provide consultation to partners within the DEI Center of Excellence, HR and the executive leadership team, and leading cross-functional teams to address business issues with data-driven insights.
Critical Thinking & Leadership Behaviors
The process of actively and thoughtfully conceptualizing, applying, analyzing, synthesizing, and evaluating information from multiple sources and perspectives to reach an answer or conclusion.
Ability to grasp DEI concepts, navigate ambiguity, apply prudent judgment, and implement proactively with multiple partners across various levels of the organization.
Position Reports to: Senior Manager, People Analytics
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in quantitative Social or Physical Science, Statistics, Data Analytics, Mathematics or Computer Science or commensurate experience
7+ years of experience in people analytics or other relevant sector with exposure to people/HR data or other sensitive data types
Proficiency in a variety of analytical platforms, software languages and statistical tools:
Microsoft Office suite of products
Data warehouse and management tools (e.g. Azure, SQL, AWS, Redshift),
Data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau),
Data preparation and manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx, Python, Databricks),
Enterprise survey platform administration and utilization (e.g. Qualtrics, UKG, Culture Amp, Glint),
Multivariate statistical platforms and/or languages (R, SAS, Stata, SPSS).Must be able to legally work in the country where this position is located without visa sponsorship.
**The foundation requires a COVID-19 vaccination for in-person business in the United States. Therefore, all U.S. employees are required to present proof of vaccination status upon hire unless they qualify for a medical or religious exemption.

At PitchBook we work to provide global professionals with comprehensive data on the entire venture capital, private equity and M&A landscape so they can discover and execute opportunities with confidence. We credit our success and rapid growth to our cutting-edge products, customer centered attitude and ability to embrace and drive change.

In just over a decade, PitchBook has reached over 1,300 global employees with offices worldwide, and we’re not slowing down! Consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work, our culture is at the heart of our success and is driven by excellence, inclusion and fun. At PitchBook we’re committed to fostering an open and collaborative work environment.

About the Role:
PitchBook Product Managers work collaboratively with key stakeholders and project teams to deliver value to customers. This role actively influences product roadmap, feature prioritization and user experience. PitchBook Product Managers establish project goals, measure business impact and identify additional opportunities of success for the PitchBook Platform.


This role would be focused on the platform market intelligence experience. The role will own key features and datasets that help investors and strategic decision makers discover, analyze, and monitor what’s going on in their industry.

As a product manager working on the PitchBook Platform, you will build exciting solutions that deliver value to our constantly growing user base. We are looking for a Product Manager to drive the roadmap for one of our key growth areas – Market Intelligence.


You will have a unique opportunity to create the tools and experiences our clients use to understand the latest activity and events in the markets that matter to them. You will work closely with designers, developers and other teams across PitchBook to build experiences that enable our clients to easily turn PitchBook private and public market data into invaluable insights.

Primary Job Responsibilities:
Validate client needs, pain points, and business opportunities through ongoing user and market research
Become a SME in the product area, including understanding user needs and workflows
Passionately data driven and willing to get messy with data analysis.
Actively influence product roadmap prioritization and create business cases for new opportunities
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders and project teams to execute your product roadmap
Create detailed functional specifications from prioritized requirements.
Communicate requirements and project details to stakeholders, including engineering teams
Continuously improve our external and internal deliverables and operational processes
Establish project goals, measure your business impact, and identify additional opportunities for success
Present to stakeholders on product functionality and vision
Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested
Develop vision for features like Alerts, Similar Companies, and Company News

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, or related field
1+ years of software product management experience
Bias for action. Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do what is necessary to meet team goals
Experience gathering customer-centric requirements
Superior attention to detail including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong audience awareness
Thrive in ambiguous situations, motivated by the opportunity to work with teams to define a clear course of action
Eager to become an expert on private and public capital markets
Experience working with ML teams is a plus
Experience building alerting systems a plus
If you are ready to start the conversation about how you might contribute to all the happenings at PitchBook, submit your resume today! PitchBook appreciates and respects diversity, and as such, we are an equal opportunity employer.
