Using technology to address some of the greatest challenges facing humanity. This is what the AI for Good Research Lab at Microsoft does. We work on AI for good, sustainability and climate change, misinformation and the erosion of democracy, crimes against vulnerable populations, cybersecurity, and disaster response. These are some of the programs at Microsoft where we want you to apply your world-class expertise.
Come to work every day knowing you are working on projects that help save lives, alleviate suffering and restore human dignity. Use the power of technology and AI to promote human rights, increase accessibility for those with disabilities, and seek solutions to climate change. These are ambitious aims, but with access to our technology, resources, global scale, and genuine commitment to using the power of AI and technology for good, they are achievable. We call this AI for Good, and we will empower our partners across the globe with our research, platforms and technology.
Researchers and Data Scientists have a fantastic opportunity to join the AI for Good Research Lab that is led by Microsoft’s Chief Data Scientist. You get to work at the cutting edge of data science, with some of the brightest minds in the field, whilst knowing that you are generating solutions to some of the most demanding and defining challenges of our time. These newly created roles will report to the Senior Director of Data Science, and work closely with teams across Microsoft to deliver world class solutions to some of the world’s most pressing problems.
Responsibilities
Create machine learning solutions, including artificial intelligence, for a diverse set of problems.
Employ structured approaches to leveraging large data sets to uncover new insights.
Work closely with data analysts, data engineers, business and project stakeholders and incorporate their expertise into your data science solutions.
Drive acquisition of new data sources as needed with governance on license, terms of use, compliance, quality, and high availability.
Represent our capabilities and product offerings to internal and external leadership audiences, both technical and non-technical.
Advance the research agenda for AI For Good initiatives: Prepare technical papers and presentations, and publish them internally and externally. Our research philosophy encourages knowledge sharing so you will contribute to the AI for good research community by publishing papers, collaborating with leading academic institutions and speaking and participating at leading industry events.

Qualifications
Required Experience:
Master’s in a quantitative field. Ph.D. preferred.
At least 4 years of experience in delivering insights and capabilities through data science, AI or machine learning techniques. E.g., neural networks for NLP, computer vision, etc., random forests and other supervised methods, clustering, PCA, etc.
At least 4 years of experience with a numerical programming language such as Python/Numpy/Scipy, C#, or similar.
Familiarity with SQL.
Research or strong experience in computational aspects of one or more of the following, or highly related, areas preferred: Bayesian modeling, causal inference methods, finite mixture models, generalized linear models, joint modeling, nonlinear mixed models.
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-dimensionality from varying sources to solve difficult problems. Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
Experience framing and participating in data-driven business decisions, including measuring and evaluating outcomes. Excellent oral and written communication skills. The ability to translate data science to non-technical people at all levels.
Working as part of a team, with proven ability to build trusted relationships. Demonstrated ability to work efficiently, prioritize workflow, and meet demanding deadlines.
Preferred Experience:
Experience with Tensorflow, PyTorch.
Experience with cloud-based architectures such as Azure or AWS

About the company and the team
In Mixed Reality, people —not devices—are at the center of everything we do. Our tech moves beyond screens and pixels, creating a new reality aimed at bringing us closer together—whether that’s scientists “meeting” on the surface of a virtual Mars or some yet undreamt-of possibility. To get there, we’re incorporating groundbreaking technologies, from the revolutionary Holographic Processing Unit to computer vision, machine learning, human-computer interaction, and more.
We’re growing a team of talented engineers, program managers and designers putting technology on a human path across all Mixed Reality devices. Our team has people from a wide variety of backgrounds, identities, previous work histories, life experiences, and we are eager to maintain and grow that diversity. Our varied backgrounds and unique experiences enable us to be better at building the best solutions for our customers and make for dynamic and joyful collaborations with colleagues!
If you are passionate about groundbreaking Mixed Reality technology and want to work on a team dedicated to a culture of inclusion, growth mindset and collaboration, we need you!
About the role
Microsoft’s Mixed Reality Design & UX Research team is looking for an Employee Experience Designer who is passionate about working at the forefront of innovative employee experience, empowerment, and retention. Our work is motivated by our company mission to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more. As part of our team, you will help to define and inform compelling new ways for how we can empower and delight people operations in Mixed Reality. With a focus on crafting new employee onboarding, to scaffolding creative retention efforts, this position will require human centered design thinking and the ability to tailor programs to the unique ecosystem of people on this team. This individual will need to be insights-driven, iterative, and requires competencies in communication and chartering employee experience roadmaps.
As an Employee Experience Designer, you will apply design thinking and contextual inquiry to architect tools for employees. You will be responsible for helping to drive clarity and satisfaction in the employee journey and culture in our Mixed Reality team. With your innovative work you will help to lay the foundation for a thriving ecosystem, build an experience blueprint, and tools to guide the employee journey from onboarding and beyond. You will closely work with Designers, Researchers, Engineers, and Product Managers across the organization to define the strategy for your programs from the early stages of planning, piloting, and implementation. This requires creative collaboration, strong communication skills, strategic planning, implementation skills, and the ability to negotiate solutions in relation to our business goals. In close collaboration with our HR team, our D&I community, and our Design UX Research team, we will persist in asking questions to better understand how we can serve our employees.
This team supports our employees in all locations around the country. This job has the option to be remote or located in one of our hubs.
Responsibilities
Drive employee onboarding and programs for touchpoints along the first-year experience
Closely collaborate with Human Resources and Diversity & Inclusion efforts on shared strategies for people operations
Develop a comprehensive career development initiative for teams and roles
Identify opportunities for increased support and scaffolding of employee resource groups and networks in business
Deliver impactful programs that result in increased recruitment and retention of diverse employees.
Create and implement programs that foster a sense of belonging and inclusion
Communicate strategies, insights and opportunities in clear, concise, and compelling ways that resonate across teams
Collaborate with other teams to leverage and synthesize previous work to provide new insights
Apply established onboarding guidelines and create new innovative programs
Identify priorities based on data inquiry processes and build a strategic roadmap to help inform next steps for human experience design on the team
Be a positive and creative force in the team
Qualifications
Required:
Master’s degree (or equivalent practical experience) in Human Centered Design, Social Sciences, or a related field
5+ years or relevant experience in an enterprise, design consultancy, agency, or other environment where you’ve worked on multidisciplinary design teams with similar accountabilities to DesignOps
Demonstrated experience in developing community-based programs and scaffolding programs that result in retention and employee success
Excellent skills in program management and strategic planning
Proficiency and demonstrated professional experience with written and verbal communication and facilitation
Familiarity with managing complex project schedules and nurturing cross-group collaboration
Proven track record for articulating the implications of data in clear, concise and compelling ways, translating them into actionable recommendations and insights
Excellent team player supporting others as well as showcasing excellent problem solving and project management skills to organize and drive work by yourself within tight timelines
Preferred:
Experienced in matrixed systems improving outcomes for historically marginalized communities
Strong analysis of diversity, equity, inclusion, and allyship
Great sense of human-centered design and ability to synthesize complex problems and innovate solutions
Experience collaborating with multidisciplinary teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers, and Project Managers throughout the development and design process
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects at the same time
Experience aligning or influencing design thinking with teams working in other geographies
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage multiple projects that require fast iteration and pivoting
Track record of cutting through ambiguity to generate results.

The Service Engineer is responsible for the troubleshooting and repair of specific Cadwell products. Also provides technical phone support to customers and vendors in resolving hardware and software issues, as well as pricing. Products are Class I and II medical devices, therefore meeting quality and productivity standards is an essential requirement of the position.
This position is located on-site at company headquarters in Kennewick, WA.
Key Duties / Responsibilities:
Troubleshoot and perform repair operations on all Cadwell products, completing work independently and in a timely manner
Provide technical telephone support to customers and vendors regarding specific Cadwell systems and applications
Follow established technical and administrative policies and procedures, including pricing
Provide technical guidance and training within Service team
Provide 24/7 application phone support, as applicable as part of rotating phone coverage
Maintain work area, tools, and equipment in a clean and orderly condition, and follow prescribed safety procedures and regulations
Complete required documentation and paperwork
Perform other duties as requested, directed, or assigned
Education / Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field required
2+ years of experience in equipment service, electronics repair, or related experience preferred
Job Knowledge / Requirements:
Familiar with electronics fundamentals, including: resistor, capacitor, and other electronic components; soldering; component removal and replacement; schematics and other electronic documentation
Familiar with computer hardware architecture (e.g. hard drive, mother board, operating system, replacing components); and with software drivers, (e.g. interface with host pc, connect device with laptop/pc to drive the device); Dell certification a plus
Computer skills: MS Office and Google applications, query tools, and database systems and applications
Good oral and written communication skills, including receiving, understanding, following and explaining oral and written instructions, technical information, procedures and schematics
Complete work both independently and as an effective member of the team, adapting to changing requirements, deadlines, and priorities as needed
Interact with others with a professional and solutions-oriented approach, including technical phone support with co-workers and customers
Must develop and maintain knowledge of Cadwell product lines and how they are used by clinicians, and be able to effectively troubleshoot computer hardware/software issues; Must successfully complete training requirements
Physical Requirements / Working Conditions:
Positions working with Cadwell equipment generally may require some reaching, bending, stooping, squatting, crawling, kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting and carrying up to 50 pounds, finger dexterity, repetitive motions, standing, walking, sitting, hearing, visual acuity, color vision, and 2-way written/verbal communication. More specific details may be provided as needed or requested.
Use of computer and various hand and electronic tools
Work outside normal business hours required to meet business needs, including part of rotation for phone technical support

At AWS, we want to be able to identify every need of a customer across all AWS services before they have to tell us about it, and then find and seamlessly connect them to the most appropriate resolution for their need, eventually fulfilling the vision of a self-healing cloud. We are looking for Machine Learning Scientists / Applied Scientists / ML Scientists with unfettered curiosity and drive to help build “best in the world” support experience that customers will love!

You will have an opportunity to lead, invent, and design tech that will directly impact every customer across all AWS services. We are building industry-leading technology that cuts across a wide range of ML techniques from Natural Language Processing to Deep Learning. You will be a key driver in taking something from an idea to an experiment to a prototype and finally to a live production system.

We are a newly formed team, and we pack a punch with principal level engineering, science, product, and leadership talent. We have started building the brightest science team and you have the opportunity to lead and establish a culture for the big things to come. We combine the culture of a startup, the innovation and creativity of a R&D Lab, the work-life balance of a mature organization, and technical challenges at the scale of AWS. We offer a playground of opportunities for builders to build, have fun, and make history!

ML Scientist / Applied Scientist

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Deliver real world production systems at AWS scale.
Work closely with the business to understand the problem space, identify the opportunities and formulate the problems.
Use machine learning, data mining, statistical techniques and others to create actionable, meaningful, and scalable solutions for the business problems.
Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of data and derive useful insights.
Work with software engineering teams to deliver production systems with your ML models
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation

We are working to achieve our business goals by deriving insights from a wealth of datasets like the AWS service metrics and logs, chat and call audio logs, email transcripts, support agent and support case data, customers context and sentiment, and AWS knowledge articles, tools and workflows.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


PhD with specialization in machine learning/deep learning
Experience or working knowledge of NLP and deep learning
Strong verbal and written communication with experience presenting complex technical information to technical and non-technical audiences
The ability to invent, a track record of thought leadership and contributions that have advanced the field.

JobTitle: Sr. Manager, Software Dev, FBA Restock Optimization
Content_text:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
10+ years of software industry experience working in software development
5+ years of managing software teams, including all aspects of people development and team building.
Experience owning the full product lifecycle from product definition and roadmap through delivery.
Highly motivated self-starter with bias for innovative thinking
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent business judgement

Job summary
Are you interested in building a world-class recommendations system for a $100B+ annual revenue business that is growing more than 50% YoY? Are you interested in driving engineering, product and science innovations that help Amazon manage the most complex fulfillment network in the world?

Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) is an Amazon service for our sellers, and the basic concept is "Sellers sell it, Amazon ships it". FBA enables Sellers to leverage our world-class fulfillment network and facilities to provide Amazon customers with unparalleled selection and pricing. FBA generates over half of Amazon's sales. 2 million Sellers in 14 countries list their products for sale on the Amazon Marketplace.

The Fulfillment By Amazon (FBA) – Inventory Optimization (FIO) organization is focused on driving free cash flow by automating and optimizing our fulfillment supply chain for third-party sellers. We are looking to hire an experienced Sr. SDM to lead our FBA Restock Optimization (FRO) team. Our systems are built entirely in-house, and are on the cutting edge for automating large-scale business, inventory and supply chain planning and optimization. We are on the forefront of supply chain thought leadership and work with some of the best research scientists and software developers in the industry.

The Restock Optimization team has the mission to educate and influence 3rd party (FBA) sellers’ replenishment decisions to maintain optimal inventory levels in Amazon’s FCs. To achieve this mission the team provides restock recommendations and builds mechanisms to prevent excess inventory shipments when our FCs are capacity constrained. These are high impact, high profile products with CEO-level visibility.

As the leader for the team, you will manage multiple technical teams to drive the long-term vision and architecture for our optimization model pipelines, seller-facing applications and high-performance services. You will work with SDMs and PEs/Sr. SDEs on your team, Directors/VPs, Product Managers, Partner teams, Scientists and other stakeholders to drive the long-term vision and roadmap for our products. You will set the team's technical vision and implement processes to help your team deliver on key business and tech goals. As a people manager, you will develop, retain and promote talented leaders. You will define processes and mechanisms to establish your team's culture.


Experience building highly scalable data science systems.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Experience communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Senior Software Engineer
Seattle, WA or Ogden, Utah - Remote/Hybrid
Freeus is the leading wholesale provider of mobile medical alerts and personal safety systems, serving more than 600,000 subscribers. Our devices work both inside the home and away, offering peace of mind to seniors and their caregivers. We are currently expanding into the lone worker and remote patient monitoring sectors and are looking for someone who wants to become an expert in helping save lives across these verticals.

Our Seattle division builds innovative iPhone, Apple Watch, Android, and web apps. We’re looking for versatile, full-stack software engineers that can thrive in a startup-like environment.
In addition to a competitive salary, Freeus offers:
Award-winning Medical, vision, and dental benefits
Competitive 401(k) retirement plan with generous company match
Generous PTO
Company-paid Life and AD&D insurance
Short-term and long-term disability benefits
Work-from-home flexibility to work fully remote or in a hybrid model (1-2 days in office preferred, but very flexible)
A FUN team, collaborative atmosphere, company parties, work-life balance, flexibility, and more!
Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, and maintain software
Decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward approaches
Contribute to defining how we build the product including architecture, technical designs, system reliability, availability, performance, and quality
Influence the engineering culture to strive for a clean architecture, sound engineering practices and growth mindset
Mentor team members

Skills Needed:
8+ years of professional software development experience preferred
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent preferred
Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, Swift, Kotlin, or C# including object-oriented design
Experience architecting and designing both client software and cloud native applications
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Be self-directed and able to self-manage

About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies.

With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin, Toutiao, Helo and Resso, ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.

We focus on conducting cutting-edge research and development in the area of Computer Graphics, Computer Vision, Augmented Reality and Deep Learning, and continuously transfer innovative technologies to various ByteDance products. We are looking for talents at all levels to join us on this exciting journey!

Investigate, prototype and implement solutions to achieve the highest quality graphics possible in ByteDance products.
Participate in cutting-edge research and development of novel computer graphics technologies.
MS/Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or related technical field
Professional coding experience in C/C++ and solid software engineering background
Good knowledge with 3D math, geometry, and other graphics-related technologies
Experience with at least one of the graphics APIs (OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Metal, Vulkan, DX11/12)

Preferred qualifications:

Experience with development of graphics rendering engine/game engine
Experience with GPU computing (OpenGL Compute, Metal Compute, CUDA, etc.) and GPU optimization
Experience in one or more areas of computer graphics, including but not limited to:
Rendering
Modeling and geometry processing
Physically-based simulation
3D reconstruction
Light field capture and rendering
Material and lighting estimation
Human capture and modeling (face, hand & full-body)
Human performance capture
Character animation
Neural rendering
3D deep learning
Image and video manipulation

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

ByteDance is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@bytedance.com.

At Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) our mission is to give people the tools to feel connected anytime, anywhere. We create new, category-defining consumer hardware and software - such as Oculus Quest, Portal, and Spark AR - that are immersive, social, and increase the depth of people's connections. Our team is a diverse group of problem solvers, inventors, and proven visionaries who are relentless about transforming everyday occurrences into rich experiences that have the potential to improve the way billions of people live. We're seeking experienced Infrastructure software engineers to join our teams in FRL. Join us!


Drive the team's goals and technical direction to pursue opportunities that make your larger organization more efficient
Effectively communicate complex features and systems in detail
Understand industry & company-wide trends to help assess & develop new technologies
Partner & collaborate with organization leaders to help improve the level of performance of the team & organization
Identify new opportunities for the larger organization & influence the appropriate people for staffing/prioritizing these new ideas
Understand the goals, strategy, and engineering bottlenecks of the organization
Advocate for higher product quality and engineering efficiency


Experience leading projects with industry-wide impact
Experience communicating and working across functions to drive solutions
Experience in mentoring/influencing senior engineers across organizations
Proven track record of planning multi-year roadmap in which shorter-term projects ladder to the long-term vision
Experience in driving large cross-functional/industry-wide engineering efforts
12+ years of programming experience
12+ years of experience with building large-scale applications, or similar experience


BS degree in Computer Science or related field
Experience building backend services or platforms
Experience building AR/VR products or infra from ideation to shipping
Experience shipping products to millions of customers or have started a new line of product

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The Business Analyst joining our team will be very comfortable in handling large amounts of structured and unstructured data. Working in close partnership and collaboration with team members and key senior stakeholders across Industry Solutions and Microsoft to design and create Sales Models, PowerBI Dashboards, Blueprints, and ad-hoc reports. Exploring and identifying patterns and insights in the data. Turning these insights into compelling Sales Model and Blueprint business cases to influence and drive the Sales and GTM team in their Strategic Pursuits.
Responsibilities
We are looking for a Business Analyst who will own the following core responsibilities:
Define the business requirements for BI and reporting for the Sales and GTM team, factoring in the data and insight needs of our LT, executive leadership, and business group stakeholders
Design and build analytical models working alongside a strong team of Leads, Analysts, Architects to monitor sales model, pipeline, and blueprint performance in alignment with the strategic roadmap for Microsoft Industry Solutions
Participate in yearly Sales Model planning involving account targeting, seller productivity, headcount and blueprint, and coverage model development and management
Partner closely with internal Sales and GTM teams to design and maintain a BI dashboard that track sales model performance, seller resource mapping, and blueprint related KPIs for example - sales model landing insights.
Take complex data sets and create and design reports for the leadership team to provide business insights and patterns in the data
Act as an evangelist and catalyst for BI & Analytics innovation in Sales and GTM and the broader Industry Solutions Organization
Provide and maintain governance on Sales Model account data and align with business group stakeholders
Provide leadership team with ad hoc reports based on business needs
Qualifications
Required:
3+ years’ experience and a proven track record as a business analyst, data analyst, management consultant, business planner (or similar roles)
Preferred:
5+ years’ professional experience in the high-tech industry or learning industry
Previous experience navigating large matrixed organizations a strong plus
The successful candidate will demonstrate passion and skills aligned with business insights, data analysis, and data visualization
Business Intelligence professional with experience in computer science or related field
The candidate should be able to work under compressed deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment that demands flexibility, high quality, and creativity.
Effective cross-team collaboration is essential to align multiple stakeholder teams to a common vision. More specifically, the candidate will meet the following qualifications:
Effective analytical skills to synthesize multiple complex data sets into easy to consume and actionable business insights
Demonstrated expertise in cross team collaboration across multiple stakeholder groups to deliver relevant reporting and data insights
Attention to detail and the ability to drive clarity in ambiguous situations
Strong oral and written communication skills and executive presence
Strong design sense along with experience in Power BI and advanced Excel (VBA) skills

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. JobTitle: Senior Product Manager - ERP and Shopping Cart Integrations
Content_text:
Flexe solves the hardest omnichannel logistics problems for the world’s largest retailers and brands. Integrating technology, open logistics networks, and elastic economic models allows Flexe customers to move fast, at scale, and with precision. Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Seattle, Flexe brings deep logistics expertise and enterprise-grade technology to deliver innovative eCommerce fulfillment, retail distribution, same-day delivery, and network capacity programs to the Fortune 500. Flexe is transforming the $1.6T logistics industry. For more information, please visit flexe.com
As a Senior Product Manager in our enterprise resource planning (ERP) and shopping cart integrations space, you will utilize your technical expertise and product sense to help build the platform that will define the industry standard for integrations. In this role, you will be spear-heading user research to uncover customer pain-points and strategic business opportunities. On top of this, you will lead a team of engineers and partner with our operations and commercial teams to deliver a complex roadmap of both product and process solutions. Your work will be a crucial part of unlocking FLEXE growth and top-line revenue.
Responsibilities:
Develop a product vision, strategy, and roadmap for the FLEXE ERP and shopping cart integrations platform.
Define what success looks like using meaningful and innovative methods of measurement
Partner closely with engineering, marketing, sales, and operations to execute your product vision
Spearhead user research efforts focused at understanding both internal and external customers
Become a domain expert in both the FLEXE platform as well as the landscape for logistics solutions
Requirements:
5+ years of experience as a Product Manager or Technical Program Manager
3+ years of experience working on ERP integrations, including EDI and API implementations
2+ years experience working on shopping cart integrations (e.g. Shopify)
Experience incorporating user feedback and business strategy to craft long term product strategy and vision
Track-record of building trust with key stakeholders to align multiple teams and deliver on strategic initiatives
Proven experience transforming multiple solutions into a cohesive platform
Strong technical background with a degree in computer science or similar field
Bonus: Past experience as an engineer or engineering manager
#LI-Remote
Benefits:
The benefits package at Flexe is thoughtfully designed to help people lead healthy lives in and outside of work.
Health benefits for individual:-Dental and vision are covered 100%-Medical is covered 100% for HSA or a tiny premium for PPO.401k Matching ProgramInternet Stipend, while we're 100% work from home$300 Work from home office reimbursement20 days of PTO

Paid Parental Leave & Bereavement LeavePaid Volunteer TimeIndustry learning initiatives with talks, demos, site visits. Etc.
Working at Flexe:
Here are a few perks that make day to day work at Flexe even more enjoyable:
Choice of MacBook or PC and monitor setup, and height adjustable standing deskLocated in historic Pioneer Square; restaurants, bars, shops, and mass transit hubPhilanthroFLEXE program. A quarterly program where we give back to the community through volunteer work, fundraising drives, etc.

About the Role

The Technical Support Representative position is a perfect blend of customer care and tech support. You'll be providing technical support and troubleshooting for our two main categories of users:

Our church/non-profit partners.
The end-users that are giving/donating to our partners.

channels:

About Pushpay

Pushpay helps organizations and communities come to gather & stay connected, strengthening community, connection, and belonging through our suite of mobile apps, management software, and giving technology. Our 400 Pushpay teammates support 10,000+ customers as they drive social good. In the 2021 financial year we were honored to process US $6.9 billion in charitable giving. We're growing fast, including an exciting acquisition in 2021, and we need driven and teachable talent. Join Pushpay and grow with us.

Our commitment to great customer service extends to our pledge to care for our team members. Our 7-year track record of organizational success and consistent, measured growth gives us confidence in our ability to sustain continued success well into the future.

amaze and delight clients and interact/connect with a wide range of personalities
explain complicated concepts in a simplified form
creatively customize solutions to exceed customer expectations

JobTitle: Senior Mgr Quality Engineering, Playback Quality
Content_text:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of technical education and experience.
Effective at being able to think both strategically and tactically with strong attention to detail.
Strong people management skills, with a proven ability to hire and grow talented personnel.
7+ years of experience managing teams of 20+ people, program management, and delivering cross functional projects working with tech and non-tech teams.
Experience defining program requirements and using data/metrics to determine improvements.
Experience in distributed systems design and testing.

Job summary
Come build the future of entertainment with us. Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching? We want to make Prime Video the most loved video service worldwide. Do you want to be an instrumental part of our journey?

Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows from Originals and Exclusive content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at any time and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.

Key job responsibilities
As the head of quality engineering, you will be ultimately responsible for the quality of new experiences launched to our customers, enable our growing scale and complexity, and will be instrumental in increasing our software development velocity. You will understand the big picture from both business and technical perspectives to shape and execute the quality strategy. The successful candidate will be obsessed with quality improvement, have an established background in setting product, technical, and architectural vision. In this role, you will:

Work with business and software development teams to understand product vision and requirements.
Develop an understanding of how all elements of the software ecosystem, customer experience, and operations work together to develop quality assurance approaches that fit the overall strategy.
Define quality metrics and drive cross organizational improvement programs.
Oversee the development and execution of test plans, and monitoring and reporting on test execution.
Develop and execute the strategy for automated end-to-end validation. Drive programmatic focus to integrating these into critical Playback development pipelines.
Lead a team of software engineers and quality engineer to ensure the highest quality product delivery.
Own and operational physical test lab environments.
Advanced degree in Computer Science or related field with 9+ years of relevant experience.
Comfortable communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings.
Thinks big, has vision and is a vocal leader and can communicate on that vision to team members.
Experience with designing tools and frameworks.
Deep understanding of system architecture and experience with large complex distributed transactional systems. Experience with performance and scalability testing, latency testing a plus.
Experience working closely with development and business teams to communicate problem impacts and to understand business requirements
Proven track record to creating and executing on highly effective quality processes. Has experience and conviction around measures to quantify software quality.

JobTitle: Manager, Technical Program Management - Inventory Management
Content_text:
Job Description
Manager, Technical Program Management – Inventory Management
At Nordstrom, we strive to provide the most relevant assortment in our Nordstrom stores, Nordstrom Rack and Online. Forecasting customer trends and distributing Inventory to the right place at the right time is how we, the Inventory Management team, connect to our customers and keep them coming back for more!
Nordstrom Technology is looking for a Manager, Technical Program Management for the Inventory Management Technology team. Our team is responsible for delivering technology solutions supporting our inventory position, which is the company’s single largest asset and the biggest lever of gross margin. How efficiently we manage inventory has a direct impact on the company’s bottom line. Our team is uniquely positioned to have a significant impact on company results and support the overall company experience. This role works with Product Management and the core leadership team to create and maintain a product delivery roadmap. This person needs an agile mentality to work with our cross functional tech and business teams. The Manager, Technical Program Management will be a key member of our leadership team and will support a team of Technical Program Managers. The ideal candidate will have hands-on project and program management experience as well as experience leading and implementing Agile practices.
We’re undergoing a technology revolution, transforming traditional retail to delight our customers worldwide. Your impact will be felt by many millions of people who rely on Nordstrom to feel and look great.
If you want freedom to drive your own career and make an impact in people’s lives all the while getting unmatched support from a company like no other, we’d love to talk to you. Finally, in this group we emphasize teamwork, work and play as one, succeed or fail together. If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet.
A day in the life…
Manage and support a team that delivers programs of high impact, risk and complexity while building and executing integrated plans across multiple teams
Hire diversified, capable, and motivated talent/teams that can deliver swiftly and predictably, adjusting in an agile fashion to deliver solutions aligned with business needs
End to end ownership of multiple cross-functional projects, including product definition, roadmap planning, resource planning and project execution
Collaborate with Product Management, the business and other technology teams across the organization to identify and prioritize solutions and build a roadmap that can be delivered
Manage risks, assumptions, dependencies, and timelines
Work with engineering to ensure speed and quality of delivery and manage resource planning
Own direct communication with leadership team and stakeholders
Be a technical problem solver on the team, identifying innovative solutions to project deadlocks and resolving issues and constraints through consensus and sound judgment
Responsible for making project decisions, achieving tactical goals while retaining a strategic focus
Identify valuable analytics for improved team performance
Coach and mentor your team as well as your peers across the wider organization
On occasion, step in to fill the role of an individual contributor on smaller projects or when a team member is unavailable
You own this if you have…
5+ years of experience delivering complex software solutions as a Technical Program Manager
2+ years technical leadership or managing/developing teams preferred
A 4-year degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical discipline is preferred but not required
Technology background, especially in a hybrid cloud-based architecture with a deep understanding of software development, passion for data and analytics
Proven track record of leading large cross-functional agile software projects
Ability to roll up sleeves and operate as an individual contributor to get the job done; at the same time, be able to guide a team toward an objective
Both business and technical acumen, including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions
Strong customer and stakeholder empathy. You must be not only the voice of the customer. You must be able to channel many points of view, synthesize them and drive alignment even in times of friction and disagreement.
How we work
With others. We have remote collaboration tools where our teams work together collectively to build out technical solutions.
With transparency. We encourage open dialog and discourse. We don’t encourage silos.
With agility. We don’t believe in following a process for process’s sake. We ship frequently and focus on delivering incremental value.
With open minds. We are committed to building a diverse team of people with unique perspectives. This encourages a healthy and inclusive environment that builds a more sustainable, successful company.
With pride. We value our people most of all. We invest in ourselves by applying our own strengths and interests to the company.
*** This position requires you to be in a hub location. If you are already located in one of our hubs (Seattle, Atlanta, Chicago, Denver, or Los Angeles), you can work from that location. However, if you are located elsewhere, you must be open to relocating to Seattle or one of our hubs once employees return to the office.
#LIAM1
Pay Range: $135,400-$203,200 (This range may vary for candidates hired to work in locations other than Colorado).
We’ve got you covered…
Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:
Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability
Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources
A few more important points...
The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.
Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.
Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.
Nordstrom Careers Privacy Policy: https://careers.nordstrom.com/#/contact-us/privacy
© 2021 Nordstrom, Inc.
Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.

Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and paper driver logs were common. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.
We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. We’ve also been backed by world-class investors, including Google, YCombinator, Fidelity, Greylock Generation, Lone Pine, T. Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. We are proud to have been named a CNBC Disruptor 50 Winner (3x), a Fast Company World Changing Idea, a LinkedIn Top Startup, a Forbes' Best Startup Employer, one of Fortune Magazine's 'Impact 20' list, a best place to work in Washington State, a BloombergNEF Pioneer winner, and more.
This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help us transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste.


You will:
Measure the impact of product launches using experimental and quasi-experimental methods (A/B testing, causal inference, statistical modeling)
Discover new opportunities and shape product/business strategies through data-centric approaches
Maintain, monitor, and debug production models/decisions systems
Develop metrics to measure system performance and business impact
We’re looking for someone who has:
Minimum of 2-7+ years of industry experience in Data Science
Strong programming skills (Python and R preferred). Proficient with statistical data analysis and modeling
Ability to break down high level business problems into concrete analytical solutions
Strong written and verbal communication and keen attention to detail
Nice to Haves:
Advanced degree in economics, statistics, computer science, operations research, engineering, a natural science or equivalent quantitative subject
Experience in SQL and ETL pipeline
Strong examples of your outputs influencing product or engineering road-maps


Benefits:
Employees' wellbeing is top of mind for the Convoy team. Outside of offering excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits, we also offer the following:
On demand mental and emotional health benefits through LyraOn demand primary care through 98.6Generous paid time offPaid parental leave programFertility benefit solutions via Progyny
Child-care and adult/elder-care options through Bright HorizonsOpportunity to join and contribute to one of our Employee Resource GroupsAbility to make a real world impact!
Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.Content Ecosystem is critical to TikTok's user experience, where people watch short-form videos from the vast content pool. This role reports to our TikTok Frontend team, who build end-to-end solutions to improve quantity, quality, and diversity of TikTok's content pool.As a backend engineer of Content Ecosystem working on our Frontend team, you will be responsible for building data pipelines and APIs to interact with business critical data. As a backend engineer at TikTok, you will:1. Work closely with product managers and frontend engineers to deliver key features;2. Implement service to handle very high QPS, with security in mind;3. Improve system design and architecture to ensure high stability and performance of the services;4. Learn and understand how TikTok product works and help build end-to-end solutions;5. Learn and grow from working with great colleagues and taking on challenges;6. Help our team grow from your expertise, experience, and perspectives.Qualifications:1. BA/BS Degree in Computer Science or related major, 2+ years of industry experience in a software development environment;2. Strong knowledge of data structures and algorithms, proficient in at least one coding language, including but not limited to Go, Java, Python, C++, Javascript, TypeScript;3. Curiosity towards new technology and outstanding ability to analyze and solve problems;4. Good grasp of software engineering and how to build a system in scalable and extensive manner;5. Understanding of concurrency, database, and message queue is a plus;6. Experience in the Big Data technologies is a plus.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $94,901.00 - $192,951.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistanceReferral programRelocation assistanceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:JavaScript: 1 year (Required)Angular: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

With nearly $2 billion in bookings of experiences, the Peek.com platform combines powerful business software with an award-winning marketplace for consumers to book fun things to do like wine tours, watersports, skydiving, art classes, and more.
The Peek Pro software suite provides world-class online booking, point-of-sale, and hundreds of automation tools such as inventory management, dynamic pricing, waivers, and marketing analytics. Thousands of operators like the Museum of Ice Cream, Artechouse, and Pennekamp State Park have grown their business and automated their operations with our technology.
Peek follows a “remote-first” philosophy, with our team of over 150 Peeksters distributed across exciting locales such as San Francisco, Salt Lake City, New York, Seattle, Chile, Colombia and beyond.
PS: Peek just made the 2021 Forbes America's Best Startups Employer list!
The Role:
Want to work on interesting technical problems around booking management and payments? Peek is looking for a Sr Fullstack engineer, the ideal candidate has 5+ years of development experience with Javascript and/or functional programming language. Our frontend app is built on top of ember.js and we use Elixir on the backend. In this role, you will have the opportunity to take a lot of ownership and learn new technologies.
Our engineering group works on several different products and systems: our Peek Pro operations management suite, embeddable scheduling & booking widgets, B2B and B2C sales and support tools, and custom development services for our enterprise customers.
See details about Peek’s tech stack here.
We work collaboratively, move fast, and value technical quality. If you are excited about the challenge of building an incredible product while working alongside a great engineering team, we’d love to hear from you!
Our team is 100% remote, however, we prefer candidates in the same time zones as the greater United States (UTC-10 to UTC-4). English is our business language, and fluency is required.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with Product Management and Design to build top-notch user experiences while focusing on code quality and maintaining codebase and system health
Act as a mentor to fellow software engineers, through code reviews, design document critiques, and brainstorms throughout the software development process
Taking ownership of features built from development through release to production
Communicating bug and feature testing implications to the QA team
Communicate effectively and participate with team members in an Agile environment
Advocating for a consistent and delightful customer experience
Deliver production-quality code with adequate automated test coverage
Requirements:
5+ years of professional development using Javascript and/or Elixir.
Solid coding practices including peer code reviews, unit testing, continuous integration, TDD, etc
Exposure to unit and/or integration test frameworks
Bonus points for people who have experience with:
Working with GraphQL APIs
Working with Ember.js/Absinthe
Working with functional programming language
Working on B2B software or in the travel industry
Taking ownership and working on a small but mighty team
Personal Attributes:
Strong interpersonal communication skills: we work collaboratively to solve problems, and value team success over individual achievement. We love working with people who can ask hard questions, offer unusual solutions, and are willing to compromise when solving challenging problems on a deadline.
Comfortable working remotely: we are 100% remote, and rely on Slack, email, Signal, and Zoom to stay connected.
Well organized and self-motivated: we work in a fast-paced environment, our teams are growing, and our priorities shift on a quarterly basis as we move into new markets.
Advocate for self-care while managing a high workload: we want you to show up as your best self, and to speak up for what you need to stay healthy and engaged.


Benefits:
Stock options with a standard 4-year vesting schedule
Medical, dental, vision, and other voluntary insurance
 401k with 50% matching up to 6% vested over 3-years
10 days of accrued PTO +16 holiday paid days, which includes the holiday shut-down during the weeks of Christmas and New Year
8 weeks parental paid leave for the birthing parent and 2 weeks for secondary caregiver
$50 WFH allowance to enhance your internet and/or connectivity
Annual "Peekiversary" gifts
Physical/Mental Requirements
Work on a computer an average of six hours per day
Extended periods of concentration
Ability to speak in front of groups of people via Zoom
Frequent communication (Internal – 90%; External – 10%) (written / verbal)
Sitting or standing for extended periods of time

Join Our Team: Do Meaningful Work and Improve People’s Lives

Our purpose, to improve customers’ lives by making healthcare work better, is far from ordinary. And so are our employees. Working at Premera means you have the opportunity to drive real change by transforming healthcare.

To better serve our customers, we’re creating a culture that promotes employee growth, collaborative innovation, and inspired leadership. We are committed to creating an environment where employees can do their best work and where best-in-class talent comes, stays, and thrives!
COVID-19 Vaccination Policy:
On September 9 2021, President Joe Biden issued an executive order requiring the vaccination of employees at federal contractors. Premera Blue Cross, as a health plan within the federal employee benefits program, is designated as a federal contractor. Premera has implemented a new requirement for all employees, including telecommuters, to either show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19 or have an approved medical or religious accommodation (based on a disability/medical condition or sincerely held religious belief), by January 1, 2022. From the onset of the pandemic, Premera has remained committed to the health and well-being of our employees, customers and communities.
As a new employee you will be required to show proof of being fully vaccinated within your first five days of employment or request an accommodation prior to your start date.
The Actuary Analyst I will join the Healthcare Economics (HCE) Actuarial team to support actuarial analyses such as but not limited to insurance pricing, provider contracting, financial reporting, and reserving. Activities include fewer complex data extraction, analytical model maintenance, preparation of rate and provider reimbursement studies and other statistical analyses, as well as production of various reports and limited technical support to assist in the achievement of company financial and membership goals.
NOTE: HYBRID ROLE; 3 DAYS IN OFFICE & 2 DAYS WORK FROM HOME
What You’ll Do:
Provide data and perform actuarial calculations, under the guidance of more senior analysts, related to product development, benefits, provider reimbursement, stop loss, health management, disease management, pharmacy programs, premium rates, reserves, and administrative costs.
Monitor data from internal departments, review it for content and accuracy, and identify associated problems.
Produce existing and some new analytical reports that monitor utilization and cost trends, revenue, claims liability, membership, administrative costs, and provider reimbursement and performance as requested by both internal and external customers.
Utilize and maintain computer programs to support existing and some new analyses, processes and reports. Consider reproducibility and potential improvements.
Complete assigned, less complex projects accurately and efficiently, within preset timelines, and regularly report status to supervisor and project manager.
Prepare written documentation on all projects to provide a peer review trail and ensure continuity and integrity of position responsibilities. This includes organizing the project work plan, notes, output, proof of review and other documentation.
Complete special projects or other duties as assigned.
What You’ll Bring:
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, actuarial science, statistics, computer science or related field or four (4) years’ work experience. (Required)
Experience in health insurance and/or actuarial department.
Knowledge of health insurance concepts and terms.
Knowledge of SQL and other data querying tools.
Commitment to participate in the Actuarial student program.
Previous actuarial experience.
Knowledge of computer programming language and aptitude to learn from others. Proficient with standard Microsoft Office products, such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc.
Strong analytic, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to take direction well.
What we offer
Medical, vision and dental coverage
Life and disability insurance
Retirement programs (401K employer match and pension plan)
Wellness incentives, onsite services, a discount program and more
Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate degrees
Generous Paid Time Off to reenergize
Free parking

Projects range from new constructions of heavy industrial facilities to maintenance and repair of historical, brownfield sites. Work scopes are primarily in electrical testing, install, start up, maintenance, and troubleshooting of low, medium, and high voltage power delivery equipment. Degree in Literature, Technical Writing, Computer Science, or a related field
Minimum of 5 years in a technical writing role
Experience writing for a developer or IT operations (DevOps) audience
Experience writing code or automation scripts as part of published documentation
Experience working on multiple documentation projects simultaneously with competing priorities and deadlines

Now’s your chance to have a lasting impact on the most widely used internal products at Amazon! Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a talented and driven Programmer Writer (PW) to help us innovate and create documentation for our existing and new products. PWs work closely with Product Management, Engineering, Leaders, and our Customers(!) to develop a vision for documentation and manage cross-team collaboration to deliver amazing solutions our customers love.

To be successful in this role, you can prioritize well, communicate effectively, and have a consistent track record of delivery. You are proactive in removing roadblocks, pave the way for innovation, and can handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. You will be a positive influencer across diverse teams, be able to effectively rally support for your initiatives, and be able to help teams create documentation solutions to meet goals.

What you will do:

Write, improve, and test customer-facing technical documentation.
As an integral part of our team, produce high-quality documentation including conceptual, how-to, and API reference documentation.
Gather, analyze, and respond to customer feedback and data.
Reorganize and update current documentation based on your expertise and customer feedback.
Work with product management, support, and engineering teams to prioritize work items.
Define writing projects and drive documentation planning.

About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with web services
Experience with an object-oriented programming language
Experience with an automation scripting framework such as bash shell scripting, Windows batch scripting, or Windows PowerShell
Experience with command-line tools

Our Opportunity:

Chewy is growing at a rapid pace. Our approach of thinking about our customers first and ability to move fast has created a large opportunity to rethink and redesign our supply chain optimization frameworks from ground up. If the opportunity to create a best in class supply chain network, make a large business impact, and deliver large scale savings intrigue you, we will want to talk to you.

Chewy’s Supply Chain Research and Planning team is looking for Head of engineering for Supply Chain Replenishment systems, and lead our efforts in building the next generation of replenishment systems for all of the products and services sold on Chewy.com.

What you'll do:

The successful candidate is one who thrives in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment, has a strong understanding of core software development, algorithmic concepts and is comfortable working in a hybrid technical/science team. The candidate is passionate about solving real business problems using cutting-edge technology. You will develop a team culture that encourages innovation and expect developers and management alike to take high degrees of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture and project delivery. Responsibilities include direct management and recruitment of software engineers and managers, improvements in process and quality of service, strategic planning, project management, and management of resources across teams.

In addition, a candidate will be skilled at anticipating bottlenecks, providing escalation management, balancing business needs with technical constraints, and taking calculated risks to maximize business benefit. They will be able to focus heavily on cross functional communication to ensure key decisions and status surrounding projects are clear to all. Successful candidates should not only be passionate about delivering extensible, on-time solutions, but should also be obsessed with contributing to the development of high-performance teams through rigorous goal-setting, disciplined attention to performance metrics, continuous process improvement and mentorship.

What you'll need:

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent
5+ years of experience leading a software and/or analytics development team through full development life cycle.
10+ years of software development experience.
A passion for people management and mentorship.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience attracting, hiring, and maintaining top talent
Experience with leading a ML/ science focused product.
Track record of developing engineers through various career stages and building high-performance teams

Bonus:

Experience or passion for supply chain
Experience in developing highly scalable, fault tolerant systems in a fast pace environment
Demonstrated ability to balance the high standards and long term solves with the need to move fast
Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.


If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact HR at chewy dot com

JobTitle: SDE - Alexa Shopping Grocery and Consumables
Content_text:
Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
Bachelor's degree in computer science related fields OR 1+ years equivalent experience in software development
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
Computer Science fundamentals in data structures
Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as C, C++, Objective C, or Java

Job summary
The Grocery Shopping Team, a team within Alexa Voice Shopping, enables customers to build baskets of grocery and consumable items using voice across device and formats. The convenience of shopping for groceries by voice, midstream of other activities, will bring a new level of convenience that will change how people shop for groceries and consumables.
Our vision is to enable a voice grocery experience that wows customers with its simplicity and convenience and creates long term highly engaged device owners and Amazon grocery shoppers. Customers will ask Alexa to buy grocery items and be delighted when she knows their favorite items, schedules deliveries, reminds them of items they may have forgotten, and helps them manage their household grocery needs.

We are seeking talented and experienced Software Development Engineers to design and develop conversational shopping experiences and algorithms. You'll have the freedom (and encouragement) to experiment, improve, invent, and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will have an impact on Amazon's new devices and the way shopping is done in the area of IoT. And finally you will have the satisfaction of being able to look back and say you were a key contributor to something special from its earliest stages.


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
Computer Science fundamentals in data structures
Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as C, C++, Objective C, or Java

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

The technology support shall include assistance to staff and students at assigned district site(s), resolving technical problems, coordinating repairs and installing new computers or peripherals. The requirements listed below are representative of the requirements that would enable an individual to perform at appropriate levels. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to meet the required responsibilities.1. Technical training in Windows PC and Chromebook troubleshooting and repair. Associates degree in information systems, computer science, electronics or related field desirable, or two years work experience in a related field.2. Understanding of basic technical network concepts and troubleshooting with devices (e.g. power, network, peripherals, wired, wireless).3. Understanding of Windows Active Directory and Google user management (i.e. create, change, password resets, security group assignments).4. Proficiency with Microsoft Office (e.g. Word, Excel, Powerpoint) and Google Workspace forEducation (e.g. Docs, Sheets, Slides, Drive).5. Demonstrated ability to assist staff in the use of various technical tools, address their concerns and coordinate school building technology.8. Established ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.10. Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with students, staff, and the community.11.
